story:
Theme Song

Motion Comic!

Logline

An animated Hip Hop/Afrofuturistic adult satirical comedy series that parodies anime, cartoons, video games, geek culture, and life as a young adult.

Synopsis

JumpBeat City, a futuristic society on earth, where everything looks and seems otherworldly—but basically all of the same crappy social issues still exist. When identical twins Yeze and Tule accidentally become the subjects of a freak lab experiment, they gain the powers to transform into the mecha robotic suit Funkadelic and the magical girl BangBang.

Through story tropes and character archetypes that anime is known for (including the obnoxiously long title), combined with a unique animation style and a bitingly dry comedic and satirical tone, SSBB will magnify and deconstruct some of the most ridiculous and hilarious socio-historical and political aspects imbedded in their (and consequently our) society.

Short Summary

Well first of all-- we're all gigantic geeks. Manga, Anime, comics, video games, cosplay, programming; you name it, between the three of us, we geek out about it. 

But we're also creatives, intellectuals, children of immigrants, and story lovers. Often though, these worlds rarely coincide. Where are all the syfy and fantasy shows, with smart, compelling storylines, and relatable characters-- that truly reflected the world that we live in? 

These questions, these desires, are what sparked the idea and propelled the creation of SSBB. We've put our hearts and our souls into this project-- but we need Y'ALL. Our greater team, our community, to take this to another level. We'll need your amazing support and every good vibe you can muster to truly bring the world of SSBB to life.  

What We Need & What You Get

A lot of time, effort, and funds go into animation. Your contributions will help us reach these goals!

$10,000- We will produce a fully animated trailer showcasing what you can expect to experience in the world of SSBB! We will also develop more dope and diverse character art to fill out our world!

Stretch Goals!

$50,000- We will produce a fully animated, 10 minute proof of concept episode to include in our pitch package to networks and studios! We will also develop more dope and diverse character art to fill out our world!

$100,000- We will produce TWO fully animated, 10 minute episodes as well as more dope and diverse character art to fill out our world!

Meet the Team

Writer/Director: Adamma Ebo. Nigerian-American from Atlanta, GA currently pursuing her MFA in Directing at UCLA. She'll also cross you up in NBA Street Vol. 2 

Executive Producer: Adanne Ebo. Funny enough she's also Nigerian-American from Atlanta, GA. A graduate from Northwestern Law, she currently works at WME-IMG. She owns every Tekken game ever created and will throw hands with Steve Fox.

Producer: Marcel Pérez. Latinx-American from Miami, FL. He currently attends improv classes at the Upright Citizens Brigade Training Center. He hopes Kingdom Hearts 3 will be released in 2018 but knows it'll be the 22nd century before it drops.

story:
Short Summary

For years people have been telling me how funny my stories are.  "Oh my gosh, that could only happen to you, Gretchen!"  "You're making that up, right?"

Nope.  I'm not making this stuff up.  I have a good sense of humor about the things that happen to me.  You have to have a good sense of humor when you leave your hometown in the Midwest and move to New York City at the age of 18.  It needs to be even stronger when you decide to move to Hollywood.

I love making people laugh.  I remember being in acting class in New York, and the teacher told me I had a natural ability for comedy.  In our showcase at the end of the semester, I got such a rush when the audience laughed.  I knew I had found my true calling.

I have finally decided to put these life experiences to good use, and to spread a little love and laughter in the world.  So I've written a web series called "#mylifeisajoke". Life is too short to not laugh at yourself.  If you can't laugh at yourself, you can at least laugh at me.  Don't worry...I'm laughing too.

As much as I love a live audience, with the Internet I will be able to reach a wider audience. One minute at a time, I can spread laughter and cheer around the world.

In order to pull this off, I need a little financial help.  Locations need to be rented, crew needs to be paid, insurance purchased, and promotional materials developed.  My goal is to raise $6,000 as a jumping off point for the first several episodes.  I'm not asking for much from you, except maybe pass up a latte one morning and donate towards spreading laughter and cheer in the world.

In an effort to spread love as well as laughter, 5% of all funds raised, even if the goal is not met, will be donated to St. Jude Children's Hospital.  St. Jude's ensures that any child with cancer will receive treatment free of charge.

I thank you in advance for helping me achieve this dream.  Because who doesn't want to watch me reenact horrible dates and gym mishaps?  I just can't make this stuff up....

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
MEET THE CAST:

Eric Francis - Logan                              Sugey Cruz - Janus               

Rory Nobel - Lacy                                   Morgan MacNaughton - Charli      

 

 Ally Batot - Tami                                     John O'Donnell - Rad 

  

Mackenzie Maula - Iris

MEET THE CREW:

Rick Hansberry - Creator / Producer / Writer / Director of Clean Slate series

Rick brings more than 20 years of industry experience with several produced shorts and feature-length films. Rick’s award-winning films and screenplays have entertained and inspired audiences worldwide. This is Rick’s first web series - a challenge he readily accepts. "As the landscape of the way we watch entertainment changes, we must adapt with it.” 

Gary Howell - Executive Producer and Writer

Bethany Parmer - Production Assistant and Logistics Coordinator

Cassandra Storm - On Set Photographer

Haley Ross - Social Media Strategist and Web Designer    

     

Casey Grim - Stylist and Makeup Artist

 Dave Emlet - Production Assistant

Todd Bailey - Producer, Director of Photography and Editor

Ryan Valotta - Theme Song Writer and Composer

Brad Norris - Writer and Production Assistant 

Jase Gibbons - Grip and Production Assistant 

MORE INFORMATION:

Asking for a monetary donation is not something easy to do, nor do we make this ask lightly, so know that before you hit the donate button, we want to thank you for your generous support of this project. You are the reason Clean Slate is happening!

It should go without saying that filmmaking is expensive, so to be able to bring on board the people and locations that will make Clean Slate a reality, we need some help. 

YOUR DONATION WILL GO TOWARDS:

Crew and Equipment – We could shoot this on an iPhone, but it would look and sound exactly how you would expect.  We need professional cameras, lighting and sound to make this series the best it can be.

Location Rentals – We’re doing our best to get locations donated for free, but the reality is that this can’t always be the case.  We’ll have to pay for site usage at times in order to fully tell our story.

Actors Salary – These aren’t student actors trying to get a reel together!  These are professional actors who work hard and spend a lot of time becoming the characters you see on screen.  It’s time-intensive and we need to provide them something for their time. 

Food for Cast and Crew - A well-fed cast and crew makes for a happy and alert team that performs at their best during long days of filming.

Editing and Color – This, too, should be professionally done, and not edited on an iPhone!

Music – One of the important aspects of Clean Slate is the creative artists that play a role in our series. We have a talented musician who is helping craft our theme music and score and we think you’re going to love what you hear!  

HOW ELSE CAN YOU HELP? 

  • If you're unable to donate at this time for whatever reason, but still want to help support Clean Slate, here's a few ways how you can help!
  • Send the link to this campaign to your friends and family or share on your Facebook, Twitter or Instagram page!  
  • Donate in-kind goods or services, such as props for our sets, or provide food or drinks for our cast and crew for our filming days
  • Visit our web page – you can make a small donation in the future through our PayPal link
  • Watch Season 1!  Watch it over-and-over again, and get your friends and family to watch to get our view counts up!  This helps with exposure and future support!

story:
More Porsche -- More Fun!

The 900 Series debuted on MotorTrend TV on April 6, 2020 and aired weekly through the end of June. It was the first real episodic car show dedicated completely to Porsche vehicles. Season #1 just wrapped, but we are eagerly preparing for season #2.

Fans contacted us with all types of feedback, but the most popular request was for us to expand the show from a half-hour to an hour-long show and asked how they could get involved.

So, we've listened and are launched this Indiegogo campaign for season #2 to let fans get more involved in the show, help us expand the show into a full hour, and help us cover more Porsche races and events around the country!

Be an Insider with Special Perks!

We've heard from a lot of fans since the show began and the feedback we've received the most is folks wanting us to expand into an hour-long show, and for us to cover more Porsche events around the country.

So, we are offering you the opportunity to become an insider of the show with limited edition swag and opportunities to get involved in the show itself while helping us stretch out budget to expand the show in season #2, which would be used to cover additional production expense for the expanded show, and it would provide the funds to cover travel expenses for the talent and crew to film Porsche events all over the country.

Our Fans Make the Difference

While The 900 Series team and the production team produce the show on a modest budget, it does take a lot of time and equipment to do it right. So, expanding the show and highlighting more Porsche clubs and enthusiasts will increase the cost of production.

As the only recurring, Porsche-exclusive car show on being produced (that we know of anyway), we want to bring our fans the highest quality and the most fun, showing them different cars, celebrities that love Porsche, and coverage of Porsche events around the country.

Your support will be the difference in making those things happen!

Other Ways To Participate

We realize that times are tough given the pandemic of 2020, so we understand if your wallet does not allow you to what your heart wants to do, so there are other ways you can help:

  • Share the link to this Indiegogo campaign with your friends on social media
  • Share the social media links of the show to your social media friends
  • Spread the word about the show with your friends and your PCA region
  • Let our sponsors know you saw their name or logo in the show when you shop with them

We are excited to get started on season #2 and hope to count you among our insiders who help us make it happen!

story:
Captain Tall Tale's Adventure Club

Teaching how to adventure safely in the world. 

The foundation of the club is to change the world for the better by empowering the next generation with the tools it takes to succeed. 

We focus on foundation, how to help guide the youth to be well-rounded adults by the time they turn eighteen. 

The program is great for any age and can set strong foundations in adults that would like to learn how to become grounded in a mindset that sets themselves for success. 

Each lesson is between one to five minutes. 

It's recommended to watch one lesson a day (five days a week)  though adventurers can view as many a day as they desire.  There is a mission at the end of most lessons so it's good to focus and finish a mission before moving on to the next lesson. 

How is our teaching different?

Captain Tall Tale's Adventure Clubs' teaching method is focused on practicality, teaching youth what happens in the real world and how to navigate the world by still being moral, just, and caring. 

The list of starting programs are: 

-Step Into Adventure: Foundation learning, morals, leadership, speaking up for self, animal ambassadorship, confidence, morals, culture, health, and much more. 

Family Fun Times Adventure: The program is made to create family togetherness and to build a solid support system within the family. 

The Three Steps to Health: The habits of health are the best tools to succeed. The program teaches Nutrition, Excercise, and Stress Management. 

Animal Ambassadorship: The most caring humans on the planet take care of others and that includes animal companions. The program teaches how to give a voice to animals. 

The Future is Yours: The program teaches the future generation how to build the world they want to live in. The foundation focus of the program teaches culture and how to appreciate other cultures. 

Storytime: An added bonus to being a member of the club is hearing Captain Tall Tale tell stories. Featuring the four-part series that tells the story of "How Captain Tall Tale Became Tall." Included are many more original stories such as: How the Cow Trained to Jump Over the Moon, Big Bad Joins the Circus, What I'll Miss the Most, Jack Trials, Meet Mr. Yeah!!, and many many more fantastic stories. 

There will be many more programs added, those are just the first to set in motion to change the world for the better. 

 

Captain Tall Tale's Adventure Club needs your help to be successful. Your contribution helps make the program successful and for us to continue to make great programs enriching the world we live in. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

The funds will go directly into filming costs including filming editing, puppets making (yes puppets!!!), and for keeping the website safe and secure.

Funds will also go towards building an app for ease of use. (The app will take four to six months to build, in the meantime the website will be the main source of viewing)

When funded the program will be available in October. (If the Indiegogo is not funded the release date will be pushed back as it will take more time to make, so make sure to share and get the program funded)

If the campaign does not reach its goal the programs will still be produced and offered on the Captain Tall Tale website however, it will take more time and the quality of the episodes will be impacted, sorry no puppets. This project is our life's mission and we will make sure the programs are made, with or without funding. Note,  the more money received the more programs we will be able to offer and the more marketing we can do to spread the great content throughout the world.   So please help us spread the word. 

 

The cost of the program will be $60 a year, that's $5 a month. Giving access to all educational and entertaining programs on the website. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

It's totally understandable if you can't contribute monetarily. We do ask one thing of everyone to help, please use your social media, word of mouth, tag celebrities, tag the news, if you know someone that can help please inform them that Captain Tall Tale's Adventure Club is here to change the world for the better but it needs as much help as it can get. To help others we ourselves need help. 

Visit the Captain Tall Tale website to see more of what we have to offer. www.CaptainTallTale.com

If you have any question, comments of concerns email me: info@CaptainTallTale.com

Thanks and adventure on!

If the campaign does not reach its goal the programs will still be produced and offered on the Captain Tall Tale website however, it will take more time and the quality of the episodes will be impacted, sorry no puppets. This project is our life's mission and we will make sure the programs are made, with or without funding. Note,  the more money received the more programs we will be able to offer and the more marketing we can do to spread the great content throughout the world.   So please help us spread the word. 
 
The cost of the program will be $60 a year, that's $5 a month. Giving access to all educational and entertaining programs on the website. 
 
Other Ways You Can Help
It's totally understandable if you can't contribute monetarily. We do ask one thing of everyone to help, please use your social media, word of mouth, tag celebrities, tag the news, if you know someone that can help please inform them that Captain Tall Tale's Adventure Club is here to change the world for the better but it needs as much help as it can get. To help others we ourselves need help. 
Visit the Captain Tall Tale website to see more of what we have to offer. www.CaptainTallTale.com
If you have any question, comments of concerns email me: info@CaptainTallTale.com
Thanks and adventure on!

story:
Mafia Dads Story!

This is a funny short film about 2 ladies who have overbearing fathers who are constantly ragging on them to get married and stop partying. The problem is these ladies just can't seem to settle down, they live for their social lives and never want to get married! After a huge house party with some crazy stuff going on, the  Dads decide enough is enough and they go to extreme lengths to get them married, you won't believe what these Dads do to their daughters to get what they want! It's hilarious with tons of funny actors and scenes!

Where will my donation go?

$450 to finish paying  off the Cinematographer 
$150 to finish paying off the 1st AD
$400 to pay off the Make Up artists
$150 to finish paying off the sound person
$500 for the Editor


What are we trying to do here?

This story was written to entertain you, sometimes you just need to laugh and you may not have time to watch a full feature film so we are here to give you a burst of laugher and entertainment in 15 min! 

The additional benefit of getting this film produced is that it will help fellow artists reach greater heights in their careers. A well shot film is helpful to everyone involved as they can use it for their demo reels and get exposure allowing them to be hired on other productions.

Why is this a short film instead of a feature film?

While short films don't generally bring in income, they are necessary for filmmakers to get hired on bigger productions and for actors to be seen in order to book the bigger and better roles.  Also they are great for audiences who just want to spend 10-15 of their day being entertained without the commitment of watching a full length film or a TV series.

What we created here is a funny story with a few twists and turns to entertain the audience while allowing everyone who participated to benefit from it.

This film could easily turn into a feature film, the writer has ideas on how to achieve that, so with your help, we would be 1/4 of the way finished with a feature film!

What do you get for helping?

We will get this into festivals and then onto Amazon Prime and other online platforms.  When we have the Red Carpet release you will be invited to attend and depending on your contribution levels you will get even more exciting PERKS!

MEET THE CAST!

Deanna Rashell as Scarlett & Scarlett's Dad   https://www.imdb.com/name/nm9428665/?ref_=nv_sr_1

Bula Barua as Ruchi & Ruchi's Dad   https://www.imdb.com/name/nm7931537/?ref_=tt_cl_t7

Justin David as Austin  https://www.imdb.com/name/nm8303358/?ref_=tt_cl_t3

Laith Wallschleger  as Titus   https://www.imdb.com/name/nm9875427/?ref_=tt_cl_t6

Chozy Rani Ayub as Lemi  https://www.imdb.com/name/nm4709456/?ref_=tt_cl_t5

Emi Mastey as Katie  https://www.imdb.com/name/nm5700028/?ref_=tt_cl_t8

Jennifer Janae as Sondra   https://www.facebook.com/jenniferjanae.tom

Kevin Saunders as Ken https://www.facebook.com/kevin.n.saunders

MEET THE CREW!

Director:  Deanna Rashell

Writer: Deanna Rashell

Producer: Deanna Rashell

Executive Producers: Bula Barua & Deanna Rashell

Cinematographer: Reddy Manojh

1st AD: Chicken Green

Sound: Harper Harris & Diego Delfino

Production Assistants:

Margaret Lisi, Brian Droche, Alex Nesbit, Michaela Nesbit, Johnny Nesbit

Script Supervisor: Carlie Raymond

MUA's:  Adrienne & Alexis

story:
Hey!  Welcome to the early development of my first episodic TV series, and newest project Running Laps.  Being that you've made it through the pitch and further down the page without getting bored, I take it you're down for some dirty details.

About the Author

I'm Madelyn Shaffer, and I'm an actor, director, writer, and visual artist based in New York City.  In the last year I'm proud to have joined the Board of Directors at SheNYC Arts (shenycarts.org), and accept a fellowship with the 2017 Artist As Citizen Conference at The Juilliard School.  In August, I directed new play and finalist selection The Holes in Human Flesh in the OOB Samuel French Festival, and in January, I directed new play A Girl Smiles in the Arctic in the Secret Theatre's Off Broadway Short Play Festival, sweeping the festival awards with Best Play, Best Director, Best Actress, and Best  Actor.  After these happy career moments, I'm thrilled to spend my next two months in a secluded Pennsylvania lake house, focusing solely on the writing and development of my next big milestone.

So, What's So Great About It?

Running Laps will be presented as a full-length series with 8 episodes per Season, running about 35 to 40 minutes each.  Here is why I think this heartfelt, hilarious, if not shocking series will garner the attention of the big streaming networks:

  • The narrative of an exotic dancer has never been offered to the mainstream audience from her own perspective.  She has never been more than set dressing or the butt (pun intended) of the joke, let alone anywhere near the focal point of the story.  It's time this tale takes a front seat, and through the vulnerable, human, and fiercely feminine lens that it warrants and deserves.
  • I think it's noteworthy and highly marketable that I'm writing the 1st Season of Running Laps in it's entirety, an endeavor that is typically taken on by a writing team after the success of the pilot.  Though I hope the show will adopt such a team in the future, bringing a full body of work to the table as a newcomer will help me earn the trust and interest of production industry professionals.
  • The world of the show is provocative, niche, and widely unexplored.  The atmosphere of Club Athena is something folks rarely stray from the moral high ground to enter, but will they enter it discretely from the comfort of their own home?  The answer is ABSOLUTELY.  Curiosity pressed 'Yes, I'm still watching,' on the cat's Netflix.  In fact, "niche" worlds are exactly the what streaming networks seek in selecting content, because that is where the most interesting stories live.

And How Does My Money Help You Get There?

At this leg of the race (See what I did there?  Lap running metaphor?  I've got layers, investors),  a bit of funding helps me to afford the time not only to complete the series, but begin the process of guiding it to a stable home.  I will be able to:

  • Submit the pitch to networks, production companies, and further funding entities.
  • Write proposals to state and non-profit film initiatives.
  • Staff, rehearse, rent space and equipment, and film the pilot episode, which is likely to be a necessary qualifier for certain routes to the green light.

Cue heart stopping, pyrotechnic, showgirl laden closing number!  My sincere thanks for your time and consideration.  I have high hopes for the laughter, opportunity, and conversation that I think Running Laps will spark, and I hope now, you do too.  

With Gratitude and Excitement,

Madelyn

story:
The Title Of The Show Is Bubbly Brown Sugar...

And as the name suggests, it’s about love, dreams and every succulent thing in between. But it’s so much more than a series about relationships and toe curling sex with smoking hot brown people. This is Serendipity meets How I Met Your Mother, magical like Amelie, quirky like Chewing Gum and a fairy tale like, Love Is.

This is a story about the journey of two soulmates destined to find one another in this lifetime.

Now, these two are not your average soulmates that are meeting in human form just to pass the time until the next incarnation. These two have been together since the beginning of time. Their souls have chosen to be reborn only to experience the delight and sheer thrill of finding one another over and over again for an eon.

But as evolved as their souls may be, the human part of them don’t have a clue about what they’re doing and are just trying to figure out this thing called life – just like everyone else on this bloody rock. But no matter how often they fall flat on their faces, it is only a matter of time before they stumble into each other’s arms. It is their destiny.

A Modern Fairy Tale...

I want to tell a modern fairy tale about a beautiful young woman and her one true love. They don’t have to battle evils in a mythical kingdom, but they each must ready themselves in their respective ways, before they can meet. So, what does that mean?

The lovers in our story must learn how to stop poking the poop that exists in their lives, so they can move on with it. We can all relate to that – and how hard that can  be. There’s just something so addicting about playing in our own crap. The tone of the show is melodramatic at times, with this quirky/raunchy humor, and a whole ton of love – hell this is a romantic dramedy after all.

Shattering Myths Around Black Love

I love love.  I love to watch holiday movies that have this air of magic and wonder weaved throughout the storyline. Out of the 50 Christmas movies I watched or saw promoted on TV last December, I  only recall seeing approximately 5 movies that starred black and brown people. Why is that?

Do black people care about love? Do they get married?

Of course we do, and it is important to see that represented on the screen.

There are a plethora of tv programs that suggest there are too few black men are available for marriage; a ton of black movies that showcase toxic and dysfunctional relationships; and let's not get started on the barrage of articles that perpetuate the unlikelihood for finding an elgibible mate for the single black female. 

Bubbly Brown Sugar is a series that affirms that a magical love story isn’t reserved for the likes of Barack and Michelle Obama and that a happily ever after is the norm for people of color.

The Spiritual And Religious 

There is a huge growing population of people that identify as spiritual but not religious. This can take so many different forms and is too broad to tackle in our series. Valuing the importance of connecting with a higher source, Bubbly Brown Sugar gives voice to those that were raised in the church and have an affinity for reading sacred texts, but also incorporate other spiritual practices to deepen their relationship with Source. When you see faith-based programming, it only paints one picture and leaves this audience out. Bubbly Brown Sugar gives voice to those that do not allow dogma to hinder their pursuit for God.

How The Funds Will Be Used

Nothing great can be accomplished alone and your contribution is a wonderful act of love that we cherish. Bubbly Brown Sugar started out as an idea that popped into Tamala's head while sitting in rush hour traffic, and less than a year later, she has been watering this seed everyday and now it is time to take it to the next level... and we need you to make that happen. 

We’ve already begun pre-production of the film including rewrites of the script and three table readings to nail down the story, auditions to book every character (everyone is cast!), and iron out the logistics like budget, locations, equipment, and insurance.

Everything you contribute will go towards production costs to create a first-rate series that you will be proud of.

Here’s the longer list of needs:

  • SAG day/rate for cast members because everyone deserves to receive compensation for their gifts and time. This is very important.
  • Production crew for the whole shoot (director of photography, camera operator, 1st assistant camera, 2nd assistant camera, gaffer, script supervisor, grip & electric)
  • Lighting, and sound equipment (Camera rental already provided by our DP)
  • Editing in post-production (color correction, composition, sound matching)
  • Music (custom songwriting and recording from RYDE Productions)
  • Art department (set design, costume design, graphic designer, hair & makeup stylist)
  • Craft services (a fancy phrase for FOOD)
  • Locations & permits (including two conference rooms, a dance studio, and two apartments for a majority of the scenes)
  • Insurance ($1,200 alone, we need it for permits and to be safe)
  • Marketing (submitting to film festivals and doing PR for the film costs money)

We’re shooting the film for ten days toward the end of October, and aiming for a post-production completion date of early 2019. In terms of risks and challenges, as with any ultra low-budget project  there may be unforeseen delays. No matter what, we promise to keep you updated throughout the process and let you know if we foresee any updates to our completion timeline.

Love is an EXCHANGE of energy and if you decide to love on us, it is a PLEASURE to send that energy right back. We spent so much time thinking of fun perks to show our appreciation and gratitude. As a backer of this series, you get some pretty dope Bubbly Brown Sugar SWAG!

Be the first to get your hands on a BBS mug, t-shirt, popsocket, calendar, or all of the above as a thank-you for your generous support!

Huge thanks to Jane Middle Art for the beautiful illustrations!

Our Sponsors

Over 25 businesses have already supported Bubbly Brown Sugar and we could not be more grateful! This means that they see the value in this platform and the need for it in the entertainment space. If you would like to learn more about sponsoring Bubbly Brown Sugar, please visit our website for more details. And to our sponsors, thank you for being down with Bubbly Brown Sugar!

Now that you know all about the story and the goal, let's talk about the brilliant artists behind this brainchild! Are you ready? 

Meet the Creative Team

We believe we can transform the way people see themselves and the world around them through media.  We are a group of filmmakers, writers, singers, actors, and artists that have assembled to bring this magical story to life.  Art can reflect life. It can also shape reality and we wish to promote images that magnify the ideal.

Tamala Baldwin: Executive Producer/Writer and Co-Director
Playing the role of Jewel
If you ever notice someone randomly breaking out into a happy dance around the streets of New York City with a huge twinkle in her eye and a gigantic smile across her face, chances are you have spotted Award-Winning Content Producer and Actress, Tamala Baldwin, MBA. Tamala is an International performing artist and author of Limitless in Possibilities. She has been cast by Broadway Directors like Richard Stafford, Paul Stancato and BT McNicholl for various theatrical productions. Theater credits include: Priscilla Queen of the Desert, Little Shop of Horrors, Hairspray, Dreamgirls and Sunshine Boys. She is currently in production for Asunder, a digital soap opera series, slated to be released on Amazon this winter and Curvy Girls Rock!  When Tamala is not performing, she is running her production company, Soul Kisses Productions that has afforded her the opportunity to work with Billboard Charting artists like 50 Cent, Mandy Moore, T-Pain and Lil Mama; with major record labels like Warner Brothers, Columbia, Universal and for mega brands such as Energizer, AARP, Photobucket, Myspace and Eventful.

Career Highlights Include:

  • Awarded a scholarship to the Julliard School of Music for the flute and a proud member of the Actors Equity Association.
  • A member of the Black National MBA Association, an organization dedicated to the development of partnerships that result in the creation of intellectual and economic wealth in the black community.
  • Serves on the board of directors for Suffolk County Women Enterprise Coalition. 
  • An award-winning content creator for her media platform, Soul Kisses TV, with appearances on network news, radio programs, business journals and in major metropolitan newspapers.

To learn more about Tamala visit her official site at www.tamalabaldwin.com 
IG: @tamalabaldwin

LaVarro Jones: Co-Director/Editor

LaVarro has over 19 years of work experience in film and television. LaVarro started his career at BET (Black Entertainment Television) working on various shows including, BET’s Black Carpet, The 5, Rip The Runway, and various promos and television specials.  As his career progressed LaVarro worked for other networks including VH1, Bravo, HGTV, History Channel, and Style Network. He edited various shows including, I Want To Work For Diddy, Kimora, Life in The Fab Lane, Amish Mafia, Breaking Amish, Mob Wives, Prank Academy and Situationships.  He currently edits “The number one show in late night, ball bags,” Viceland’s Desus and Mero.

In 2016 LaVarro formed Necessary Studios, with fellow creative, Kamau Martin.  Necessary Studios, is the place to go for all of your production needs.  Through his production company, LaVarro Productions, he has written directed and edited web series, short films, music and promotional videos. The company’s first web series,  “Love And Money,” won 4 best acting awards at the 2013 LA Web Fest.

Neena Bhanti: Producer

Neena Bhanti, a New York native, is an award-winning performing artist and producer.  She has also worked on numerous music video, film and television sets including: Law and Order (NBC), the Sopranos (HBO), Lipstick Jungle (NBC), Damages(FX), The Sorcerer’s Apprentice, Two Lovers, Kabhi Alvida Na Kehna, The Accidental Husband and many more. Most notably, Neena earned an MBA, which focused on film production. There she was the co-creator of an independent film, which screened in NYC.  While at the Cannes Film Festival, she networked with many international film producers and directors. At NYU, she earned a certification in film production and made 2 short films, which she wrote and directed. Her gift of storytelling and being personable also allowed her to be the top seller at The Public Theater’s campaign funding program. She worked with donors who contributed generously to many play productions including Stephen Adly Guirgis’, Little Flower of East Orange, which was directed by Philip Seymour Hoffman. Currently, Neena is the associate producer of a documentary about the foster care system. She is also the producer of Bubbly Brown Sugar, a new television/web series.  Her cinematic dreams include directing music videos, creating impactful films that promote inclusion and diversity, and producing educational documentaries.

Justin Benjamin: Music Supervisor

Justin Benjamin is a professional songwriter, producer, and mixing engineer located in New York, NY with two decades of experience producing R&B, Hip-Hop, and Pop music and mixing songs of all genres.  He regularly collaborates with award-winning singers, rappers and actors for film, theatre, and television projects, including Brandon Victor Dixon (Hamilton, Shuffle Along, Motown) and Malcolm Barrett (Timeless, The Hurt Locker, Better Off Ted).  Justin's formal music training includes classical Trumpet and a BA in Music Theory and Composition from Columbia University.

Justin steps into his work on Bubbly Brown Sugar with an eagerness to capture the passion and intensity of the project, and a great deal of excitement to expand his experience composing and directing music for the screen.

Key Members of the Production Team

Rachelle Le Blanc: Production Manager

Rachelle Le Blanc, also known as Shelly, is a 29 year old actress from Curaçao. In 2012 Shelly moved to the States to pursue a Masters degree in Business administration and after obtaining her degree she moved to New York to attend New York Film Academy and studied Acting for Film. Since her graduation from NYFA, Shelly’s acted in Student Films, webseries, produced and starred in a short movie “Worthy of Love”, which is in post production and obtained a Masters degree in Media Management. In 2017, Shelly was nominated Best Supporting Actress by the Urban Webseries Awards for her performance in Da Brooklyn Way. Shelly is looking forward to a successful career in acting and hopes to inspire others with her passion and talent. Fun fact: Shelly is fluent in 4 different languages. IG: @Inspiringactress_shellsz

Randall Holloway: Casting Associate

Randall Holloway is a proud native from Milwaukee, Wisconsin and an alumni from Howard University. From a young age, Holloway would memorize lines and impersonate characters from movies. He has studied with Marc John Jefferies, and is a proud member of One on One NYC. Some of his New York Off- Broadway credits include Tennessee Williams The Mutilated (Sailor), Annie Warbucks (Alvin T. Paterson) and Company (Peter). He is a certified producer with BRIC TV and is currently developing his own projects off the ground, filming two new series, and has independent films touring across the country. On the side Holloway is a On- Air personality for and Music Xclusive TV. Since being in New York he would like to thank his family and close friends who continue to support him while he pursues his entertainment endeavors IG: @itsrandallholloway

We Can't Forget About Our Awesome Interns!

We are so FORTUNATE to have thes dynamic young ladies helping to us to make this all come together. Meet Esther, Amiela and Kalyani! 

Now that you have a better understanding of the incredible souls that are working from behind the scenes, it's time to switch up the pace and introduce you to the INCREDIBLE cast that have come on board to bring this story to life. 

Meet The Cast

Nothing great can be accomplished alone and we are so excited to have these amazing actors on board! Learn more about the artists you are supporting with your contribution below: 

    Rich Lowe: Playing the Role of CALEB
    Rich Lowe is an American born actor, singer, song writer, producer dancer and director. In addition to Rich's notoriety as a singer/dancer, Rich began his professional acting career with a role in American Stage Theatre's production of Marco Ramirez's "The Royale". Followed by roles in indie feature films “Over There” and “V for Vindicator” as well as numerous other short films. Rich wrote, edited produced, directed as well as starred in the short film “The Least of All”; in which he portrayed 4 different characters. The short was awarded two awards for best short film in the festival circuit in 2017. IG: @RichLowe24

    Tyrone Reeves III: Plays the Role of JOSIAH
    Tyrone Nathaniel Reeves is an American actor born in Abington, Pennsylvania and raised in New Jersey. Tyrone didn't discover his passion for acting until his mid-20's. His very first acting gig was a stage play called, Don't Count Me Out. From the moment, Tyrone knew he wanted to be an actor and he hasn't looked back. Tyrone has starred in movies such as, Lord Put A Ring On It, Lord Keep A Ring On It, and can also be seen on the hit TVONE series, For My Man.  
    IG: @Tyrone.N.Reeves

    James Pierce III: Playing the Role of KWAME
    James A Pierce III is currently in the cast of Anastasia on Broadway. His Theatre Credits include The Lion King on Broadway, Little Dancer at the Kennedy Center and On The Town at Paper Mill Playhouse. He has had an extensive career in the performing arts. He's danced with Martha Graham, Ballet Met Columbus, Ballet Hispanico, Ailey 2 and Complexions dance companies. His television/film credits include Sissy Man, Love is a Broadway Hit, Collision(Vimeo), Once A Star (Vimeo), MTV's Decoded and SMASH (NBC) to name a few. You can follow him on Twitter and Instagram: James A Pierce III

    Jene: Playing the Role of Kimmi
    International Entertainer - Actress, Soul/R&B Artist-Songwriter, and Model - Jené has appeared throughout the world in Film, Television, Broadway, and Vocal Music. She is currently in production filming The Last Thing He Wanted - Directed by Dees Rees, starring Anne Hathaway. Credits include - FILM: Cash Flow, All The Little Things We Kill, Tio Papi; TELEVISION - Orange Is The New Black, Conviction, Jonny Zero, One Life To Live, The Mysteries Of Laura, the Law & Order franchise; THEATER: Broadway - Larry David's Fish In The Dark, RENT, Little Shop Of Horrors, Footloose, the original European and North American Tours of FAME. Jené holds great pride in living as a passionate, influential New Yorker, who is first and foremost, a Humanitarian. Most notably, she is a lifelong Advocate for the LGBTQ Community and LGBTQ Homeless Youth causes/foundations, as well as Anti-Bullying, with a focus on self esteem/wellness for young ladies. IG: @jenenyc

    David Crownson: Playing the Role of ZEKE
    Born and raised in the exotic state of NJ. David Crownson is an actor, writer and filmmaker who recently created the comic book series Harriet Tubman Demon Slayer.  He recently wrapped the horror feature "Fauna"  produced by Troma Productions. He's working on his next comic Nightmare In Newark & 12 Years A Slave & Zombies. IG: @Dcrownson

    Quincy Giles: Playing the role of Gabriel
    Quincy Giles was born in Indianapolis, IN. After graduating college as a student-athlete and working in Corporate Finance, Quincy transitioned his career to acting and modeling. Quincy aspires to use his platform as an actor and influencer to uplift and support people's belief in themselves to pursue their dreams. IG: @Quincy_Giles40

    Jacinth Headlam: Playing the Role of ANGELA
    Jacinth Headlam is a multi-award winning actress, model, and film producer. She won an award for Best Leading Actress at the Philadelphia Independent Film Awards 2017. Also she received the People's Choice Award at the 2016 Nafca African Oscar. She also won Best Leading Actress for her leading role in "Diary of a Badman" at the Caribbean Tales Film Festival in Toronto, Canada. Which is the first film she produced. She recently booked a principal role for on an Emmy Award winning television show, “A Crime to Remember”, directed by Christopher Dillion. Recently, she co-produced her first television pilot, “Illusions”, in which she is also playing one of the leading roles. She is a true definition of not relying on anyone for an opportunity. By producing her own films, she is not only creating opportunities for herself but most importantly for other to live out their dreams. IG: @ImJacinth

    Maria Tholl: Playing the Role of Meagan
    Maria Tholl is incredibly excited to be a part of Bubbly Brown Sugar!  Favorite credits include As You Like It and Pericles (Shakespeare Theatre of New Jersey); Merry Wives of Windsor (Hedgepig Ensemble Theatre); Infinitely Yours (Planet Connections Theatre Festival); Promises, Promises and Joseph and the Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat (Stages St. Louis); Dogg's Hamlet, Cahoot's Macbeth (St. Louis Shakespeare), and The Imaginary Theatre Company at the Repertory Theatre of St. Louis (Ensemble Member).  Vocal/dialect coaching: Conversations with my Father (New Jewish Theatre), Amadeus (The Repertory Theatre of St. Louis), and Othello (Great River Shakespeare Festival).  She is a proud graduate of the Webster Conservatory of Theatre Arts.  IG: @MariaTholl

    Cassagnole Leonidas Jr.: Playing the Role of Gregory
    Cassagnol Leonidas Jr. (GREGORY): is thrilled to make his TV debut, in “Bubbly Brown Sugar”. Born and raised in Brooklyn, NY where he’d watched his favorite sitcoms, such as, “Family Matters”, “The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air”, and “Martin”; amongst many others. He looks forward to bring laughs to viewers of this series, just as he experienced with 90s sitcoms. Leonidas Jr. recently returned from tour, performing with the Oxford Shakespeare Company, in Scotland, in the role of MacDuff, in “The Tragedy of MacBeth”. His Theater Credits include: Walter Lee Younger (Lead) in “A Raisin in the Sun” at his alma mater Five Towns College. Uncle Mose (Supporting) in “Emmett, Down in My Heart at Castillo Theatre, and Tiresias (Ensemble) in “NOMANSLAND”, where he toured in various cities with Subpoetics International in Ukraine, Slovenia, and Poland. Walter Bibb (Lead) in “Ain’t Never Been Easy” at Castillo Theatre. His Selected Film/TV credits include: Upscale Art Gallery Attendee (Background) in the Netflix Series, “She’s Gotta Have It” Season One directed by Spike Lee. Jermaine (Lead) in “Wet Dreams” - Short Film directed by Richard Joseph, and MAN (Lead) in “Elle” - Silent Short Film. Leonidas Jr. likes to thank Soul Kisses Productions and all that helped to make this possible. And is looking forward to working with cast and crew of “Bubbly Brown Sugar”. Visit: cassleojr.com for more details. Peace and Blessings to You! IG: @Cassleojr

    Reina Cedeno: Playing the role of Trinisha
    Elementary School started it all for Reina. She was in a performance art class from grades 4-6 and she remembers her teachers seeing something in her. After school,  she didn't get bit again by the acting bug until 2002 and that's when she auditioned for the movie "State Property." She didn't get the role but that didn't stop her. Reina later went to do an Off Broadway theatre project by the name of "Countdown" and she got to play along side Adepero Oduye. Other credits include "One 2 Four" Webseries, "The Ave" Webseries and her newest project "Random Acts of Flyness" on HBO. She got a chance to play a Hair stylist in one of the scenes. Show aired its first Episode on August 3rd. IG: Reinacedeno

    Sabrina Athena: Playing the Role of GIGI HERNANDEZ
    International model/actress/hostess Sabrina Athena has traveled the world gracing everything from the pages of magazines (Urban Ink) to television (BETs Rip the Runway) and movie screens (Sex and the City 2). Originally from Detroit and now residing in Brooklyn, Sabrina brings her dynamic and charismatic personality to the cast of Bubbling Brown Sugar. She enjoys teaching the art of meditation and practicing a yogaic lifestyle, spending time outside and enjoying nature, and creating delicious meals to enjoy with friends and family.
    IG: @Sabrina_Athena

     

    Other Ways You Can Help

    • Donate space! We are looking for incredible locations to shoot our series. If you have access to a cafe/restaurant, co-working space, conference rooms, two apartments, that you would like to allow us to use in-kind, please give us a shout!
    • Share this campaign with friends, family, and anyone passionate about supporting both the independent filmmakers and sustainable industries!

    • Sign up to receive email updates. 
    • Love this page or donate to receive crowdfunding updates.
    • Follow us on Facebook, Twitter & Instagram for more updates on our progress with the campaign as well as with the films progress. 

    YAYER BABY!

    Bubbly Brown Sugar is all about speaking what you want into existence. We want the world to know that there is so much beauty to be experienced here and we can create it if we learn how to use our inner forces. Soooooo.. with all of that being said, allow us to say WOOOOHOOOO and THANK YOU in advance for your delicious love, support and help! Your assistance affords us the opportunity to touch hearts, and illuminate minds through our story.  

    Your gift enables us to bring this vision to life! THANK YOU SO VERY MUCH!

    Everyone attached to this project has invested their hearts, minds and gifts to create a final product we can all be proud of. Thank you again for joining us in producing a series that not only feels good, but looks and sounds yummylicious!  

    Take a look at all of our incentives, give what cash you can share, and help us spread the word. Together we can make visual magic!

    With our deepest love, joy and gratitude!!

    Tamala Baldwin & Team Bubbly
story_txt:
The Title Of The Show Is Bubbly Brown Sugar...
And as the name suggests, it’s about love, dreams and every succulent thing in between. But it’s so much more than a series about relationships and toe curling sex with smoking hot brown people. This is Serendipity meets How I Met Your Mother, magical like Amelie, quirky like Chewing Gum and a fairy tale like, Love Is.
This is a story about the journey of two soulmates destined to find one another in this lifetime.
Now, these two are not your average soulmates that are meeting in human form just to pass the time until the next incarnation. These two have been together since the beginning of time. Their souls have chosen to be reborn only to experience the delight and sheer thrill of finding one another over and over again for an eon.
But as evolved as their souls may be, the human part of them don’t have a clue about what they’re doing and are just trying to figure out this thing called life – just like everyone else on this bloody rock. But no matter how often they fall flat on their faces, it is only a matter of time before they stumble into each other’s arms. It is their destiny.

A Modern Fairy Tale...
I want to tell a modern fairy tale about a beautiful young woman and her one true love. They don’t have to battle evils in a mythical kingdom, but they each must ready themselves in their respective ways, before they can meet. So, what does that mean?
The lovers in our story must learn how to stop poking the poop that exists in their lives, so they can move on with it. We can all relate to that – and how hard that can  be. There’s just something so addicting about playing in our own crap. The tone of the show is melodramatic at times, with this quirky/raunchy humor, and a whole ton of love – hell this is a romantic dramedy after all.

Shattering Myths Around Black Love
I love love.  I love to watch holiday movies that have this air of magic and wonder weaved throughout the storyline. Out of the 50 Christmas movies I watched or saw promoted on TV last December, I  only recall seeing approximately 5 movies that starred black and brown people. Why is that?
Do black people care about love? Do they get married?
Of course we do, and it is important to see that represented on the screen.
There are a plethora of tv programs that suggest there are too few black men are available for marriage; a ton of black movies that showcase toxic and dysfunctional relationships; and let's not get started on the barrage of articles that perpetuate the unlikelihood for finding an elgibible mate for the single black female. 
Bubbly Brown Sugar is a series that affirms that a magical love story isn’t reserved for the likes of Barack and Michelle Obama and that a happily ever after is the norm for people of color.
The Spiritual And Religious 
There is a huge growing population of people that identify as spiritual but not religious. This can take so many different forms and is too broad to tackle in our series. Valuing the importance of connecting with a higher source, Bubbly Brown Sugar gives voice to those that were raised in the church and have an affinity for reading sacred texts, but also incorporate other spiritual practices to deepen their relationship with Source. When you see faith-based programming, it only paints one picture and leaves this audience out. Bubbly Brown Sugar gives voice to those that do not allow dogma to hinder their pursuit for God.

How The Funds Will Be Used
Nothing great can be accomplished alone and your contribution is a wonderful act of love that we cherish. Bubbly Brown Sugar started out as an idea that popped into Tamala's head while sitting in rush hour traffic, and less than a year later, she has been watering this seed everyday and now it is time to take it to the next level... and we need you to make that happen. 
We’ve already begun pre-production of the film including rewrites of the script and three table readings to nail down the story, auditions to book every character (everyone is cast!), and iron out the logistics like budget, locations, equipment, and insurance.
Everything you contribute will go towards production costs to create a first-rate series that you will be proud of. 
Here’s the longer list of needs:


SAG day/rate for cast members because everyone deserves to receive compensation for their gifts and time. This is very important.

Production crew for the whole shoot (director of photography, camera operator, 1st assistant camera, 2nd assistant camera, gaffer, script supervisor, grip & electric)

Lighting, and sound equipment (Camera rental already provided by our DP)

Editing in post-production (color correction, composition, sound matching)

Music (custom songwriting and recording from RYDE Productions)

Art department (set design, costume design, graphic designer, hair & makeup stylist)

Craft services (a fancy phrase for FOOD)

Locations & permits (including two conference rooms, a dance studio, and two apartments for a majority of the scenes)

Insurance ($1,200 alone, we need it for permits and to be safe)

Marketing (submitting to film festivals and doing PR for the film costs money)

We’re shooting the film for ten days toward the end of October, and aiming for a post-production completion date of early 2019. In terms of risks and challenges, as with any ultra low-budget project  there may be unforeseen delays. No matter what, we promise to keep you updated throughout the process and let you know if we foresee any updates to our completion timeline.

Love is an EXCHANGE of energy and if you decide to love on us, it is a PLEASURE to send that energy right back. We spent so much time thinking of fun perks to show our appreciation and gratitude. As a backer of this series, you get some pretty dope Bubbly Brown Sugar SWAG!


Be the first to get your hands on a BBS mug, t-shirt, popsocket, calendar, or all of the above as a thank-you for your generous support!
Huge thanks to Jane Middle Art for the beautiful illustrations!

Our Sponsors
Over 25 businesses have already supported Bubbly Brown Sugar and we could not be more grateful! This means that they see the value in this platform and the need for it in the entertainment space. If you would like to learn more about sponsoring Bubbly Brown Sugar, please visit our website for more details. And to our sponsors, thank you for being down with Bubbly Brown Sugar!

Now that you know all about the story and the goal, let's talk about the brilliant artists behind this brainchild! Are you ready? 


Meet the Creative Team
We believe we can transform the way people see themselves and the world around them through media.  We are a group of filmmakers, writers, singers, actors, and artists that have assembled to bring this magical story to life.  Art can reflect life. It can also shape reality and we wish to promote images that magnify the ideal.

Tamala Baldwin: Executive Producer/Writer and Co-DirectorPlaying the role of JewelIf you ever notice someone randomly breaking out into a happy dance around the streets of New York City with a huge twinkle in her eye and a gigantic smile across her face, chances are you have spotted Award-Winning Content Producer and Actress, Tamala Baldwin, MBA. Tamala is an International performing artist and author of Limitless in Possibilities. She has been cast by Broadway Directors like Richard Stafford, Paul Stancato and BT McNicholl for various theatrical productions. Theater credits include: Priscilla Queen of the Desert, Little Shop of Horrors, Hairspray, Dreamgirls and Sunshine Boys. She is currently in production for Asunder, a digital soap opera series, slated to be released on Amazon this winter and Curvy Girls Rock!  When Tamala is not performing, she is running her production company, Soul Kisses Productions that has afforded her the opportunity to work with Billboard Charting artists like 50 Cent, Mandy Moore, T-Pain and Lil Mama; with major record labels like Warner Brothers, Columbia, Universal and for mega brands such as Energizer, AARP, Photobucket, Myspace and Eventful.
Career Highlights Include:

Awarded a scholarship to the Julliard School of Music for the flute and a proud member of the Actors Equity Association.
A member of the Black National MBA Association, an organization dedicated to the development of partnerships that result in the creation of intellectual and economic wealth in the black community.
Serves on the board of directors for Suffolk County Women Enterprise Coalition. 
An award-winning content creator for her media platform, Soul Kisses TV, with appearances on network news, radio programs, business journals and in major metropolitan newspapers.

To learn more about Tamala visit her official site at www.tamalabaldwin.com IG: @tamalabaldwin

LaVarro Jones: Co-Director/Editor
LaVarro has over 19 years of work experience in film and television. LaVarro started his career at BET (Black Entertainment Television) working on various shows including, BET’s Black Carpet, The 5, Rip The Runway, and various promos and television specials.  As his career progressed LaVarro worked for other networks including VH1, Bravo, HGTV, History Channel, and Style Network. He edited various shows including, I Want To Work For Diddy, Kimora, Life in The Fab Lane, Amish Mafia, Breaking Amish, Mob Wives, Prank Academy and Situationships.  He currently edits “The number one show in late night, ball bags,” Viceland’s Desus and Mero.
In 2016 LaVarro formed Necessary Studios, with fellow creative, Kamau Martin.  Necessary Studios, is the place to go for all of your production needs.  Through his production company, LaVarro Productions, he has written directed and edited web series, short films, music and promotional videos. The company’s first web series,  “Love And Money,” won 4 best acting awards at the 2013 LA Web Fest.

Neena Bhanti: Producer
Neena Bhanti, a New York native, is an award-winning performing artist and producer.  She has also worked on numerous music video, film and television sets including: Law and Order (NBC), the Sopranos (HBO), Lipstick Jungle (NBC), Damages(FX), The Sorcerer’s Apprentice, Two Lovers, Kabhi Alvida Na Kehna, The Accidental Husband and many more. Most notably, Neena earned an MBA, which focused on film production. There she was the co-creator of an independent film, which screened in NYC.  While at the Cannes Film Festival, she networked with many international film producers and directors. At NYU, she earned a certification in film production and made 2 short films, which she wrote and directed. Her gift of storytelling and being personable also allowed her to be the top seller at The Public Theater’s campaign funding program. She worked with donors who contributed generously to many play productions including Stephen Adly Guirgis’, Little Flower of East Orange, which was directed by Philip Seymour Hoffman. Currently, Neena is the associate producer of a documentary about the foster care system. She is also the producer of Bubbly Brown Sugar, a new television/web series.  Her cinematic dreams include directing music videos, creating impactful films that promote inclusion and diversity, and producing educational documentaries.
Justin Benjamin: Music Supervisor
Justin Benjamin is a professional songwriter, producer, and mixing engineer located in New York, NY with two decades of experience producing R&B, Hip-Hop, and Pop music and mixing songs of all genres.  He regularly collaborates with award-winning singers, rappers and actors for film, theatre, and television projects, including Brandon Victor Dixon (Hamilton, Shuffle Along, Motown) and Malcolm Barrett (Timeless, The Hurt Locker, Better Off Ted).  Justin's formal music training includes classical Trumpet and a BA in Music Theory and Composition from Columbia University.
Justin steps into his work on Bubbly Brown Sugar with an eagerness to capture the passion and intensity of the project, and a great deal of excitement to expand his experience composing and directing music for the screen.
Key Members of the Production Team

Rachelle Le Blanc: Production Manager
Rachelle Le Blanc, also known as Shelly, is a 29 year old actress from Curaçao. In 2012 Shelly moved to the States to pursue a Masters degree in Business administration and after obtaining her degree she moved to New York to attend New York Film Academy and studied Acting for Film. Since her graduation from NYFA, Shelly’s acted in Student Films, webseries, produced and starred in a short movie “Worthy of Love”, which is in post production and obtained a Masters degree in Media Management. In 2017, Shelly was nominated Best Supporting Actress by the Urban Webseries Awards for her performance in Da Brooklyn Way. Shelly is looking forward to a successful career in acting and hopes to inspire others with her passion and talent. Fun fact: Shelly is fluent in 4 different languages. IG: @Inspiringactress_shellsz

Randall Holloway: Casting Associate
Randall Holloway is a proud native from Milwaukee, Wisconsin and an alumni from Howard University. From a young age, Holloway would memorize lines and impersonate characters from movies. He has studied with Marc John Jefferies, and is a proud member of One on One NYC. Some of his New York Off- Broadway credits include Tennessee Williams The Mutilated (Sailor), Annie Warbucks (Alvin T. Paterson) and Company (Peter). He is a certified producer with BRIC TV and is currently developing his own projects off the ground, filming two new series, and has independent films touring across the country. On the side Holloway is a On- Air personality for and Music Xclusive TV. Since being in New York he would like to thank his family and close friends who continue to support him while he pursues his entertainment endeavors IG: @itsrandallholloway
We Can't Forget About Our Awesome Interns!
We are so FORTUNATE to have thes dynamic young ladies helping to us to make this all come together. Meet Esther, Amiela and Kalyani! 

Now that you have a better understanding of the incredible souls that are working from behind the scenes, it's time to switch up the pace and introduce you to the INCREDIBLE cast that have come on board to bring this story to life. 

Meet The Cast
Nothing great can be accomplished alone and we are so excited to have these amazing actors on board! Learn more about the artists you are supporting with your contribution below: 


Rich Lowe: Playing the Role of CALEBRich Lowe is an American born actor, singer, song writer, producer dancer and director. In addition to Rich's notoriety as a singer/dancer, Rich began his professional acting career with a role in American Stage Theatre's production of Marco Ramirez's "The Royale". Followed by roles in indie feature films “Over There” and “V for Vindicator” as well as numerous other short films. Rich wrote, edited produced, directed as well as starred in the short film “The Least of All”; in which he portrayed 4 different characters. The short was awarded two awards for best short film in the festival circuit in 2017. IG: @RichLowe24

Tyrone Reeves III: Plays the Role of JOSIAHTyrone Nathaniel Reeves is an American actor born in Abington, Pennsylvania and raised in New Jersey. Tyrone didn't discover his passion for acting until his mid-20's. His very first acting gig was a stage play called, Don't Count Me Out. From the moment, Tyrone knew he wanted to be an actor and he hasn't looked back. Tyrone has starred in movies such as, Lord Put A Ring On It, Lord Keep A Ring On It, and can also be seen on the hit TVONE series, For My Man.  IG: @Tyrone.N.Reeves

James Pierce III: Playing the Role of KWAMEJames A Pierce III is currently in the cast of Anastasia on Broadway. His Theatre Credits include The Lion King on Broadway, Little Dancer at the Kennedy Center and On The Town at Paper Mill Playhouse. He has had an extensive career in the performing arts. He's danced with Martha Graham, Ballet Met Columbus, Ballet Hispanico, Ailey 2 and Complexions dance companies. His television/film credits include Sissy Man, Love is a Broadway Hit, Collision(Vimeo), Once A Star (Vimeo), MTV's Decoded and SMASH (NBC) to name a few. You can follow him on Twitter and Instagram: James A Pierce III

Jene: Playing the Role of KimmiInternational Entertainer - Actress, Soul/R&B Artist-Songwriter, and Model - Jené has appeared throughout the world in Film, Television, Broadway, and Vocal Music. She is currently in production filming The Last Thing He Wanted - Directed by Dees Rees, starring Anne Hathaway. Credits include - FILM: Cash Flow, All The Little Things We Kill, Tio Papi; TELEVISION - Orange Is The New Black, Conviction, Jonny Zero, One Life To Live, The Mysteries Of Laura, the Law & Order franchise; THEATER: Broadway - Larry David's Fish In The Dark, RENT, Little Shop Of Horrors, Footloose, the original European and North American Tours of FAME. Jené holds great pride in living as a passionate, influential New Yorker, who is first and foremost, a Humanitarian. Most notably, she is a lifelong Advocate for the LGBTQ Community and LGBTQ Homeless Youth causes/foundations, as well as Anti-Bullying, with a focus on self esteem/wellness for young ladies. IG: @jenenyc

story:
So here we are...

Actor and Producer-Christopher J. Prado, Actor and Assistant Director-Fausto Olmos Renteria, Crime Novelist-Mark P. Sadler, Actor and Executive Producer-Solomon Carranza. Friends, colleagues and now collaborators. Some of you may know us from the films "Sacred Goals", "El Patron", "Amazed By You" by Avondale Pictures and the novels, "Blood On His Hands" and "Kettle of Vultures", some of you may know us personally, and many of you probably don't know us at all. Regardless, we're here to introduce you to a project that inspires hope. 

"You Only Live Twice" is an episodic narrative drama project we’ve lived and breathed for the last year of our lives. It’s a story formed partly from circumstances Christopher is familiar with, but primarily a fiction following friends dealing with life’s unexpected challenges.

 If you think it’s worth your contribution, small or large, you’ll be satisfying the budget for 3 60 minute episodes of “You Only Live Twice.” That’ll make our first season 3 total episodes. The first season scripts are all written, casting is done, rehearsals are underway, locations selected and we’re ready to attack this production as soon as we have the funds. Over the next 60 days, you have the ability to bring this 3 episode series several steps closer to the launch of our first season and well on our way to becoming a full second season of narrative drama television that takes a real look at the recovery side of addiction and the fight it takes to succeed and live a life of purpose and hope.  

What's in it for you?

Now for the fun part. We’ve put a lot of thought into what we can offer our backers a.k.a., The YOLT Family. We think many of the campaigns that forged a path before us had some incredible ideas, so you’ll see a few familiar incentives. We also dashed in a few things we think are inspiring and original, but we’ll let you be the judge of that. 

We’re very grateful for every cent put forward and are looking forward to expressing that gratitude through these incentives and more!

Why are we crowdfunding?

In an ever-changing landscape of Film and TV, more and more people are taking matters into their own hands and seeing incredible results. We're constantly inspired by filmmakers who fiercely protect their creative integrity. Crowdfunding our budget allows us to do exactly that. We want to remind creatives and audiences alike that there's always interest — and room — for great content. Here you will not only support “You Only Live Twice,”  you will also be showing your belief in independent television.

We’re grateful to take this route because it gives us more creative freedom and the ability to take you on the journey with us — every step of the way. Our incentives will provide you with updates and opportunities to put your own stamp on the series! 

Where does the money go?

We have a small, but incredibly talented and proficient team of independent filmmakers — a team that’s worked together on multiple projects over the years — actors, producers, cinematographers and sound mixers who have spent over combined decades carving out an efficient and effective system to create peak production value on a modest budget.

Since we already completed the writing and are currently in pre-production on our own, these funds will pay for the production of 3 episodes to make a total of one complete 3 episode season. Our efforts to help minimize production costs will include using several locations we personally own, shooting all episodes on one schedule to save time, and taking nominal pay rates relative to industry standards.

But no matter how cost-effective we are, there will be expenses. Our shoot will last around 4 full months of principal photography on a tight schedule and with a cast and crew of around 15-25 people, it will take significant funds to compensate these warriors fairly. There will also be insurance to buy, food for the crew, make-up and hair, trailers, lights to rent, music licensing and all post-production costs (editing, sound mixing, color grading) amongst a truckload of other line items. The camera and lenses are all supplied by Avai D'Amico, our incredible Director of Photography. Oh and that reminds us, some of our talent will be coming from out of town and even though we will house them in our modest homes, some just may not fit and hotel accommodations will need to be made. But, we are also going to use the hotel as one of our locations so we will be able to make it a multipurpose use along with our own vehicles!

All things considered, the number we’ve set for this campaign allows us to make a season of "You Only Live Twice" for the very least amount of money possible. Down to the last woman and man, we are a filmmaking team and family dedicated to the passion and love for storytelling first. 

Tucson is our home town and our team of writers have done a phenomenal job making Tucson a character in the show itself. Featuring the beautiful desert landscape, along with its historic and gorgeous bario district, will enhance the value and drive you to want to really be a part of this production.

How else can I help?

Some people just can't contribute and we understand that. We want to make sure that you know that inspiration and hope need a voice to spread the message and sharing this campaign with those that have been affected personally or those who are just wanting to be a part of something great, is also a part of this wonderful crowd-funding age!

This crowd-funding video is produced by Rogelio Camarillo, Jr.

We hope you enjoyed reading this and are looking forward to having you join the YOLT/You Only Live Twice Family!
story_txt:

story:
Short Summary

Hi guys! I am an Actor/Writer/Producer who is looking to produce the rest of Season 1 of Booster Mom. I hired an amazingly talented cast and crew to shoot the pilot episode.This show is a comedy that follows a group as they navigate the cut throat world of volunteering for high school programs. I want to bring joy to the world, and I do that through entertainment. I have 5 more episodes to produce. I self funded the pilot episode but need your help to fund the rest. Each episode costs around $3000 to produce and the graph shows where the money goes to each episode. There are some great perks to grab!! Show your support for Booster Mom!! Let's bring joy to the world together and donate to Booster Mom today :) Please help us spread the word and share this campaign, you can find it at:   supportboostermomshow.com

story:
Short Summary

Hi there!

This entire project has somewhat of an interesting start. Imagine this: It's night, it's raining, and you're walking down a shadowy street in New York City. The neon signs are reflecting off the rain covered streets and everyone rushes by, completely unaware that you've disconnected from the usual robotic march into the concrete jungle. Then suddenly, synthwave music rushes from your headphones and fills your mind with an idea; a story of mystery that takes place in the year 2058 in a cyberpunk city called Retro-City. Well...here we are! 

We had the opportunity to create a couple of episodes for a college class and, to our surprise, it was well received! The one major thing that Retro-City needed was better audio. Essentially, in order to have better audio, we need better equipment. 

Which is why we need your help. You would aid us in purchasing new equipment for this web-series. Not only will this improve the overall quality of Retro-City, it will also allow us to access the equipment we need to create more content in the future that we can be proud of.  If you donate, you would be giving us the opportunity to recreate Retro-City with our desired vision, as well as provide White Owl Productions the means to produce future content! 

Thank you,

Andrew and Emilio 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Here is a list of the equipment we are planning on buying with the money raised:

  • Shotgun Microphone Boom Set
  • Lavalier Microphone Set
  • Portable Digital Audio Recorder
  • Light Reflectors 
  • Extra Battery Packs for our Cameras
  • DSLR Shoulder Mount 
  • 3 Point Lighting Kit
  • Camera Field Monitor
  • 2nd Camera

For each donation we will be sure to send a special thank you. We are looking into a sending perks that range anywhere from a Retro-City shirt, to a signed virtual script from the cast, or a video call from on set! 

The Impact

The impact that your contributions would make will be incredible. Not only for Retro-City and all of the actors and people working on the web-series, but also for future projects. Being just out of acting college in New York City, there are countless opportunities to collaborate with likeminded artists, actors, writers and directors who we want to work with in creating content. We plan on using the equipment that we buy from your contributions to give White Owl Productions its foundation, that will provide these incredibly creative individuals with the tools they need to turn thought into action! 

Know that the sky is the limit when it comes to your donation.  You will be giving actors, writers, directors and many others amazing opportunities to follow their dreams.

Risks & Challenges

The major risk we face at the moment is trying to start and finish shooting for Retro-City before summer ends. Many of the actors that we have cast are not going to be in New York City by the end of the season, so we would need to recast. Also, the majority of the scenes take place at night, so filming in warmer weather would all around easier for everyone.  The sooner we are able to get better equipment, the sooner we can begin production before fall.

Other Ways You Can Help

Being fresh graduates from college we understand that money can be tight. If you are not able to donate but still want to give Retro-City the best shot it can get, please share this campaign! Use the social media sharing tools already provided by Indiegogo!
