story:
Hello and thank you for taking the time to read our campaign. My name is John Wolfe and I am the writer and producer of Wrongfully Convicted - a first of its kind UK male prison drama series. We were set for production in March this year but with the current Covid crisis we had to put it back until just two months ago. Covid has caused a massive impact on all of our lives and has made it harder for me to self-fund this series but needless to say I have strived on and managed to pay for everything needed to date to help launch the careers of everyone involved. We now however need more of a budget for better locations, props and travel costs among other things.

Series Summary

The series follows Vincent Prince, a quiet man from the north east on a night out with his friend - Garry. A series of violent events that were out of their control lead to Vincent being incarcerated for 5 years. We follow Vincent step by step in his life before the events of that evening, the court proceedings and whilst he serves his time in prison. We watch as he witnesses all the horrors of prison and crawls his way to being top dog.

I wrote the series to tell the story of what truly happens in prison. It is written from real inmate’s life stories both past to present and no fabricated life stories.

The production will be made to raise awareness and hopefully rehabilitate people from offending. We also aim to help launch the careers of the actors portraying each role and the crew that are carrying them through it all. As an actor, I understand the difficulty of getting that foot in the door, especially when you aren't too sure how it all works and I am passionate about helping these individuals pursue their passion like I did with mine.

The actors and crew in the production have all been hand-picked to showcase the talent the UK truly has, while creating a one of a kind unique show and some bigger names have come on board to offer their experience and help for the other actors.

We will be looking to take this to a major broadcaster once the pilot episode is made and start a much bigger production with more actors and crew.

What We Need

We expect the series to take 6-9 months to make. As you see from the images we have already started shooting the pilot episode. We seek £10,000 to cover all costs, including UK travel, editing costs, post production, sound and picture grading, etc.

£1,500 towards Camera crew

£1,500 towards Sound

£1,000 to other crew

£4,000 Court room and prison hire.

£1,000 travel expenses for cast

£1,000 Costume and prop hire

We have equipment to shoot the episode, and an enthusiastic network of supporters. We believe strongly in open access and we guarantee to make a free version available of the pilot episode.

Whatever position you hold in respect of crime and punishment, there are hidden stories that need to be told from all sides. This series will tell those stories.

What You Get

We have spent a long time discussing the perks for our campaign and we feel that what we chosen will be warmly welcomed. 

We have a range of different perks including social media shout outs, IMDB Thank You credits, signed clapperboards, Executive Producer credits and more. Every penny helps in order to make this dream a reality, whilst giving cast and crew valuable experience on set. If more money is raised than the target, these funds will go into making the production bigger and better, although the standard is already at a extremely high. 

The Impact

Wrongfully Convicted is a gripping drama of which will tells the story of what life is really like in UK prisons. We hope for this to not only have a story line of which is gripping and immerses the audience but is also educational - as sometimes visuals are the best ways to understand. 

We have an amazing cast and crew, who have already been working extremely hard to make this show a reality. They have all put their hearts and souls into this project, we hope to give them the opportunity to continue to grow with us and the show by making the pilot the best it can be. This not only gives everyone useful showreel footage, experience and knowledge but also the chance to build relationships within the industry. We believe in giving as many people the opportunity to hone their craft whilst having fun and enjoyment on a professional set. 

We have already won multiple laurels and awards from film festivals for the script of which we hope to win many more. We feel this not only shows the high standard of the script and it's writing but also our professionalism and dedication to Wrongfully Convicted. 

Everyone working on the project has a range of skills and understanding - some professionals, semi-professionals and some new talent in the industry - all of whom have and are working extremely well together, all with the same intent to make Wrongfully Convicted the best it can be. 

Risks & Challenges 

With any production there is a risk, but we feel that the more we film the more we learn. Throughout this process we have all, already learnt a lot and we continue to learn everyday. We use our different experiences both in life and in the industry in order to educate and train each other. Whilst this can be a challenge, it is also a wonderful opportunity to expand our knowledge and share it too. There are so many different challenges of which we have to overcome on any production, all of which we take as a learning opportunity. These challenges include:

Organisation - This is a very big and important challenge of which we focus on a lot. We are aware that organisation can make or break a production. It is extremely important for everyone to know where they have to be and when, what they need to be doing, what costume they need and so on. We believe that organisation is the way to success. 

Shoot Schedule - We have a large cast all shooting on different days and at different times. Having a shoot schedule and sticking to it, is such an important detail in order to keep us running smoothly. 

Safety on Set - This is another challenge of which has our focus. Without health and safety in place we would not be making the show. Ultimately, filming is not more important than someone's life. We would rather not film than risk someone. This is very relevant with Covid-19 where we take the rules and regulations very seriously, whilst keeping a watch of any and all updates. We feel at present this is one of our biggest hurdles but with everyone's amazing attitudes to keep each other safe, we are so far succeeding. We require PPE to be worn, social distancing to be kept in place, hand sanitizer is used as well as hand washing on a regular basis. We check everyone's temperatures and have a very open way of communication should anyone have any concerns or feel the need to discuss. If anyone shows any symptoms or feels unwell before or during their shoot times, they will be assessed by the Covid trained team members in order to keep everyone as safe and updated as possible. Not only is this important for Covid-19 reasons but for everyone's general health, safety and well being. 

Say Hello to some of our Cast and Crew

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone will be able to contribute to our fundraiser, financially. We have a great following behind the project so far, through word of mouth. It is of great help and extremely appreciated if you can help us to continue to build our following by sharing our fundraiser far and wide. 

Thank you for taking the time to view and read all about our campaign for Wrongfully Convicted. If you would like to find out more, please head over to our Facebook page by using the link below: 

https://www.facebook.com/Wrongfully-Convicted-1...

To find out more about our cast and crew, please head on over to our IMDb page by using the link below:

https://www.imdb.com/title/tt11361590/?ref_=fn_...

To find out more about our cast and crew, please head on over to our IMDb page by using the link below:
https://www.imdb.com/title/tt11361590/?ref_=fn_...

story:
Hey Ravers!

We want to thank you for the likes, follows, and viewership of Renting and Raving Season 1! The full first season is available on our YouTube channel, including some special holiday mini-sodes and additional content. 

Our web series follows three hapless yet good-hearted roommates; Evan, Bret, and the mysterious Basement Guy. In Season 1 we followed their adventures as they figure out life, love, and making rent (along with building a giant robot). We also came to find that Basement Guy is a former child star of the 90’s hit TV show Freddie Feline. 

 

Season 1 ends with Basement Guy being offered a huge opportunity to reboot Freddie Feline, as well as his acting career. Season 2 sees Basement Guy facing the challenges of renewed stardom, the pressure from competing actors, as well as the proper way to style a scarf. 

Bret is living off the land and loving it..or is he? Always working towards “the next big thing”, he reinvents himself as an all-around handyman. Evan seems to have finally found his own path to stardom, accidentally becoming a renowned contemporary artist. And Tito? Well, we learn a few things about Tito that might surprise you as we build the larger world of Syntronix, Michigan. 

 

So, why are we on IndieGoGo?

Being a micro-budget, micro-crew production can mean a lot of great things. All of our content, costumes, props, and production processes are done completely in-house by our talented core team of six people. But, given our goals for Season 2, we realize we need some extra help. 

Your contribution will help raise our production value with additional crew members, lighting equipment, help with props and advertisements, as well as feeding all the great talent who graciously volunteer their time. 

If you have been following since Season 1, you already know what an exciting accomplishment this project has been. Now, with your support, we’ll be able to make a deeper impact with our creative community and get Renting and Raving out there to the world!

 

Thank you, from the crew here at Renting and Raving.

story:
Short Summary 

Muze Productions is an amateur film group made up of Actors, Directors, and Editors. Working towards making diverse, exciting and relevant stories for our world today!

Synopsis: Miles Returns to his childhood home after the passing of his mother. his life would change forever when he uncovers a family chest full of secrets. Miles is destined to save the mortal world from the damned Souls of the shadow realm, with the help of some new friends.

What We Need & What You Get

  • Funding generated for this project will go directly into the making of this production (Costumes, Shoot Location fees, Production Equipment etc.)
  • We're offering several unique perks for our donators including being named after a character, or an early release of the first episode!
  • If our funded goal isn't reached, All funds will still go towards the production of this project. Our film may be placed on hold until we reach our goal to ensure that we produce quality content.

Risks & Challenges

Muze Productions is an amateur film group made up of current and recently graduated students in the film industry. This makes funding our own projects a bit challenging.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help in other ways:

  • Please share the news about our web-series by sharing this Indiegogo page with others!
  • Follow us on Instagram and TiK Tok ( @ Muze.productions).

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Nos sentimos muy arropadas por su apoyo, y queremos que participen  en nuestro proyecto.

Os queremos !!!

 

Dear friends and followers of “El Contacto Cero”, we have created this campaign from our hearts and we feel very happy for it. We had the chance to record the first season thanks to the money that our director had saved for a long time, and now, once again we need money to record the second season, in order to create new and longer episodes; we love that you ask us for that.

We feel your support and great welcome and so that, we want you to join and participate in our project! We love you!

 

Chères amies et suiveurs d '<< El Contacto Cero >>, en una crête cette campagne dés le coeur et c'est très beau que ce soit comme ça. En un lugar de estreno, se publicará el calendario y la fecha y la fecha, así como el mantenimiento y el mantenimiento de una fuente para el agente y el torneo de la ciudad y de la ciudad. En adore que vous nous demandiez ça.

Nous sommes trés hereuses de pouvoir resentir votre chalereuse accueil et on veut que vous participez également dans le projet. En vous aime bien !!!

 

¿Cuánto necesitamos y por qué?

La 1ª Temporada fue hecha con 3000 €, no tenemos problemas en contacto. ¿En qué se usa ese dinero? A pagar a parte del elenco, en alquiler equipo, poder alimentar en los rodajes ... Gran parte del equipo lo haremos gratuitamente, y participando en el proyecto gratuitamente, simplemente creemos en ello y ahora más, gracias a vosotras ya vuestro gran recibimiento .  

Si vemos el número de reproducciones que tenemos por video, y sigue subiendo, ¿qué son 2 € un cambio de darte más visibilidad y que disfrutes con ello? 

Nadie se va a beneficiar directamente de este dinero, todas tenemos otro trabajo del que nos alimentamos, esto lo hacemos porque creemos en el proyecto. Porque queremos contar historias de verdad, porque la mujer no es solo un objeto sexual del hombre. Somos mucho más y queremos mostrarlo, y disfrutar mostrándolo y que vosotras lo disfrutéis. 

 

The first season was recorded with the sum of 3000€, we are not afraid of telling it to you. How was used all that money? We paid the actors, we had to rent the equipment, we had to pay to record in some places, we had to eat during the long and wonderful hours of recording… However, a great part of the team, did it for free, because they beleive in the project, and now, they do it more thanks to you and your great support.

If we have a look to the number of displays of each video, and it still increasing, what does it matter 2 euros if it gives us more visibility and you can enjoy it with us?

Nobody is gonna have personal profits with this money, we all have another job that allows us to live, we do this because we beleive in the project. Because we want to tell true stories, and because the woman is not only a sexual objetc belonging to men. We are a lot more and we want to show it, enjoying the way of showing it and making you to enjoy it with us.

 

La première saison était faite avec 3000€, on n’as pas de soucis pour vous le dire. A quoi est-ce que c’est argent a été destiné? On a payé les acteurs, on a loué les équipes de tournage, on a du payer pour tourner dans quelques endroits, pour pouvoir nous nourrir pendant les longes heures du tournage… Il y a eu également une grande partie de l’équipe qui étaient des bénévoles, parce qu’ils croient dans le projet, et maintenatn, ils le font en plus grâce á vous et votre grande accuéil.

Si on voit le nombre de réproductions, que ne césse pas d’augmenter, qu’est-ce que ça signifie 2€ pour nous rendre plus visibles et que vous profiteez avec nous?

Personne n’aura des bénefices personnels avec cet argent, on a toutes un autre travail duquel on peut vivre, on fait ça parce qu’on croit vraiment dans le projet, parce qu’on veut raconter des histoires véritables, parce que la femme n’est pas seulement un objet sexuelle qui apartienne à l’homme. Nous sommes beaucoup plus que ça, et on aimerait le montrer, profiter en le montrant et que vous toutes le profitez également.

 

Desafío

Realmente para nosotras esto es un desafío, todas nos dedicamos profesionalmente al medio audiovisual pero es la primera vez que hacemos algo por nosotras mismas y sin querer obtener nada a cambio. Sólo por tener la libertad, muchas veces me han preguntado como directora del proyecto: ¿por qué no vendes la idea? Está funcionando muy bien. Siempre les respondo: ¡Qué ni en broma! ¿Sabéis por qué? Porque por primera vez puedo decir, hacer y experimentar lo que yo quiera, y es tan grande esa satisfacción que ningún dinero lo puede pagar.

Así que, con este crowdfunding podemos ganar todas, apoyarnos cómo podáis y lo que podáis. Serán los 6.000€ mejor invertidos de vuestras vidas y los más agradecidos por nuestra parte. No os defraudaremos. 

Un fuerte abrazo de todo el equipo de El Contacto Cero.

 

Actually, this is a real challenge for us. We all work in the audovisual world, but this is the first time that we do something like this by ourselves and without expecting to receive something in return. Only for having the freedom of doing it. Sometimes people ask me, as the director of the project, why i dont sell the idea, because it is actually working. And  you know what? I always answer that there is no way that it happens! Ans that is because for the first time, i can say, do and experiment wahtever i want and the feeling of satisfaction is that big, that no amount of money can replace it.

So, with this crowfunding we can all win. Support us as you can, and with what you can . It will be the best investment of your life and the most grateful from our side. We won’t let you down.

Big hughs from all the team of El Contacto Cero.

 

La réalité c’est, qu il s’agit d’un vrait défi pour nous. On appartienne au monde professionnel de l’ audiovisuel, mais c’est la première fois qu’on fait quelque chose comme ça par nous mêmes et sans vouloir rien recevoir en retour. Juste pour avoir la liberté de le faire. Des fois, on m’est démandé á moi, comme directrice du projet: << Pourquoi est-ce que tu ne vends pas l’idée? Ça marche très bien>>. Et je répond toujours: <<Même pour plaisenter!>> et vous savez pourquoi? Parce que par la première fois, je peux dire, faire et expérimenter ce que je veux, et c’est si grande ce plaisir qu’aucun argent pourrait le payer.

Alors, avec cet crowfunding en peut toutes gagner. Soutenez-nous comme vous pouvez y avec ce que vous pouvez. Ce sera l'argent le mieux investi de votre vie, et les plus réconnus de notre cote. En ne vous décevra pas.

L'équipe du El Contacto cero vous embrasse trés forte.

story:
Our Project

The Baobab, this magnificent and upside down tree from Africa reminds me to keep an open mind about not only nature but ourselves too. And from an old African myth related to it, that we were all wanderers at one point...

I'm Ariel Tweto, an Alaskan Inupiaq  Eskimo, expert wanderer, TV personality, adventurer, and my new passion is figuring out the origins of our human species! Where did we originate from?  Where are my actual roots?

From somebody whose ancestors crossed the Bering Strait some 30,000 years ago, and who began their journey from Africa some 2M years ago, I am so eager to learn more about Africa and where humanity began! 

Olduvai, Tanzania - The site were Homo habilis lived 1.9M years ago

Are we all really that different from one another? Not really! I can’t think of a better way to look at this than having an Eskimo (me!) travel to Africa and explore this with locals, scientists, cameras, and YOU to help us arrive at fresh conclusions.

In these 8 episodes, we are going to learn that what may make us human isn't our ability to make tools and weapons, but rather our ability to show empathy, compassion, and create social bonds!

Footprints in Laetoli, Tanzania:  Male, female and child steps

In this series we will also be visiting with different tribes in Africa and comparing them with our tribes and cultures in Alaska. And again, are we really that different? Not really! Even though we may look different, talk different, and live in different environments, we still feel and love the same way!

Also, click on the link to follow this project on Twitter!

 

What We Need & What You Get

I am raising money to finish covering costs for an exciting new series about humanity and its origins as seen through the eyes of an Eskimo from Unalakleet, Alaska.

  • This extra amount will cover costs to film a proof of concept for this series that came from the pandemic. The extra costs include extra cars for the film crew (social distancing), drone permits, park permits, scientists, and covid tests and precautions for everyone on the set on a frequent basis.
  • As a perk, you will be able to receive exclusive videos from me while we are filming on location (filming-of), as well as a copy of the proof of concept reel (after you sign a NAD). I will also encourage you to write me with ideas on what you want to see and even give us editing pointers on the proof of concept we share with you. This is a group effort - which is one of the main points of the series, that as humans we are better when we work together!
  • If we don't reach our goal, we would film a shorter proof of concept and donate 25% of the funds to the Zara Foundation in Tanzania for the education of Maasai girls in the Ngorongoro area.

 

The Impact

We are living in a very divisive moment both in our country and on our planet. This level of distrust among ourselves, along with covid-19, has exacerbated tensions between us.

I propose to show that humans were perhaps not always like that. By visiting the sites of our origins as a species, I propose to argue that perhaps empathy was more important than weapons when my ancestors started their long trek out of Africa and ended up in Alaska, where I come from.  I will involve scientists in this discussion who both share or disagree with this viewpoint. 

I will also show the importance of women in this process, and how it was them  who kept these groups together as they traveled far from their origins and eventually learned how to adapt within the Arctic Circle. Don't estimate girl power 2M years ago!

The 8 episode original series will also interview important scientists in the fields of paleo-anthropology, primatology, sociology and medicine.  I hope to take you to where Jane Goodall did her research with her chimpanzees or Diane Fossey with the gorillas - both women who have made an impact on how we see ourselves as humans. 

I will also give you an inside look on how different tribes in Africa live today and how their habits keep them in much better health than ours.

Your contribution will allow these topics to be seen by millions - and most importantly, the idea that as humans, we have many more things in common than differences. In other words, that as somebody from Alaska who is an Inuit, I share many more commonalities than differences with a female Maasai of my age in the Serengeti. And therefore, that as an American and as a human, we need to learn to look for these common traits in order to survive and better flourish as a society.

I have a solid track record in docuseries with 4 years of Flying Wild Alaska and recently, an IMAX movie: Into America's Wild.

I now wish to make my own statement on how to defuse our current divisiveness in the US and the rest of the planet.

And this brings me to YOU. We are all in this together.

So please give me a hand, spare some money, and help me in making this inspiring series a reality. 

 

Risks & Challenges

Our major obstacle has been the COVID-19 pandemic. Filming and investments have ground down to almost a halt with the traditional pathways for financing such ventures. 

I come from a small town in Alaska, and as a survivalist I have made it into docuseries and movies. The divisiveness we live, along with the pandemic,  are yet other obstacles that I will overcome with your help. 

Help me show the world that as humans we are a better lot than what we have seen lately. 

As for the risks, we have scientists on our team that will watch for us with regards to malaria, typhoid, and of course covid. We are filming with a top crew, and we have chosen the most reputable safari group in Serengeti for our transport and lodging. 

With your help, we will be able to film and edit a very high quality proof of concept that you can be part of in an effort to help turn our planet around. 

Thanks!

Ariel Eva Tundraq Atauchiaq Tweto

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't spare a few dollars today, perhaps you can spread the word about our project. If you are an influencer, or someone with many followers in social media, please help by using your platform to help this project gain attention. I will give you many virtual hugs!

This is OUR project, and we are all contributing here both with ideas and some cash to get this off the ground.

I will also show the importance of women in this process, and how it was them  who kept these groups together as they traveled far from their origins and eventually learned how to adapt within the Arctic Circle. Don't estimate girl power 2M years ago!
The 8 episode original series will also interview important scientists in the fields of paleo-anthropology, primatology, sociology and medicine.  I hope to take you to where Jane Goodall did her research with her chimpanzees or Diane Fossey with the gorillas - both women who have made an impact on how we see ourselves as humans. 

I will also give you an inside look on how different tribes in Africa live today and how their habits keep them in much better health than ours.
Your contribution will allow these topics to be seen by millions - and most importantly, the idea that as humans, we have many more things in common than differences. In other words, that as somebody from Alaska who is an Inuit, I share many more commonalities than differences with a female Maasai of my age in the Serengeti. And therefore, that as an American and as a human, we need to learn to look for these common traits in order to survive and better flourish as a society.
I have a solid track record in docuseries with 4 years of Flying Wild Alaska and recently, an IMAX movie: Into America's Wild.
I now wish to make my own statement on how to defuse our current divisiveness in the US and the rest of the planet.
And this brings me to YOU. We are all in this together.
So please give me a hand, spare some money, and help me in making this inspiring series a reality. 

 
Risks & Challenges
Our major obstacle has been the COVID-19 pandemic. Filming and investments have ground down to almost a halt with the traditional pathways for financing such ventures. 
I come from a small town in Alaska, and as a survivalist I have made it into docuseries and movies. The divisiveness we live, along with the pandemic,  are yet other obstacles that I will overcome with your help. 
Help me show the world that as humans we are a better lot than what we have seen lately. 
As for the risks, we have scientists on our team that will watch for us with regards to malaria, typhoid, and of course covid. We are filming with a top crew, and we have chosen the most reputable safari group in Serengeti for our transport and lodging. 
With your help, we will be able to film and edit a very high quality proof of concept that you can be part of in an effort to help turn our planet around. 
Thanks!
Ariel Eva Tundraq Atauchiaq Tweto

 
Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't spare a few dollars today, perhaps you can spread the word about our project. If you are an influencer, or someone with many followers in social media, please help by using your platform to help this project gain attention. I will give you many virtual hugs!
This is OUR project, and we are all contributing here both with ideas and some cash to get this off the ground.

story:
Story

In an Alternative & Utopian 2019, as a form of slavery reparations, African-Americans of a certain age must choose who they want to be for the rest of their lives from a list of preset archetypes.

Blaque Brown’s coming of age was supposed to be no different, but it is only when her procedure goes horribly wrong that she realizes that her life has taken a turn for the chaotic. As Blaque’s new identity invalidates everything she once knew about herself and her blackness, she must learn to harness her newfound power to grow into the woman she chose to be.

Behind the Story

When I was younger, kids in elementary and middle school would tell me that I was “not black enough” due to the way I spoke, the music I listened to, the movies I liked, etc. For years, I was widely known as the "oreo" in the room– black on the outside, white on the inside, and this destroyed my self-esteem and my own perception of my cultural identity until high school.

In high school, I entered an environment where I was suddenly one of the only black kids and in contrast to my previous years, I suddenly became hyperaware of my blackness and felt uncomfortable on the other end of the spectrum– feeling too black and defined by stereotypes I've never known to be true. As a result, I strayed even further from what I thought my blackness should be and I tried for many years to be something I wasn't.  

Navigating the spectrum of blackness has always been confusing (and at times, discouraging) because to me I’ve always felt "black enough".  Coming to college (a less structurally defined institution), I realized that it should be enough to exude blackness simply by just being black. There is no one singular way to be adequately black and I wrote Exotic Blaque as an exploration of that concept.

The Impact

I've always thought of myself as a "girl-next-door" type, but I've realized that although I see myself this way, I have rarely (if ever) seen myself represented this way in media. The "Girl-Next-Door" archetype has never looked like me, and while that has become "acceptable" and gone unquestioned, it most certainly is not true. Relatability isn't gained solely by having a bouncy, blonde ponytail and lily white skin and that is what I hope to prove through this project.

While this campaign is only in support of Exotic Blaque as a proof of concept, the impact of this project continues to look at the bigger picture. The goal is to deconstruct typical archetypal associations and show the many faces and personalities that come along with the potentially limitless representations of blackness in the media.  

I am making this project not only for myself, but for those who feel marginalized and pressured to fit into a specific identity– those who have not seen enough of themselves in the media as it stands today. 

 

The Team

Lauryn Henry (Writer, Director, Actress)

Lauryn has always held a deep appreciation for art in all of its forms. She has spent years of her youth training as both a dancer and a vocalist through musical theater, in addition to having taught herself in both the fields of photography and filmmaking. 

Lauryn is now a junior at the University of Southern California studying Cinema & Media Studies as well as pursuing a double minor in Entertainment Industry and Screenwriting. She is a YoungArts alumna, having been selected as a 2016 national winner for her accomplishments in the Cinematic Arts. ​

In recent years, in addition to writing and directing numerous shorts, she has taken on freelance work as a production designer, sound designer, and editor. Her work has been previously released with GirlBoss and PAPER Magazine. 

 

Chandler Guzman (Producer)

Chandler Yvanna, also known under her producing title 'cult kid', is a sophomore at the University of Southern California as a Media Arts + Practice student in the School of Cinematic Arts. She specializes in ethical media making and focuses those efforts on producing films she believes rewrite the narrative of ethics in the entertainment industry. As a Los Angeles native and Chicana, she loves diving into projects that are based in the experiences of people of color. 

In a similar vein, Chandler also authors her media to re-appropriate the depiction of addiction, recovery, and post-generational trauma. As a film mentor for sober youth in lower-income communities Chandler's ultimate goal is to provide access to the world of cinema and story telling that she feels privileged to be apart of.   

 

Brandon Le (Cinematographer)

Brandon Le is a recent graduate from USC’s Marshall School of business, where he simultaneously engaged in advanced business curriculum during the week and used any free time to explore cinematography and enhance his skills. He was born in Portland, Oregon, but has also lived a third of his life overseas in Taipei, Taiwan and Shanghai, China. Despite never having one single place to call home, he found stability in pursuing his passion for art through the performing arts and photography and cinematography. 

As a cinematographer, Brandon specializes in the visual aspects of filmmaking. He is most fascinated by sculpting light to craft artistic images, rather than merely capturing them. This has led him to work with many directors to create stunning music videos, short films, commercials, and documentaries. He has also worked with acclaimed filmmaker, Freddie Wong, at RocketJump, and is now working to expand his knowledge of lighting by working at Aputure, an LED lighting manufacturer.

 

Obehi Uadiale (Production Designer)

Obehi Uadiale is a sophomore majoring in Art at the University of Southern California. She finds joy in curating experiences and finds that production design is a perfect outlet for that. Her main focus is crafting experiences and campaigns that people love and want to share by intertwining marketing strategy, art direction,  teamwork, and culture to develop visual narratives and captivating experiences.

She is passionate about combining nuanced visuals that are both intellectual and powerful in a way that probes you to feel. As a black woman in entertainment, she places value in accurate and complex representations of minority voices.

 

Maya Tribbitt (Assistant Director)

Maya Tribbitt is a rising junior studying journalism at USC.  She has produced several short films in the past, but now she currently works in the entertainment journalism industry at The Hollywood Reporter while holding the position of marketing chair for Delta Kappa Alpha (Alpha Chapter).  Off duty, you can catch her at Dulce with an iced mocha latte raving about the latest Marvel movie. 

 

Will McCormick (Graphics)

Will McCormick studies Animation and Digital Art major in the School of Cinematic Arts at USC, where he specializes in concept art and 3D character animation. He aspires to become a visual effects supervisor working on feature films. Last year, he and a team of four other animators won seventh place out of 214 contestants in the National 24-Hour Animation Competition. He currently works as a freelance graphic designer and is the chair of art and design at Pi Kappa Alpha fraternity. 

 

Ways You Can Help

We will be shooting over the course of three weekends July 2019, and a significant percentage of the budget is allocated towards camera rentals and various equipment. Additionally, the world of this project is highly stylized, on top of having many science-fiction visual elements and sequences. With this is mind, art department plays a huge factor in the total budget as it includes costumes, hair, makeup, and props. Other costs include craft services (food) and securing locations. 

We understand that $15,000 is a large number, but considering the demands of this project, it's well worth it and your money surely will not go to waste.

We appreciate anything you can do to help, so regardless of whether or not you choose to donate, please share this page and spread the word about this project! Feel free to share on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, or whatever else you can think of! We just want to prove that this story works, that the world is interesting, and that the characters of Exotic Blaque are innovative and worth watching, so let's get people interested!

Thank you for your support!

–Lauryn & the Team

story:
You can check out our series trailer below  and watch episodes 1-6 on our YouTube channel!

 

Hi there!

I'm Zachary Michaels the creator of the web series "Generation Z"! I created this series back in 2017 and I've been working tirelessly ever since to complete it and now we've just got 1 episode left to film. This series was really important for me to make because when I was a teenager I didn't have anybody who looked like me dealing with mental health and I had nothing to look to, So with "Generation Z" I wanted to have different people from various walks of life coming together, finding better ways to deal with their mental health and to create a series that anybody could connect to and learn from.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We're hoping to raise $3,500 so we can film the Season 1 finale episode of "Generation Z"! Realistically we'll likely need more than $3,500 to complete the episode but this money will give us a solid foundation to start on. If you donate to our campaign you'll not only get the satisfaction of helping young artists but you'll be able to claim some cool perks like your name in the credits, a "Generation Z" t-shirt, a day on set, a producer credit, tickets to the finale premiere and more! 

*If you donated to our initial Indiegogo campaign you can expect to receive any additional physical perks in the coming months!*

 

Help me I'm poor, what else can I do?

Just because you don't have the funds (believe me we've all been there) doesn't mean you can't contribute!

Here are some ways you can help out:

SPREAD THE WORD! Just because you can't donate doesn't mean you don't know anyone who may want to contribute. Use the Indiegogo tools and share our campaign. It takes a village, ya know?

Give us a like, follow, retweet, & share on ALL social media platforms (@genzwebseries)!

MOST IMPORTANTLY: don't forget to watch our show on YouTube! Subscribe, share it with your friends, and let us know what you think!

 

Crew

Cast

Behind The Scenes

Bloopers - 

Full Q&A - 

 
BTS Montage - 
 
The Making of - 

 

 

 

Social Media Links

     

Thanks for joining us on our journey!

- Generation Z Team

story:
Summary

Mirador Television wants to unite the small towns and villages of the world through small scale television. A mighty tough task? Yes, but if you do nothing, nothing gets done. There has to be a starting point

Already we speak to our local community through a social media page, LEWES LOCAL TELEVISION MIRADOR but we’ve also established an infrastructure on all the major streaming channels such as Roku, Amazon Fire etc.

This way our television programmes stream across the globe, to the parts that other television channels cannot reach!

We do it through a programme loop of six hours, revolving through the day and week, with the content created by our small team of television professionals.

We’re punching well above our weight, but the project can stand proud against any TV service in the world, including the iconic BBC, PBS, ABC and ITV.

Our production team is mixed. There are grizzled veterans with experience of over 40 years in mainstream TV and young apprentices, just out of college and raring to go.

You can see their combined efforts on miradortelevision.com or on the streaming channels on your phone or smart TV sets.

Its different, its intriguing, its geared to a mature audience, is a bit quirky but perfectly watchable by the family.

We provide information, news, entertainment, comment and a few giggles, while supporting small businesses which are suffering lockdown blues and charities, who have been hit hard by the shift in emphasis to COVID type support from the standard charitable giving who fight cancer, heart disease and mental health.  

But if we are to conquer the world, we need to expand a bit. We need a bit more studio space, a smidgen more equipment and a bit of working capital to go along with it.

We are the Biggest Little Television Channel in the World.

Now we want to make sure everyone knows it.

So we need a little more cash. And that’s why we want daring pioneers who are like ourselves. Ready to achieve the impossible. Ready to take on the big boys, ready to fulfil the Mark Twain proposition, ‘Most men see things as they are. I see them as they could be.’

No little local television unit anywhere has taken up the challenge of being small in size, but so big in heart that we make David loom large in facing Goliath. We think there is room for global ‘tiny towns’ television and we want an army of tiny towners to support us.

So, get on board. It’s going to be a thrilling ride.

We need a few million pounds to get to the final dream. But just for now, we could do with about £20,000 to take the first step outside our own house.

So what does £20,000 buy for Mirador Television?

First, some more space. We operate from a small office and studio combination right now. We would like to double the size of the studio so we can make more programmes. Production is limited by the amount of space and equipment we have. While good weather gives us the ability to shoot outside, COVID has cut down the number of people we can use and the locations we can go to. So a bigger studio is a must.

We are using the miracle of modern technology. We have one good quality video camera, some smaller web cams and we use our phones, along with the fantastic, well priced Apps that allow editing, special effects and animations. The internet sends our programmes to a central distributor who then places them on the streaming channels. Half a billion people worldwide can then see the fantastic creative television programmes that a tiny town’s television can create. Another good quality camera, an improvement to our sound system and some studio bits and bobs need funding.

We are excellent trainers as well. We give chances to grow into the television industry through courses, on the job training and mini apprenticeships. 

Another videographer and a part time producer are on the list and some extra space will also be bought. Finally, we need to do some self promotion. Our viewing audience is growing but we want it to speed up. So spending a little on shouting about ourselves is going to count a lot.

£20,000 doesn’t seem a lot, I know. But we have invested almost £40,000 already and the revenue side of things was slow to start. And why shouldn’t it? In the harsh commercial world, the businessman wants a bang for his buck. We’ve spent six months getting the product right. Now we can bang all over the place for the commercial buck, without cutting back on our quality programmes.

We can become self sufficient within a couple of months, but we need a bit of help from our friends, known and soon to be.

The Mirador Television Icon is a medieval helmet, drawn like a statue in Lewes’s Priory Park. The statue stands as a memorial to the Battle of Lewes in 1264, credited by historians as the conflict that sparked English democracy.

So we’re inviting you to become a Knight of Mirador and spark a revolution in the television media industry and make Netflix look ordinary!

There is no other band of media Knights fighting the good fight for local media to make its impact on the world. And let’s face it, the big boys aren’t that interested in getting involved with the more discerning television fan.  

So being a part of Mirador through a knighthood, (COVID has stopped the Queen tapping you on the shoulder with a sword) is a way to spread a great voice across the world, talking in a language the common man can take in.

Mirador was born out of the struggles to establish local TV some five years ago. We had a rough ride when equipment was expensive, the need for manpower was extensive and the support from small investors was stretched.

But we came through the fire and Mirador, established three years ago has slowly proved that the little television project can not only survive in its own little corner, but dare to branch out and win the citizen of the greater world.

We are stubborn, hard working full of self-belief and faith. So Mirador is here to stay. Give a bob or two and stay with us.

Life during COVID is harsh. Money is scarce, we understand that. But you can still help. Spread the word about Mirador to your friends, share our programmes with your friends, point others in the direction of miradortelevision.com, even form a fan and supporters club to back us up. Indiegogo

You’ll get lots of recognition from us. We’ll put your actions on telly. Aunt Maude always wanted to see you on the small screen, didn’t she?

Be a Mirador Knight and help us battle our way across the world. We’re a new set of Crusaders, so join trek. It’s fun but also putting something into our society which right now, it badly needs.

Another good quality camera, an improvement to our sound system and some studio bits and bobs need funding.
We are excellent trainers as well. We give chances to grow into the television industry through courses, on the job training and mini apprenticeships. 
Another videographer and a part time producer are on the list and some extra space will also be bought. Finally, we need to do some self promotion. Our viewing audience is growing but we want it to speed up. So spending a little on shouting about ourselves is going to count a lot.
£20,000 doesn’t seem a lot, I know. But we have invested almost £40,000 already and the revenue side of things was slow to start. And why shouldn’t it? In the harsh commercial world, the businessman wants a bang for his buck. We’ve spent six months getting the product right. Now we can bang all over the place for the commercial buck, without cutting back on our quality programmes.
We can become self sufficient within a couple of months, but we need a bit of help from our friends, known and soon to be.
The Mirador Television Icon is a medieval helmet, drawn like a statue in Lewes’s Priory Park. The statue stands as a memorial to the Battle of Lewes in 1264, credited by historians as the conflict that sparked English democracy.
So we’re inviting you to become a Knight of Mirador and spark a revolution in the television media industry and make Netflix look ordinary!
There is no other band of media Knights fighting the good fight for local media to make its impact on the world. And let’s face it, the big boys aren’t that interested in getting involved with the more discerning television fan.  
So being a part of Mirador through a knighthood, (COVID has stopped the Queen tapping you on the shoulder with a sword) is a way to spread a great voice across the world, talking in a language the common man can take in.
Mirador was born out of the struggles to establish local TV some five years ago. We had a rough ride when equipment was expensive, the need for manpower was extensive and the support from small investors was stretched.
But we came through the fire and Mirador, established three years ago has slowly proved that the little television project can not only survive in its own little corner, but dare to branch out and win the citizen of the greater world.
We are stubborn, hard working full of self-belief and faith. So Mirador is here to stay. Give a bob or two and stay with us.
Life during COVID is harsh. Money is scarce, we understand that. But you can still help. Spread the word about Mirador to your friends, share our programmes with your friends, point others in the direction of miradortelevision.com, even form a fan and supporters club to back us up. Indiegogo
You’ll get lots of recognition from us. We’ll put your actions on telly. Aunt Maude always wanted to see you on the small screen, didn’t she?
Be a Mirador Knight and help us battle our way across the world. We’re a new set of Crusaders, so join trek. It’s fun but also putting something into our society which right now, it badly needs.

story:
Who is This Former Hot Guy?

My name is Troy Maurice Williams and I hail from the windy city of Chicago. After my mother's untimely death from cancer, I  loaded up my truck, left Alcorn State University and I moved to Beverly. Hills that is. Well, it wasn't actually Beverly Hills, it was Baldwin Hills.  And it wasn't actually a truck, it was a 1983 Nissan Sentra. I moved to Los Angeles to pursue a dream I had had since the age of four. A dream of waiting tables, driving Uber and doing various other thoughtless jobs. All with the hopes of one day seeing my name in lights. However, after 25 years I thought, maybe everything I had been shown in the brochure of following your dreams wasn't true. Then one morning I woke up with a brilliant ideal. How about a web series about a middle-aged man who was the hot ticket back in the day, but had not fulfilled any of his life's dreams or goals. Yes, this is my life.

And What Is He Doing

Trials & Tribulations of A Former Hot Guy - is a 3-7 minute, 11 episode romantic comedy web series about Troy Maurice, a former hot guy of the 80’s, 90’s and early 2000’s who wakes up one morning in distress. He realizes after 25 years of living in LA that this hot guy title has netted him nothing. Not only is his acting and writing career not flourishing, but he never got the wife nor had the children he longed for. So, now Troy is on the fast track to get his career rolling along with finding his soulmate to have a child with, all before his 86-year-old father/antagonist dies thinking he was shooting blanks. The only challenge is, Troy has to date women among a demographic that is of childbearing age. Unfortunately, he absolutely loathes that demographic, millennials.

(Example of an Episode) Episode One: Mastering the Art of Non-Communication

The female council members give Troy a tutorial on the various reality TV shows that millennials are interested in, like Love and Hip Hop, Atlanta Housewives, The Kardashians etc... They believe this will give him things to talk about on his date. Troy tells them he is a master of the art of communication and he can find something to talk about with anyone. In the next scene Troy is on his date. His date is not very interested in his conversation and tells him she doesn't watch very much TV. Then  she begins texting on her cell phone. Troy becomes annoyed, but comes up with an idea. He starts texting his date while sitting at the table with her. She responds favorably?

 

So, Why Is This Former Hot Guy Bothering Me?

Because I need you. My producing partners and I believe $15,000 will allow us to do the following:

  • Hire Director
  • Hire Camera person with equipment
  • Hire Cast
  • Hire Craft Services
  • Post production 

I have had a dream of being a filmmaker since I was four years old, but let's face facts. My dream is not going to help us find the cure for cancer or aids. It's not going to help bring an end to poverty or social injustice. Nor will it help to bring world piece or resolve any other issues we face as a nation. However, I guarantee you that the 3-7 minutes to spend watching one of the 11 episodes of Trials & Tribulation of A Former Hot Guy will make you laugh out loud and  simply remind you of how funny and fun everyday life can be when you don't take yourself or this world  so seriously. I believe this web series will eventually become a television show, but we have to get these 11 episodes done first. I need all of you to make this happen, family, friends, strangers, enemies, single women, married women, single men, married men, happy couples, unhappy couples and even Trump supporters. I know with your generous donation, WE CAN DO THIS. Please see the perks section as to what you will receive with your generous donation. Thank you in advance.

MY HOT CAST

This hot looking cast of Devika Parikh, Richard Whiten, Tangie Ambrose and Mari Morrow have appeared in some of the hottest films, TV shows and commercials for over two decades. And the only thing that exceeds their hot looks is their incredible talent.  

                 

             

 

MY HOT PRODUCERS

These hot producers, Stacey McClain and Kieren Boyce have worked in various aspects of the entertainment industry from marketing and sales to writing and  directing for over 25 years. Their insight and creative talents will make Trials & Tribulations of a Former Hot Guy a web series for the ages.

story:
HELP WANTED

New York City can't survive without the young and hungry. We wake the city up with coffee, take care of its children, get it in shape, and put it to bed with a bottle. We are your interns, baristas, cooks, nannies, assistants, and dog walkers. But we don't want these jobs. We just need the money.

MONEY is an anthology series about different New Yorkers fighting to get just above rock bottom. 

CO-WORKERS

Our writing team is made up of Mercedes Flores,​ Michael J. Bevan, Nicole Bernardo, An-Li Bogan, Niko Crawford, Haley Jakobson, Nazareth Hassan, and Guillermo Contreras.

Each of us wrote an episode with a different protagonist to showcase the diverse and unique experiences that make up young, "broke" New York.

COVER LETTER/RESUME

All funding from this campaign will go toward production and distribution of our pilot episode, “Matilda."

“Matilda” is about a weekend of dog sitting in the West Village where disaster strikes twice.  This episode is set in a studio apartment, so it will be the cheapest to make and least challenging to shoot. Once finished, "Matilda" will be submitted to festivals to create momentum for MONEY.

With a completed pilot episode and Season 1 written, we plan to pitch our show to different media outlets that are in search of original short form content. 

PAYCHECK

We need money to make MONEY. 

Your contribution will go toward:

  • paying actors, crew, and designers
  • location
  • editing
  • sound
  • costumes
  • original music
  • festival submission fees

We believe in this show because we know that the struggle is real. These stories are real.  No matter where you live or how old you are, you'll see yourself in each episode. Watch as seven hopefuls chase their dreams while trying to pay for it all. 

no money? no problem.

Already over your budget for the month? We get it. Consider other ways to help! Share this campaign on social media, connect with us on facebook, or watch our series come to life on instagram. 

Design by Joanne Jones.

story:
THE IMPACT 

LIFE THROUGH AN ARTIST reflects the daily grind and triumphs of artists in various fields of entertainment. Seldom does a show convey the authentic life of the people responsible for making us laugh, cry, and think. Through intriguing flash backs, engaging teasers and relatable characters, Life Through an Artist paints a realistic picture of what it means to be up and coming in New York City. 

This drama follows the paths of an actor, dancer, singer and a photographer pursuing their dreams of making it big in New York City while facing personal conflicts with family and each other.  Adam, Alexandria, Brittany and Elizabeth, chase their destinies of fame and success while past lovers rekindle flames, past tragedies causes setbacks and missed opportunities ignite doubt. In this city of lights and action, the struggle is their greatest strength.

 

WHERE WILL THE MONEY GO?

We need to raise $25,000 to complete production and distribute this Tv Pilot. This is a "SMALL" amount compared to what it will take to really produce a show on this caliber, but any amount will help us get a great jump start. 

  • Production: 70% -the bulk of funds raised will be used for the actual production of the show. (time & labor intensive).
  • Post-Production:  15% - ADR, music and licensing rights, editorial/post, composting and color grading.
  • PR & Distribution: 10% - legal fees, press kits, marketing materials,  and travel.
  • Perk Fulfillment:  5% - Thank You gifts for all of our generous friends and supporters!

The crowdfunding campaign for Life Through An Artist is a flexible funding campaign, which means that every dollar raised will go towards the production of the pilot and much more!

 

STRETCH GOALS

$40,000

At the $40,000 mark, we will be able to finance additional project development including stretching out shoot days for even more excellent quality. 

$60,000

At the $60,000 mark, we will be able to start production values of the entire season.

 

GET TO KNOW THE CAST 

adam|Rory Clarke

ADAM'S STORY:

Losing a mother is difficult for anyone. But this is especially hard when you’re a young actor living in a harsh and unforgiving city like New York. Adam, who is the lead character has his life turned upside down when he loses the most supportive and faithful person in his life, his mother. He finds himself completely thrusted in New York City and has to stay focused on keeping up with his auditions and maintaining his circle of friends which becomes the most constant aspect of his life since his mother passed. We find out at the end of the pilot that even though getting work as an actor is hard on its own, Adam’s career faces a huge obstacle in the form of another rival actor who is hell bent on ruining Adam’s career. 

alexandria|Brittany Mirabilé

ALEXANDRIA'S STORY: 

A dancer and old fling of Adam’s is just as focused on her dreams as any other in the big city. She has a sort of innocence and freshness to her dance aspirations that makes her hungry since she is new but also nervous because of her lack of experience. Alexandria is an important part to Adam’s life because they were high school friends and even dated for a short period time. Though the romance element of their life has officially ended, there still remains an undeniable flame between the two. Alexandria is the most stable person in Adam’s life right now and they support each other in their hunt for greatness.

brittany|Kajuana Marie

BRITTANY'S STORY:

Brittany, the photographer, wants to take as many chances to grow and develop as she can.  Despite  her outstanding academics, she is content with the thought of being an Ivy League student.. Being from upstate New York Brittany struggles with pleasing her parents and maintaining a healthy relationship with her bestfriend Elizabeth as they both try to fit in a new city.

elizabeth|Rebi Paganini

ELIZABETH'S STORY:

Elizabeth a young singer that has a strong drive for her music career. Brittany and Elizabeth are best friends and struggle at times in learning how to be a support to each other as artists while also maintaining a healthy friendship. Elizabeth battles with her insecurities of being a writer but they same thing that she struggles with helps her get through a pass that continues to haunt her as she trys to forget and move on.

Supporting Cast Members

charlene|Nhadya Salomon

-------------------

marcus|Telvin Griffin

-------------------

evan|Vincent Ford

-------------------

brad|Torre

-------------------

royce|Terrell Wheeler

 

THE TEAM

Creator|Director

_____________________________________________________________________________

Executive Producer|AD  

_____________________________________________________________________________

Producer

_____________________________________________________________________________

Producer

_____________________________________________________________________________

Writer

_____________________________________________________________________________

Set Designer

 

RISKS & CHALLENGES

Creating a series is a long journey, and must be taken one step at a time. This pilot, like any new venture, faces the challenge of raising sufficient capital to ensure that we can achieve a high standard of excellence. That’s why we need your help. With your financial support, we will complete what we have started and get it into the hands of people who will bring it to you.

IN ADDITION TO PLEDGING NOW, HERE ARE A FEW OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP….

  • Log into your FACEBOOK account
  • Go to https://www.facebook.com/LTAASERIES/
  • And hit the share button on our campaign story and share it with your friends and family.
  • Connect with us on Facebook for New Update and Much More

OR

  • Log in to your Indiegogo account
  • Go to our crowdfund page
  • Share the campaign directly using the buttons on the left or copy the direct URL https://igg.me/at/ltaatvseries
  • Refer our Indiegogo campaign with anyone you think would be interested in supporting this project.

MORE WAYS YOU CAN HELP….

Even if you can’t donate, the biggest way you can help is to spread the word about our crowdfunding campaign and encourage everyone you know to give…give often...and give generously!  Each person who donates increases our chances of reaching our goals.

THANK YOU IN ADVANCE!
