story:
B-to-C Summary | Creator Statement

Hey, it's Nikita! If you’re reading this right now, I’ve won half the battle. Because you either care about the series or care about me (or both, which is rad! Or you hate me, and are eager to read this so you can go, “ugh she’s not even funny” in which case, thank you for your closeted obsession!)

If you know me and my style of comedy, you know I do nothing just for the sake of being funny. I always want to call out things we take for granted, to expose hard truths, to have a MESSAGE.

I’ve worked a combined 3+ years of office and startup jobs. And here’s the thing: startups claim to be a paradise away from corporate jobs and offer an experience that traditional workplaces could never have. But it comes at a high and often unclear cost. 

But! Paranormal Disruption is not specific to startups - the story is universal for all jobs! Did you walk into work today and go “not these people again?” Would you rather poop at work because you technically get paid for it? Good! You’ll find something you relate to in this series!

If you have a job, you’re not a bad person. In fact, you’re lucky and you’re making money that I desperately want! But we’ve all bought into some lies in the workplace. That's what the series is about.

 

Our Leverage & Your ROI | What Your Money Will Do

Our team is comprised of only the best of the best: 

Did you notice something? The core team behind Paranormal Disruption is ALL People of Color! No, you are not racist for noticing that! Yes, you are racist if you close this tab! No, I am not above playing the race card to get money!

These POC creators are lending their talents to the series along with a dedicated production team. A lot of tried-and-true people are behind this, and your contribution will help pay them for their hard work. Creative people deserve to get paid.

Our $8,500 goal will do all of these things:

-pay our cast

-purchase props

-secure a filming location

-feed our cast and crew during shoots

-rent filming equipment

-pay for high quality post production. That means sharp editing, captivating coloring, and just the right sound mixing to make the hair on your neck stand. Horror is NOTHING, and I stress NOTHING, without the right editing. I want the comedy in this series to be intentional, not accidental. Ya dig?

And hey, you get something out of it too!  From series merch to conference room dedications in the episodes, we've got everything!  Plus, you can write your donation off on your taxes. 

With a flexible goal, any and all contributions will go a LONG way. Every dollar brought to our campaign will go directly into the production of the series and into the wallets of the people who brought it to life. The more funds, the bigger the production and the happier the cast and crew. 

 

Market Penetration | Why Does This Matter? 

Paranormal Disruption is about teasing startup culture, yes. But it's more about individual empowerment in an environment that wants everyone to function as a unit. It’s about finding your voice in an echo chamber and listening to yourself.

And, it's about mental health. A lot of us suffer silently with brains that aren’t our friends. We’re anxious, we doubt ourselves, we think everyone else has it right and somehow we messed up. But sometimes, the best gift we can give ourselves is to end up in a situation so dysfunctional that we wake up and realize our true power.

In a way, it’s meant to empower the voice inside you when something just… isn’t… right.

Also, the protagonist? A badass woman of color. How often do you see those as the leads of a film? There are plenty of stories and perspectives that haven’t been heard just because we don’t have the access to tell them.

And if you’re a woman of color, how much of your REAL life is being your white friend’s sidekick, an exotic token girlfriend, a poster-employee for diversity, a punchline for your accent? None, I hope! You’re a whole person and not someone’s statement! You’ve fallen in love! You’ve experienced loss! You’ve sh*t your pants! My point is, YOU’VE LIVED A LIFE.

Our team is creating a story from a voice unheard. And we know you're gonna love it. Don't believe us? Then take a look at the work our team has done before:

 

See?  Results.  We Deliver.  And you can be a part of that!

 

Pivot Plan | Risks & Challenges

With any kind of production, you run into the challenges of having actors or locations back out at the last minute, incumbent weather, or worst of all, injury on set.  

Our team is fully qualified to handle any of these issues based on the amount of experience they've gained from hundreds of sets past.  And *ahem* each production they have accomplished has come away with a clean bill of health as well as being fully completed/distributed!  

 

Boot-Strapping | Other Ways You Can Help

We know that not everyone can give to our campaign, but you can still do your part by sharing this with everyone you know!  Your parents, your siblings, your friends, your dogs - even your OWN corporate or non-corporate office if you're brave like that!  

You can use any of the Indiegogo share tools listed on our page to do so!

We hope you will enjoy this series as much as we will enjoy making it. 
So, have you hugged that puppy yet?  Well, go ahead and do it, then donate!
story_txt:
B-to-C Summary | Creator Statement
Hey, it's Nikita! If you’re reading this right now, I’ve won half the battle. Because you either care about the series or care about me (or both, which is rad! Or you hate me, and are eager to read this so you can go, “ugh she’s not even funny” in which case, thank you for your closeted obsession!)
If you know me and my style of comedy, you know I do nothing just for the sake of being funny. I always want to call out things we take for granted, to expose hard truths, to have a MESSAGE.
I’ve worked a combined 3+ years of office and startup jobs. And here’s the thing: startups claim to be a paradise away from corporate jobs and offer an experience that traditional workplaces could never have. But it comes at a high and often unclear cost. 
But! Paranormal Disruption is not specific to startups - the story is universal for all jobs! Did you walk into work today and go “not these people again?” Would you rather poop at work because you technically get paid for it? Good! You’ll find something you relate to in this series!
If you have a job, you’re not a bad person. In fact, you’re lucky and you’re making money that I desperately want! But we’ve all bought into some lies in the workplace. That's what the series is about.
 

Our Leverage & Your ROI | What Your Money Will Do
Our team is comprised of only the best of the best: 

Did you notice something? The core team behind Paranormal Disruption is ALL People of Color! No, you are not racist for noticing that! Yes, you are racist if you close this tab! No, I am not above playing the race card to get money!
These POC creators are lending their talents to the series along with a dedicated production team. A lot of tried-and-true people are behind this, and your contribution will help pay them for their hard work. Creative people deserve to get paid.
Our $8,500 goal will do all of these things:
-pay our cast
-purchase props
-secure a filming location
-feed our cast and crew during shoots
-rent filming equipment
-pay for high quality post production. That means sharp editing, captivating coloring, and just the right sound mixing to make the hair on your neck stand. Horror is NOTHING, and I stress NOTHING, without the right editing. I want the comedy in this series to be intentional, not accidental. Ya dig?
And hey, you get something out of it too!  From series merch to conference room dedications in the episodes, we've got everything!  Plus, you can write your donation off on your taxes. 
With a flexible goal, any and all contributions will go a LONG way. Every dollar brought to our campaign will go directly into the production of the series and into the wallets of the people who brought it to life. The more funds, the bigger the production and the happier the cast and crew. 


 
Market Penetration | Why Does This Matter? 
Paranormal Disruption is about teasing startup culture, yes. But it's more about individual empowerment in an environment that wants everyone to function as a unit. It’s about finding your voice in an echo chamber and listening to yourself.
And, it's about mental health. A lot of us suffer silently with brains that aren’t our friends. We’re anxious, we doubt ourselves, we think everyone else has it right and somehow we messed up. But sometimes, the best gift we can give ourselves is to end up in a situation so dysfunctional that we wake up and realize our true power.
In a way, it’s meant to empower the voice inside you when something just… isn’t… right.
Also, the protagonist? A badass woman of color. How often do you see those as the leads of a film? There are plenty of stories and perspectives that haven’t been heard just because we don’t have the access to tell them.
And if you’re a woman of color, how much of your REAL life is being your white friend’s sidekick, an exotic token girlfriend, a poster-employee for diversity, a punchline for your accent? None, I hope! You’re a whole person and not someone’s statement! You’ve fallen in love! You’ve experienced loss! You’ve sh*t your pants! My point is, YOU’VE LIVED A LIFE.
Our team is creating a story from a voice unheard. And we know you're gonna love it. Don't believe us? Then take a look at the work our team has done before:




 
See?  Results.  We Deliver.  And you can be a part of that!
 


Pivot Plan | Risks & Challenges
With any kind of production, you run into the challenges of having actors or locations back out at the last minute, incumbent weather, or worst of all, injury on set.  
Our team is fully qualified to handle any of these issues based on the amount of experience they've gained from hundreds of sets past.  And *ahem* each production they have accomplished has come away with a clean bill of health as well as being fully completed/distributed!  

 
Boot-Strapping | Other Ways You Can Help
We know that not everyone can give to our campaign, but you can still do your part by sharing this with everyone you know!  Your parents, your siblings, your friends, your dogs - even your OWN corporate or non-corporate office if you're brave like that!  
You can use any of the Indiegogo share tools listed on our page to do so!
We hope you will enjoy this series as much as we will enjoy making it. So, have you hugged that puppy yet?  Well, go ahead and do it, then donate!

story:
Who are the CannaFairies?

CannaFairies are the hosts of FAEK News, a satirical adult news show that is looking at our culture from the outside in. These fairies are born from the first seed of a new strain of cannabis, named after terpenes, and are residents of Humboldt county. They are pure in intent and spirit, yet quite naive in their understanding of humans' ways, leading to much of the humor and commentary the show will carry. They are very distinct in personality and relationships to each other and humanity. They have come out from hiding due to the "acceptance" of cannabis in our culture with a poignant message to the world about how we are "missing the mark". They curse and rant at times, losing their shit, only to remember that they are hosting a news show and they have to keep it together. They also devote some coverage and give props for the moves they see us taking towards sustainability and preservation. Their mission is ultimately to educate about cannabis, environmental issues, social justice issues, and the corporate take over of the world while bringing the "medicine" of laughter. Every episode will be having a segment tied to the Emerald Triangle as well, so both tourism aspects and local cannabis related companies get some regular exposure.

 

Message to the Emerald Triangle

Greetings Humboldt, Mendocino, and Trinity counties. We are at a crossroads as a community and our economy is going in the tank. The struggle is real and is impacting ALL businesses in our communities. While corporations move into the cannabis market with regulations on their side, we must find ways to keep revenue flowing here and ways to promote some of our business on a national level for when full legalization comes around. While things may get better when we are able to move product across state lines, there will be the inevitable competition of the GORM spending 10s of millions on their advertising and their pursuit of monopolizing the market. The CannaFairies project is devoted to keeping the Emerald Triangle and its cannabis related companies in the public eye, promoting tourism, and supporting local artists whenever possible. Please consider funding our pilot EARLY as an investment in the Emerald Triangle itself and letting the public know we provide the best cannabis products as well as let them know they won’t go missing or get murdered on a mountain if they visit!

 

Message to the World

Hey World. How's it going? We are at a crossroads as a community and our environment is going in the tank. The struggle is real and impacting ALL life on our planet. While corporations run rampant with sociopathic tendencies, we must find ways to raise awareness and organize for the change that is needed. We have a near endless supply of topics to cover and inform on. CannaFairies can reach millions with vital information and even become an activism hub in time. Please consider funding our pilot as an investment in our future, our children's future, and the future of all living things on the planet. No pressure though. Oh, and hey, SHARING this helps a lot too. We know times are tight for many, but the share will cost you nothing!

 

Solid Production Foundation

Creator Ben Jacob has extensive experience in the Voice Over field having been a casting director, teacher, and production engineer in Hollywood for many years before moving to Humboldt. Solid casting, character development, and direction for the voices will be the foundation this production will build off of. Fortunately we have an expert in this unique field.

On top of that Alan Peterson, Professional photographer/videographer/animator brings both his experience and Epic Red set up to our production for top quality live action footage. This adds a depth and quality to this project from the very start.

 

What you see vs. What will be - CannaFairies 2.0

While we are quite happy with the current line up of CannaFairies created, these are only mock ups for this campaign. Our software and hardware for these initial models and renders is almost 7 years old! So be prepared to see significant upgrades in what will be coming. This will allow for more realism on renders to blend them into live action settings, which we will be doing quite a bit of. As mentioned in our production schedule, one of our first goals will be to revamp and re-create our CannaFairies and we will be sharing with you along the way each new creation to join our FAEK News team!

 

Our Campaign Goal

This campaign is to fund the pilot episode of FAEK News. From there it would be to get picked up by a network that isn't afraid of a bit of controversy such as HBO, Showtime, Netflix, or Comedy Central to name a few. However if the networks don't catch on right away, we hope to create a Patreon following to keep us moving into episode 2 and beyond as we will have the hardware and software to continue production.

 

Supporting local business

We are dedicated to supporting local businesses with the CannaFairies project and most perks will be fulfilled using local companies or done in house. Crystal laser sculptures will be done by Swanlund’s Camera in Eureka, gem stones by Chapman’s and Bead Supply Inc., Hemp shirts by Divine Tribe, and so on. We also plan to host an online consignment shop of local artists doing renditions of our CannaFairies in all kinds of mediums. If you are a local artist and have any interest, please shoot us an email! 

 

Tree Perks

As you may have noticed, in each perk we have included the gift of trees being planted. This service will be provided by Trees for the Future (Trees.org), a non-profit that has been doing amazing work for a very long time. They have planted over 149 million trees to date helping many communities rebuild their lives in the process, and sequestered over 192,000 tons of carbon. We know that this campaign, with your support, plants an entire forest while funding the pilot. We also fully intend to continue to offset the CannaFairies footprint by having 20,000 trees planted for each episode we create. In addition we will be creating a FAEK News segment about this collaborative effort!

 

Politics

The CannaFairies are not champions for any political party. They are independent in their views and see that the government is under corporate rule on both sides. When covering politics, they will be looking directly at the relationship of politicians to corporations, and what impact those corporations are having on our world. The lobbying and corporate money in politics must come to an end, and politicians willing to turn down the GORM’s attempt to buy policy will be recognized and those in the pockets of the GORM will be called out.

 

Segments for pilot episode of FAEK News

The following are our intended segments for this pilot episode you can support. We hope to cover all these with a few surprises we are keeping under wraps. However, due to time constraints or possible budget issues, we may have to delay some for later episodes.

1. “The CannaFairies” - an introduction by the Queen giving background on the CannaFairies origin and why they have come out to combat the GORM and their take over of the cannabis industry. This will be the deeper look into what our Indiegogo trailer is alluding to.

2. “CBD B Healin’” - CannaFairies give an overview of all the ailments CBD has been found to be an effective treatment for. Future episodes will go into more detail on the medical benefits of CBD and how human biology finds cannabinoids to be an incredibly perfect match for health and wellness.

3. “Profiles in GORM” - CannaFairies will be taking an in depth look at one of these greedy old rich men and how they are shaping our culture with their unlimited financial wealth. We have a short list and plan to keep this as a regular segment as, sadly, there are so many to cover. No mercy will be shown in calling these disgusting individuals out for their crimes against our planet, animals, and the people.

4. “Your Shit Matters” - This is a one shot segment that will focus on the Arcata Marsh and Wildlife Sanctuary. This incredibly successful, yet little known project, started back in the 70’s. It provides a roadmap for all communities great and small to follow to establish a symbiotic system for waste/sewage management and how it can beautify and create a habitat for wildlife. Truly an amazing success story that we look forward to sharing.

5. “True Resistance” - This segment will be reoccurring and will focus on individuals and organizations resisting the corporate rule. For our pilot episode we will be looking at Standing Rock - NODAPL, and the Water Protectors who stood firm against the GORM and their truly disturbing tactics to build this unwanted pipeline.

6. “The indoor grow weather report” - Those who know, know. Haha! Just having a bit of fun here!

7. “Inside the Emerald Triangle” - This segment will begin with a look at what the legalization and over production of cannabis in California has done so far to our community in the ET. The CannaFairies will interview one or two local business owners to detail the very real struggle of coming into compliance with regulations, and how that has crushed small farms and impacted our local economy.

8. The “Read a Fucking Book” report - Another reoccurring segment highlighting books with relevance towards progressive thinking and action. Even if you get the audio version, our fairies will be pleased that you received the knowledge provided by this author.

9. “Plastosis” - CannaFairies look into and provide solutions to our addiction to plastics, the environmental impacts, and the absolute absurdity of continuing this insane practice of production and consumption.

10. “A New Forest” - This is a one time segment on how we, as a unified group of creators and supporters, planted a massive forest in the making of this pilot. It will be highlighted that all endeavors great and small should consider offsetting their environmental impacts, and how every future episode and project by the CannaFairies will be offset with more trees being planted.

11. - 13. We got to keep some surprises for you. We know what they are, and so will you as long as we get support! Please consider funding and sharing!

 

Production Schedule 

Starting once Indiegogo funds received:

Weeks one and two - Acquire new hardware, software, office space, book keeper, web developer, and business lawyer. Set up new content libraries in Daz 3D, test Motion Capture, prep auditions for voice over artists.

Week three - Begin CannaFairies character creation v 2.0. Set creation 2.0. Begin voice over auditions for the 4 roles we intend to cast. More mo cap testing. Begin stop motion animation for FAEK News intro. Finalize our script for pilot episode.

Weeks four and five - Record voice over and motion capture for entire show. Begin the “clean up” of mo cap files. Start seeing the CannaFairies come to life.

Weeks six and seven - Record live action interview segments and possible pick up lines or segments with voice over actors. Continue with animation clean up and begin on final renders. 

Weeks eight through sixteen - Heavy post production and rendering. This will include Photoshop and After Effects graphics, intensive rendering for the fairies, adding particle effects and spells, editing in Premier, mixing audio, creating credits, and the detailed refinements once the episode is pieced together.

Week seventeen - Hold our live stream “smoke out” with the team and share the pilot with all of you lovely contributors! You guys rock! Thanks so much for supporting this vision!

 

Budget

The budget requirements are somewhat flexible to produce our pilot episode. The budget set forth is for optimum production, speed, and tools for our team of four. However, if we can reach even half this, we can still make significant headway into the production while working on raising additional funds. If we are over funded we can hire additional team and place the rest towards promotional efforts once completed.

Animation Design and Production - $35,000

Live Action Elements - $5,000

Hardware - $10,000 (2 top end iMacs and 4 iPhones for Mo Cap)

Writing and Research -  $4500

Social Media Management and perk fulfillment - $11,000

Music Licensing and composition - $4000

Voice Over casting and recording - $5500

Software - $4000

Website Development - $1500

Office space and 2nd hand furnishings- $5000

Legal and book keeping - $2000

13% for fees and withholdings for Indiegogo - $11,400

 

Total Budget = $99,000

 

The Team

Ben Jacob - Director/Producer/Animation/Writer

Alan Peterson - Animation/Cinematography/Special Effects/Motion Graphics

Katy Warner - Social Media Management/Stop Motion Animation/Gift Fulfillment/Finances

Laurel Jean - Lead Writer/Campaign Promotion/Research

 

CannaFairies creator, Ben Jacob, has twenty one years experience in audio/visual production. Having spent 8 years in Hollywood as an audio engineer, voice casting director, and in commercial production, he then moved to Humboldt county in 2000 to pursue a happy life. He became self-taught in 3D animation in his spare time using Daz 3D over many years and eventually fell back on his earlier training to produce adult animated content. While successful enough to pay bills in this endeavor, it was unfulfilling on many levels and his drive to create something to “change the world for the better” eventually gave way to the CannaFairies project. His passion lies in protection of the natural world and looking/living outside the box that our culture of consumption has created. Oh and cannabis, he likes cannabis.

Alan Peterson lives in McKinleyville, California and has been an animator, videographer, editor and photographer for twelve years. He studied film and animation at California College of the Arts, and now dedicates much of his time to documenting the ecology of California’s northern coast, and pretending that global warming won’t kill us all. His work has been featured by the BBC Natural History Unit and National Geographic, as well as independent documentaries about the region’s natural history and infrastructure. Growing up in Oakland, he learned how cruel liberal economics and ideology can be to the poor and people of color, moving him to become a social worker and activist before being priced out of the Bay Area.

Katy Warner is a McKinleyville-based multimedia artist, specializing in digital printing and screen printing. She grew up in Sacramento, CA and decided to become an artist after receiving a hand-me-down laptop for her 14th birthday. Her life's goal is to illustrate how anyone can become an artist using the wasted and neglected objects our society creates. Her training was in Oakland, CA, receiving her BFA from California College of the Arts in 2009 and her MFA from Mills College in 2013. She is currently a Co-Operator at the Sanctuary, managing their print room and co-supervising their arts programming. She also maintains social media pages for several Humboldt County institutions such as Arts Alive! Humboldt, the Redwood Art Association and the Sanctuary.

Laurel Jean is a HumCo transplant from SoCal. She has been writing stories since she could talk (which used to get her into trouble). She studied Creative Writing at Humboldt State University, and graduated in 2013 with a dual MA in Literature and Teaching Writing. Currently she teaches English Composition. She also writes porn and is less embarrassed about that than she is about how she used to write fanfiction.

 

Challenges

There is only one challenge we face other than taking on the GORM. We (Alan Peterson and Ben Jacob) are going from traditional key frame animating to Motion Capture in Daz 3D. We are expecting a sharp learning curve in the first few weeks, but the latest tech is in our favor. It seems to be as easy as recording the voice artist with an app in iPhone, and using bridging software to translate the motions/expressions into Daz. If at any point we don’t see the mo cap being viable, we can fall back on our traditional key frame animating to see the show through. This may cause a slight delay in release time but we can still get to that finish line either way. 

 

Final Words

Thanks for taking the time to read all this and for considering CannaFairies FAEK News as a project to support. We are all passionate about the project and know it will be unique, fun, and educational. We look forward to bringing you the very best in FAEK NEWS!

If we are over funded we can hire additional team and place the rest towards promotional efforts once completed.Animation Design and Production - $35,000Live Action Elements - $5,000Hardware - $10,000 (2 top end iMacs and 4 iPhones for Mo Cap)Writing and Research -  $4500Social Media Management and perk fulfillment - $11,000Music Licensing and composition - $4000Voice Over casting and recording - $5500Software - $4000Website Development - $1500Office space and 2nd hand furnishings- $5000Legal and book keeping - $200013% for fees and withholdings for Indiegogo - $11,400 Total Budget = $99,000 The TeamBen Jacob - Director/Producer/Animation/WriterAlan Peterson - Animation/Cinematography/Special Effects/Motion GraphicsKaty Warner - Social Media Management/Stop Motion Animation/Gift Fulfillment/FinancesLaurel Jean - Lead Writer/Campaign Promotion/Research CannaFairies creator, Ben Jacob, has twenty one years experience in audio/visual production. Having spent 8 years in Hollywood as an audio engineer, voice casting director, and in commercial production, he then moved to Humboldt county in 2000 to pursue a happy life. He became self-taught in 3D animation in his spare time using Daz 3D over many years and eventually fell back on his earlier training to produce adult animated content. While successful enough to pay bills in this endeavor, it was unfulfilling on many levels and his drive to create something to “change the world for the better” eventually gave way to the CannaFairies project. His passion lies in protection of the natural world and looking/living outside the box that our culture of consumption has created. Oh and cannabis, he likes cannabis.Alan Peterson lives in McKinleyville, California and has been an animator, videographer, editor and photographer for twelve years. He studied film and animation at California College of the Arts, and now dedicates much of his time to documenting the ecology of California’s northern coast, and pretending that global warming won’t kill us all. His work has been featured by the BBC Natural History Unit and National Geographic, as well as independent documentaries about the region’s natural history and infrastructure. Growing up in Oakland, he learned how cruel liberal economics and ideology can be to the poor and people of color, moving him to become a social worker and activist before being priced out of the Bay Area.Katy Warner is a McKinleyville-based multimedia artist, specializing in digital printing and screen printing. She grew up in Sacramento, CA and decided to become an artist after receiving a hand-me-down laptop for her 14th birthday. Her life's goal is to illustrate how anyone can become an artist using the wasted and neglected objects our society creates. Her training was in Oakland, CA, receiving her BFA from California College of the Arts in 2009 and her MFA from Mills College in 2013. She is currently a Co-Operator at the Sanctuary, managing their print room and co-supervising their arts programming. She also maintains social media pages for several Humboldt County institutions such as Arts Alive! Humboldt, the Redwood Art Association and the Sanctuary.Laurel Jean is a HumCo transplant from SoCal. She has been writing stories since she could talk (which used to get her into trouble). She studied Creative Writing at Humboldt State University, and graduated in 2013 with a dual MA in Literature and Teaching Writing. Currently she teaches English Composition. She also writes porn and is less embarrassed about that than she is about how she used to write fanfiction. ChallengesThere is only one challenge we face other than taking on the GORM. We (Alan Peterson and Ben Jacob) are going from traditional key frame animating to Motion Capture in Daz 3D. We are expecting a sharp learning curve in the first few weeks, but the latest tech is in our favor. It seems to be as easy as recording the voice artist with an app in iPhone, and using bridging software to translate the motions/expressions into Daz. If at any point we don’t see the mo cap being viable, we can fall back on our traditional key frame animating to see the show through. This may cause a slight delay in release time but we can still get to that finish line either way.  Final WordsThanks for taking the time to read all this and for considering CannaFairies FAEK News as a project to support. We are all passionate about the project and know it will be unique, fun, and educational. We look forward to bringing you the very best in FAEK NEWS!

story:
Hi, we're Olympia Productions, a group of filmmakers and actors from different backgrounds and production companies looking to bring our exciting TV concept to life.

Our writers and producers, Alex Carter (Black For a Cause) and Claire Rose (From Mansfield with Love), have been working on the series plan and scripts since 2015, from a concept by our friend David Green (Out of Bounds Theatre). Now they have gathered a talented creative team to get this show on the road, but we need some funding to get this project going.

 

CLICK HERE TO SUPPORT US ON PAYPAL

 

 

 

Meet the Cast

IMDb/Wikipedia

19-year-old Helen Swann is a demigod, and – unknowingly – Zeus’ daughter. She struggles to balance her studies and social life with keeping her powers under control. Despite her lack of self-confidence, her godly charisma makes her popular, which people are quick to exploit.

IMDb

Formerly king of the gods, Zeus now has no control over the Olympians who are at each other’s throats. He's in a funk, pursuing the temporary highs of drink and sex to remind him of his old life. Zeus has brought the Olympians together, but can he make them a family again?

IMDb

God of the basement apartment, Hades emerges from time to time to bother his brother Zeus. He’s pretty laid back and doesn’t really want to take sides – he is aware he has a reputation as “the evil one”, but doesn’t let anyone know it bothers him.

IMDb

Zeus’ most irritating brother, Poseidon doesn’t live with the Olympians, but he’s constantly haranguing Zeus for money. He aims for a certain lifestyle (yachts, girls, dolphins) and pays for it with money he doesn’t have.

IMDb/YouTube

Goddess of love and beauty, Aphrodite's star has risen in recent years and thus she has a strained relationship with her fellow gods. She runs a popular dating app, longing for the love and admiration she once had.

IMDb

Goddess of wisdom, Athena strives to keep peace between the gods. She is the first to take Helen under her wing, but she’s also the goddess of war, terrifying when she’s angry.

IMDb

Hyperactive psychopomp Hermes hangs around the university, helping people out, but he’s not a student and he doesn’t live with the other Olympians. However, that doesn’t mean he’s not going to get involved in their business.

 

Twitter/Facebook

A former child star, Lucia "Eris" Argento has fallen off the wagon and been sent to uni for rehabilitation. An attention seeker, she has built the persona of “Eris”, tabloid-magnet.

IMDb

A half-nymph senior librarian, PhD student and seer, Tiresias is willing to help people out with their problems… sometimes. Tiresias has a friendly rivalry with Athena, who spends most of her time in the university library as well.

 

 

 

Meet the Crew

 

Director - Darren Power (Manhunt: Kill or be Killed)

Associate Producer - Paulo Rego (Avengers: Age of Ultron, Clash of the Titans)

Director of Photography - Kevin Turner (Manhunt: Kill or be Killed)

Camera - Cassius Clayton (Wasted)

Behind-the-Scenes Camera - Andrew Compton (Wandering)

Sound - Arron Gumbrell (Wasted)

Costume & Photography - Abbie Hills (Fred Dinenage: Murder Casebook)

Hair & Make Up - Larisa Moldovan (Milan Fashion Week, Vogue India)

Editors - Alex Carter (Black For a Cause) and Nate Kiley (Wasted)

Visual Effects - Ben Harker

Music - James Walker

 

 

 

 

 

Where Your Funding Will Go

 

We want to make this the best it can be, and we also want to be able to reimburse everyone involved for their hard work. That is why we need your help to make Olympia a reality.

£1000 will enable us to cover our pre-production: actors' travel to locations, food expenses, hair and makeup, visual effects, music composition and promotional material. Every little helps - even if you can only spare £1.

We have budgeted for a 15-day shoot, as well as contingency days, rehearsal time and post-production, so going forward we won't skimp on the expenses or additional costs needed to bring our world of gods and monsters to life.

This is a high concept project and we want to do justice to the myths and legends we're adapting, to provide you - the audience - with the high-quality experience of a full-budget TV episode! So please donate if you can! And, you can get some great perks too...

 

 

The Perks

 

Witness the making of the pilot. As the Muse of History, you'll have access to special behind-the-scenes updates and fun videos, as well as a written thank you on social media.

 

Our Muse of Comedy backers will receive an all-important digital copy of the pilot episode itself upon completion!

 

As the Muse of Epic Poetry, enjoy a digital album of songs that were written for - and inspired by - the series.

 

Muse of Music backers will receive an additional digital album featuring the Olympia pilot episode's original score by James Walker. Here's a taster!

 

 

A very personal perk. Muse of Hymns backers will be treated to a "Thank You" video from cast and crew, addressed specially to you.

 

Muse of Dance backers get the opportunity to spend a day on set as an extra, meet the cast and crew as we film the pilot, and receive a signed art print to commemorate the occasion!

 

Two lucky Muse of Tragedy backers will each get an exclusive voiceover role in the pilot episode, and join the cast and crew for dinner. You'll also receive a replica "Trojan Horse" branded varsity jacket as worn in the show.

 

Muse of Love Poetry backers can enjoy a night at the theatre! You will be treated to two cinema seats for a special premiere of the pilot episode in London.

 

This perk is out of this world! As the Muse of Astronomy, you will be credited as executive producer (both in the pilot and on IMDb), and have a hand in the future of the series.

 

 

Very Special Thanks

 

Jack Connell • Emrys R. Keim • Kimberley Kotin • Kieran McGarry

Alanna Petty • Theresa Rule • Danny Sanders • Caroline Sax

Joshua Wade • Damon L. Wakes • Out of Bounds Theatre

IMDb

Website

IMDb

IMDb

IMDb

 

 

    The Future of Olympia

     

    The pilot episode itself will be pitched to online and streaming TV distributors, with the support of our existing audience (you!). However, the more we make on this campaign, the more we can make going forward. This series could go far and we can't wait to share it with the world!

     

     

    Risks & Challenges

     

    We will make time to rehearse with the actors before shooting, as well as making risk assessments of locations and scenes. On each shooting day we will view the rushes on field monitors and computers to ensure we have the footage we need to move on, and reduce the need for reshoots.

    Physical locations may change, but they are written in broad enough terms to be able to accommodate potential changes. The pilot has minimal stunts, but following health and safety protocol we will work to ensure that everyone is safe in scenes involving cars and swords.

     

     

    Other Ways You Can Help

     

    We appreciate even the smallest donations, but if there's no way you can contribute monetarily, please share our campaign on your social media, by email, and even in person - with your friends, family and anyone else who may be interested!

     

     

    Motion Posters

     

    Another special thanks and a shout-out to Rich Wysockey for creating our motion posters.

story:
What's This For?

The team at Unworthy Productions need YOUR HELP to continue making the hit web-series PR: Unworthy! The epic conclusion of Episode 2 was just the beginning of a potential SIX PART Season 1, but we need additional funds to make each episode BIGGER and BETTER than the ones before. Read below to find out how you can help:

 

What We Need & What You Get:

Episodes 3 & 4 of PR: Unworthy will feature new heroes, new (but familiar) villains, and require some grandiose locations! As an estimate, we believe $8k would be enough to cover our costs for the additional costumes & sets - but if we manage to raise beyond that, the team will be able to do some cool things like travel to cons out-of-state or even feature fan-favorite villains like Lord Zedd! And if you donate, we've got some cool rewards for you:

  • Your Name in the Credits!
  • Exclusive Shirts
  • Buttons
  • Hats
  • Mini-Prints
  • Posters
  • Digital Downloads
  • Blu Ray Special Editions
  • Helmet Replicas
  • Full Unworthy-style Suits & More!

 

Why It's Important:

With your help we can continue to grow and expand on the Unworthy mythology. We can have more heroes, more villains, IMPROVED costumes, better special FX, better audio and ADR quality and much, much more! Episodes 1 & 2 have been a hit and we want to continue delivering the best fan series possible by improving every episode - but we can't do that without your support!

Your Donation will help us fund:

  • A Rita Repulsa Costume
  • A Divatox Costume
  • An Unworthy Original Time Force Ranger Costume
  • A Canon Time Force Ranger Costume
  • A Young Arbiter Costume
  • Upgrades to our Unworthy Suits
  • DARK RANGER Costumes...
  • Sets & Locations
  • A Lord Zedd Costume (10k Stretch Goal!)

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

If you can't donate, that's fine too! Just share this page with other Ranger Nation fans that can! Every little bit helps lessen the burden on our series creator Jourdan Barnett. He's been funding the costumes and set costs so far and could use all the support we can give him! Let's help make this the best fan series possible! Donate & Share!

story:
Okay, who are we?

We are a group of Western Australian artists who truly want to broaden the horizons of Australian television. Our team consists of passionate filmmakers, actors and just general film enthusiasts!

In our opinion, Australia is severely lacking in television options. Particularly in the genre of supernatural or action. 

That's where we come in! 

We're creating a supernatural detective style series which will be filmed in Western Australia using local talent!

"JJ and Calleigh’s lives were hit with a series of tragic incidents, the first of many which started the chain reaction of events was the death of their parents in a car crash when JJ was 18 and Calleigh was 8. They never stayed in one place for very long after that." ~ writer, Julia Marie Warnes.

The Nitty Gritty

We are looking for a crowdfunding goal of $5000 to help with distribution of our pilot episode and marketing exposure to help with the rest of the series when we come to create it.

If we don't reach our entire goal. we will distribute the gained proceeds evenly throughout the required divisions (camera, catering, marketing, location, etc) so you can rest assured that all of your kind pledges will be used appropriately. 

Can you help in other ways? uh, of course!

If you aren't able to contribute anything then don't fret! We would love to have your support in other ways.

Please share our social media pages to help us gain new followers and fans! 

FACEBOOK

www.facebook.com/DLBTheTVSeries/

INSTAGRAM

www.instagram.com/dont_look_back_2018

TWITTER

www.twitter.com/jjandkaysdiary

Also please share this campaign around with your friends and family to spread the word!!!

story:
Once Upon a Time...

There was a nerdy actress in Los Angeles who realized that her group of friends consisted almost exclusively of professional RPG players and professional princesses. How can you resist a mashup like that?

And here's the good news: We have scripts for 6 more episodes, a full season of Royal RPG (that's role-playing game) antics! And we've already filmed the pilot!  It's full of nerdy, silly shenanigans that we hope to release after the next two episodes are funded.

Here's where you come in, kind stranger/new best friend. We have everything ready to go, but filming a web series takes resources and we need all the help we can get!

All fundraising will go straight to offsetting the costs of production: Renting equipment, locations, paying our hardworking cast and crew, feeding, clothing, and wigging the princesses, dressing the set, etc. This project has been a labor of love by everyone involved, and we just need a little boost to share the full season with you! 

We've Got Gadgets and Gizmos Aplenty...

A shiny RED Camera! Professionally styled, custom wigs! Handmade props and costume pieces!

~We just need some help from our Fairy Godmothers to pay for them~

We were fortunate enough to be able to film the pilot ourselves, but we have 6 more episodes we would love to bring to life. This show means the world to us, and that means we want to make it the best that it can be. We want our princesses to shine!

With that in mind, each episode costs about $10,000 to make. That covers everything from the highest quality equipment and wigs, to competitive compensation for the cast and crew. Here's a breakdown of the expected budget for each episode: 

A Dream is a wish your heart makes...

And we have the power to make those dreams a reality!

At its heart, "Damsels, Dice, and Everything Nice" is about a group of girls getting together to tell their own stories. It has never been a better time to shine a light on a diverse, female ensemble taking charge of their own lives.  It's finally the moment for these princesses to rescue themselves...with a little help from their friends, some magic, and most importantly you!

All we need is Faith, Trust, and a little Pixie Dust...

Donations are delightful and you'll get some super fun perks as a backer for the series, but we understand if you're a little short on gold right now. 

If you can't give us the power of your dollars, please give us the power of your voice (If you haven't already sold it to a sea witch)!

We reside in all the Realms of Social Media, so you can share, like, comment, and subscribe to your heart's content. You can even send links to your friends, coworkers, animal companions, or any bards that you may come across. We also have a website with our sizzle reel, behind the scenes images, and lots of tidbits about our cast and crew.

If you find yourself becoming Curiouser and Curiouser, we invite you to journey down the rabbit hole with us. Roll initiative, the adventure begins soon...

"It's kind of fun to do the impossible"-Walt Disney

It has never been a better time to shine a light on a diverse, female ensemble taking charge of their own lives.  It's finally the moment for these princesses to rescue themselves...with a little help from their friends, some magic, and most importantly you!
All we need is Faith, Trust, and a little Pixie Dust...

Donations are delightful and you'll get some super fun perks as a backer for the series, but we understand if you're a little short on gold right now. 
If you can't give us the power of your dollars, please give us the power of your voice (If you haven't already sold it to a sea witch)!

We reside in all the Realms of Social Media, so you can share, like, comment, and subscribe to your heart's content. You can even send links to your friends, coworkers, animal companions, or any bards that you may come across. We also have a website with our sizzle reel, behind the scenes images, and lots of tidbits about our cast and crew.
If you find yourself becoming Curiouser and Curiouser, we invite you to journey down the rabbit hole with us. Roll initiative, the adventure begins soon...

"It's kind of fun to do the impossible"-Walt Disney

story:
This is gonna' be big!

Vegan Round the World: The Series is the world's first international vegan documentary series. Over the next six months, the Vegan Round the World (VRTW) team will be traveling to over ten countries and capturing inspiring stories from all across the vegan movement. We'll be compiling the footage into five exciting episodes, each covering a unique aspect of the vegan world as we know it!

The vegan movement is one of the fastest growing social justice movements on the planet and it comes at a pivotal time, as we desperately search for a way of living that will lessen our impact on the environment, promote worldwide health, and be kinder to the animals that we share this earth with. The VRTW team is here to inspire viewers by showing them the human side of the vegan movement, while also throwing in some beautiful imagery and comedic relief while we're at it. 

Vegans should get excited because they're going to get to see all of their favorite faces up on the big screen (or whatever screen you've got, size isn't everything) such as Rawvana, Dr. Michael Greger, Mercy for Animals, Dr. Neal Barnard, Jon Venus, Animal Place Sanctuary, VegFest, Chocolate Covered Katie, Vegan Camp-Out UK, and so many more!

And to all the non-vegans out there: don't worry! There will be plenty of fun for you too! This isn't a series about vegans for vegans. It's a series about vegans for everyone! If you've ever wondered how on earth they make "vegan cheese" or what exactly B12 is supposed to do, you've come to the right place!

 

A refresh for the vegan movement.

Let's be real for a second: the vegan movement doesn't exactly have the best image going for it.  Much of the general public is still under the impression that vegans are hippy weirdos who don't wear shoes. We're on a mission to show them that not only are we proud of our non-leather slippers, but that we're having a ton of fun making them too!

We know that to inspire change, we must first inspire. That's been our goal since day one and it will remain that way until the day we hang up our cameras.

Anyone can go on Netflix and watch any number of pro-vegan documentaries covering health, environmental impact, animal rights, etc. However, they'll all scare the socks right off of the viewer and some people just don't react well to that type of information. That's where Vegan Round the World: The Series comes in. We're here to show people the inspiring, human side of the vegan movement. We're here to show the world that this movement is made up of people from all backgrounds and professions and that it's certainly here to stay. 

 

 

 
 

You're right, Dr. Greger; it is crazy. But we're passionate about protecting our ecosystem!

We've partnered with Trees for the Future, a non-profit organization that gives aid to impoverished rural families in Africa and gives them the resources and training to turn their land from infertile and barren to beautiful and filled with trees and crops! For every mile that we drive, fly, or hyperloop (we're waiting, Elon), we'll be making a donation to Trees for the Future to offset our carbon emissions by 100 percent! We will be tracking our monthly donations and sharing all of the juicy details with all of our VRTW Club Members!

But that's not all! Every VRTW backer is also going to receive their very own tree certificate via email! We aren't even going to print them out on paper for you! Think about all of the trees we're saving!

Well, let us explain:

Filming a documentary isn't cheap. There are a lot of moving parts, different people for each job, and the equipment's price tag is enough to raise anyone's voice a few octaves. And if you think that sounds pricey, now just imagine that you're filming a multi-part documentary series and you've gotta drive/fly/Hyperloop (ELON COME ON!) around the globe! CHA-CHING!

But don't worry, our team is made up of efficient travelers that know how to do things on the cheap. 

For example, on our recent East Coast US filming tour, we spent a whopping $0 on accommodation for 8 days. How? Well, we aren't exactly bashful. We sent out a V-blast (similar to the bat signal, but made out of broccoli) to all of our vegan people along our tourstops and they gave us a free place to stay! And we got to make new friends! How cool is that?!

So we've got accommodation taken care of 'round the world, but we still need help with a few things:

Please say hello to our good friend: The Vegan Round the World Funding Pineapple! Over the course of our 30-day campaign, we're going to be keeping track of how much we've funded and we'll be filling up the pineapple with beet juice to show our progress! When it reaches $100k we're fully funded!!! And if we go over we enter into the BONUS ROUND!!!

At $150k, you can do a little dance because we're bringing you an ADDITIONAL action-packed episode that will feature incredible vegan restaurants around the globe! And at the $200k mark?! Oh, no big deal, just prepare yourselves for SEASON TWO!!! If you're wondering why we aren't heading to China, Poland, South America, Belgium or Australia just yet, it's because we're saving the best for season two! Am I right, mates?

 

We're layin' it all on the line.

  1. T-shirts:
    1. Our super-awesome, ultra-soft t-shirts will be made of 100% Organic cotton! For our US backers, the shirts will also be made in a 100% wind-powered factory located in the US and printed using water-based inks. We will try our best to find the most sustainable method of producing shirts in the EU to get them as fast and efficiently as possible out to our backers in those areas.
    2. T-shirts for US backers will be shipped out by July 31st, 2018. EU shirts will ship by September 15th, 2018. 
  2. Tree Certificates:
    1. Your custom tree certificates will be sent out via e-mail by June 15th, 2018. 
  3. Vegan Caribbean Cruise: 
    1. The Ocean Cruise Package includes two tickets to the Holistic Holiday at Sea Caribbean cruise coming up in March of 2019. All of your amazing vegan meals are included. Airfare to Miami, Florida is not included. If you are unable to join the cruise or would prefer another trip compliments of the VRTW team, please reach out to us and we will work something out that's absolutely delightful. Thanks for being our Executive Producer!
  4. Skype Call
    1. The skype call with our director will be 30-minutes in length and no questions are out of bounds. Do your worst! We'll do our best to answer anything you can throw our way!
  5. Signed Copy of How Not to Die or Simple Happy Kitchen:
    1. Signed copies of How Not to Die will ship out by July 31st, 2018 and copies of Simple Happy Kitchen will ship out by October 31st, 2018 after its release in September. 

Check out our amazing custom Vegan Round the World T-Shirt Design! The ink color will be blue on a black shirt, but we're still deciding on the perfect shade :)

1. Plant-Based Health + Athleticism

Featuring Dr. Michael Greger, Chef Charity Morgan, Dr. Neal Barnard, Physicians Committee for Responsible Medicine, STLvegGirl, GreenFare, Cam F Awesome, and Jon Venus!

2. Global Vegan Events

Featuring the most exciting vegan events of 2018 including Vegan Camp-Out UK, The Vegan Food Festival Amsterdam, Eat Drink Vegan, VegFest, and more!

3. Vegan Influencers

Diving into the behind-the-scenes of top names in the vegan content creation world including Rawvana, Chocolate Covered Katie, The Happy Pear, Simple Happy Kitchen, and more!

4. Activism and Awareness

We'll be highlighting the lives of the hardest working activists on the planet, featuring Mercy for Animals, James Aspey, The Save Movement, Anonymous for the Voiceless, The Vegan Society, Melanie Joy, Challenge 22+, Animal Place, and many more!

5. The Vegan Marketplace

If you've ever wondered how humans survive without leather from cows, if lab-grown meat is as terrifying as it sounds, or if cashew cheese actually tastes any good, this is the episode for you. Featuring Heidi Ho Organics, Beyond Meat, New Roots, Corkor, Mosa Meat, and Stray Dog Capital.

6. Bonus Episode! - Top Vegan Restaurants Round the World

We'll give you an inside look at the culinary prowess behind the top names in the vegan culinary world. 

There are so many possibilities!

First off, thank you for your generosity! Even if you aren't able to make a monetary contribution, there are lots of ways that you can help support the series!

  1. Follow us on Instagram!! You can find us @veganroundtheworldtheseries 
  2. Share this campaign on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter! You can even Snapchat about it! Throw up some smoke signals! Do whatever you want! 
  3. Tell your friends about the series! Every extra person that we can get behind this project will help spread the vegan movement further and faster!
  4. Send us pictures of puppies! For real, that will make our day. 

From the bottom of all of our hearts here at Vegan Round the World: The Series, we want to sincerely thank each and every one of our backers, supporters, parents, siblings, flight attendants, vegan chefs, etc etc for being so kind and supportive. We couldn't have made it this far without you!

We're looking forward to seeing you all, well, 'Round the World. 

Where and when can I watch the series?

We plan to release the series on a major subscription platform by Spring 2019, but don’t worry, if you’re part of the VRTW backer’s club, you’ll get awesome behind the scenes footage from all around the world to keep you entertained in the meantime! And don’t forget, if you’re part of the backer’s club, you’re also going to get the pilot episode MONTHS before everyone else! How cool is that?!

So what exactly is the VRTW Backer's Club?

Great Question! The VRTW Backer's Club gets you exclusive access to the behind the scenes as the VRTW team travels the world and meets amazing vegans from all around the globe. We'll be blasting out an email and video update monthly to all of our club members so that they can keep up with our progress and see all the amazing sights!

How can I get involved?

There are so many ways to get involved! First, come and meet us at one of the events we’re filming at! We’d love to see all of your shining faces (that whole lack of dairy thing must be good for the skin)! Tell your friends about us! Share this campaign! It’s as simple as hitting a button and it really does mean the world to us! And if you’re got an an amazing vegan story or company, shoot us a message and we’ll try and get you in the series!

How many people will this reach?

We hope to reach a lot of people! We’re planning on an early 2019 release through a major subscription network while spending all of 2018 gaining a following and spreading the message about the series! We think that because we’re going to be traveling to so many countries over the next six months, we’ll be able to meet lots of people and get some serious hype going!

How much does shipping cost for my sweet, 100% organic, water-based-ink t-shirt that’s made in a wind-powered factory?

Great question and thanks for being so specific! The price for shipping is a flat $5 for within the US, $10 in the EU, and $15 to Israel. Outside of those regions we’re unable to ship t-shirts, but feel free to check out some of our other perk options! If you're somewhere else in the world and really want a shirt (we don't blame you!) shoot us a DM on Instagram about wherabouts and we'll get you a quote!

Where can I stalk you?

Find us on Instagram! You can follow along @veganroundtheworldtheseries - We’re trying to keep the whole social media thing from taking over our lives completely, so we’re just sticking to the Instagram world for now, but we’re sure someone will “strongly advise” that we make a Facebook and Twitter later down the line. Until then, long live minimalism!!!

When are you coming to Australia/Poland/South America/China/Abu Dhabi/Antarctica/etc?

Season one has come together so smoothly that we’d be more than happy to head to every destination on the planet to capture the amazing vegan stories within every region! As promised, if we hit our 200k bonus mark, you can count on a season two heading your way!

When will the pilot episode be released to the members of the VRTW backers club?

We’ll have the VRTW Backers Club early-release episode out by March 2019, so you’ll get to see it before the rest of the world!

Why so many colors?

WE DRANK TOO MUCH COFFEE OKAY, RELAX

Will the VRTW team get enough protein while they travel?

Please stop.

What about B12?

Seriously. Please stop.

story:
Equus:

Healing Through Horses

“A horse is the projection of peoples' dreams about themselves - strong, powerful, beautiful - and it has the capability of giving us escape from our mundane existence.”  ~Pam Brown

 I have spent the last 7 years in the Equine Facilitated Wellness (EFW) field, motivated by a passion to create opportunities for people to become their best selves, heal old wounds and experience peace in the presence of the horse. There is a need for the work to be known in order to inspire more research and funding and increase accessibility for individuals who would benefit from connecting with the horse

My fiance, John Fulton, is an experienced filmmaker and photographer. We knew when we met that we had an important project to do together. With the combination of my EFW experience and his media talents, we are creating a documentary series about the ways people and horses come together to heal.

We want to validate the benefits and possibilities of working with horses with a wide population of people. There are many people around the world working in a variety of ways with horses that are having profoundly positive impacts. We will interview the innovative leaders and showcase the research that is validating the effectiveness of this work. We will highlight new developments in the field and discuss ethical considerations. There are many people working in isolation because of the nature of the work being time consuming and typically being  in a rural setting. We see this project as way to connect and create more transparency and community within the EFW field. We want people to no longer view horses as an alternative or last resort to typical office based therapies, but as an effective and innovative form of healing that stands on it's own and is worthy of more research. 

The topics we will cover include:

PTSD/Trauma- We will interview trauma therapists working with horses, the somatic and neuroscience research, and people working with war veterans and horses

Energy Healing- We will delve into the world of energy healing covering Reiki, Body Talk and Intuitive healing. We will interview cancer survivors who have worked with horses to aide in their healing.

Seniors- We will highlight a program in the USA that is incorporating horses into the seniors center. We will also interview university researchers that are finding benefits of working with horses for people with Dementia and Alzheimer's.

Children and Youth- The use of Art Therapy within EFW will be explored through interviews with child and youth practitioners. We explore the benefits of doing ground and mounted work as well as working with Aboriginal Populations.

Leadership- Branching out of the mental health related work, leadership can be applied to organizations and corporations of any size. We will interview some of the women who have developed unique leadership frameworks for our modern world.

Mounted Work- We will demonstrate how EFW is different than therapeutic riding. We will interview practitioners who are using mounted work to assist in self regulation and trauma therapy as well as Journey Rides and spiritual practices.

Ethics- The field of EFW is relatively small and a conversation about ethics, accessibility, privilege and power does not always happen with fear of being ostracized from the community. We will uncover some of the stories of misuse of power and abuse with the hopes of creating more safety and accessibility within the field.

Addiction- We will interview facilitators who are working with people in recovery and why working within nature and with the horse has been more effective than traditional office setting counselling.

The Plan

We will be traveling to interviews within Canada, USA and Australia. We are currently working from our home base on Gabriola Island, a small island off the coast of British Columbia. We will keep costs low by travelling in our little van as much as possible and using our own equipment. We are doing all our own production including filming, editing, music composing and media campaign. The funds will be used to purchase equipment, travel costs, and time for editing.

What We Need and Where It Will Go

We are seeking $15,000 to help us launch the first stage of this project. We are keeping costs low by traveling in our van- which saves money on accommodations and air fair. We have been offered free accommodation at many of the interview sites we are travelling to which will also saves on costs. We will be driving from our little island on the west coast of Canada through Alberta and Ontario into the USA to Virginia, North Carolina, California, Arizona and Washington. We will need to invest in new audio recorders, a gimble and a new camera lens. The money will also go towards the editing time and distribution costs. 

Risks and Challenges

The Impact

By donating money you will be joining us in creating the first ever documentary series to shed light on the ways in which horses help us to become our best selves. If you are unable to contribute through a donation please help us to spread the word on this important project through social media by sharing our campaign page. Horses have carried us for centuries through wars, fields and new territories. Let’s capture and document how they are now carrying us into new ways of being, relating to one another and connecting in our world.

There are many people working in isolation because of the nature of the work being time consuming and typically being  in a rural setting. We see this project as way to connect and create more transparency and community within the EFW field. We want people to no longer view horses as an alternative or last resort to typical office based therapies, but as an effective and innovative form of healing that stands on it's own and is worthy of more research. The topics we will cover include:PTSD/Trauma- We will interview trauma therapists working with horses, the somatic and neuroscience research, and people working with war veterans and horsesEnergy Healing- We will delve into the world of energy healing covering Reiki, Body Talk and Intuitive healing. We will interview cancer survivors who have worked with horses to aide in their healing.Seniors- We will highlight a program in the USA that is incorporating horses into the seniors center. We will also interview university researchers that are finding benefits of working with horses for people with Dementia and Alzheimer's.Children and Youth- The use of Art Therapy within EFW will be explored through interviews with child and youth practitioners. We explore the benefits of doing ground and mounted work as well as working with Aboriginal Populations.Leadership- Branching out of the mental health related work, leadership can be applied to organizations and corporations of any size. We will interview some of the women who have developed unique leadership frameworks for our modern world.Mounted Work- We will demonstrate how EFW is different than therapeutic riding. We will interview practitioners who are using mounted work to assist in self regulation and trauma therapy as well as Journey Rides and spiritual practices.Ethics- The field of EFW is relatively small and a conversation about ethics, accessibility, privilege and power does not always happen with fear of being ostracized from the community. We will uncover some of the stories of misuse of power and abuse with the hopes of creating more safety and accessibility within the field.Addiction- We will interview facilitators who are working with people in recovery and why working within nature and with the horse has been more effective than traditional office setting counselling.The PlanWe will be traveling to interviews within Canada, USA and Australia. We are currently working from our home base on Gabriola Island, a small island off the coast of British Columbia. We will keep costs low by travelling in our little van as much as possible and using our own equipment. We are doing all our own production including filming, editing, music composing and media campaign. The funds will be used to purchase equipment, travel costs, and time for editing.What We Need and Where It Will GoWe are seeking $15,000 to help us launch the first stage of this project. We are keeping costs low by traveling in our van- which saves money on accommodations and air fair. We have been offered free accommodation at many of the interview sites we are travelling to which will also saves on costs. We will be driving from our little island on the west coast of Canada through Alberta and Ontario into the USA to Virginia, North Carolina, California, Arizona and Washington. We will need to invest in new audio recorders, a gimble and a new camera lens. The money will also go towards the editing time and distribution costs. Risks and ChallengesThe ImpactBy donating money you will be joining us in creating the first ever documentary series to shed light on the ways in which horses help us to become our best selves. If you are unable to contribute through a donation please help us to spread the word on this important project through social media by sharing our campaign page. Horses have carried us for centuries through wars, fields and new territories. Let’s capture and document how they are now carrying us into new ways of being, relating to one another and connecting in our world.

story:
CROSSROADS STATION now RETURNS TO LIFE

What started as a proof-of-concept 7 minute production is now getting the fuller-length treatment. With more planning days, more shooting days, and more post-production days, we will bring you deeper into this post-apocalyptic/sci-fi/fantasy world where bands of Destroyers seek only to pillage and kill, while the diminished Returners fight to restore the land. Innocent villagers are caught in the middle, all while the vicious, mutant Berserkers threaten to turn up at any time!

Crossroads Station is the title of the pilot episode for the web series Return To Life.

Many of the cast and crew are returning for this project, some to reprise their roles, and some to play in new ones.

story:
What's the plan?

TLDR: Install New Head Giveaway Current Performance Head

If you don't know who I am, my name is Cole Gentry and I run the Classic Mini Cooper DIY youtube channel called Classic Mini DIY. I have run this channel, making DIY videos explaining how to work on your Classic Mini Coopers for almost 3 years.  In that time I have gone over everything from oil changes to engine rebuilds. Today I want to tell you about the next big project!

I want to replace the standard 1275 cylinder head with a brand new fuel injected cross-flow head.

What I Need & What You Get

To complete the project I will need to raise money to purchase the following parts:

  • A brand new Specialist Components aluminum crossflow 7-port head
  • Intake and injector system for fueling the motor
  • Timing system for determining firing times
  • ECU management system to bring all the above components together

Check out the link to Specialist Components Site here: 

  • https://cmdiy.co/7porthead

As a backer and a supporter of this project you will get:

  • A hyper-detailed video series explaining exactly how to accomplish this on your own car
  • Multiple episodes showing the ins and outs of the 1275 motor and what it's like working on your own engine.
  • A chance to win the "old" performance head I take off my classic mini($1300 value).
    • High flow big valves
    • Ported intake 
    • Professionally machined
  • One of the various perks available on this campaign!
This is a huge undertaking but if you have ever seen my channel and the things I do, I never do it half-a**ed and I always see a project through to completion. Well except the rally dash but we will just ignore that one!

story:
*Who we are

The cast and crew of B-City Season 2 come from a variety of backgrounds and experiences that will ensure that the series is a continued success.

Jolie East-Miji (Creator, Writer, Director, Producer):

Born and raised in Baltimore City, Jolie is a graduate of Stevenson University with a Bachelor of Science in  Film/Video.  After falling in love with writing and film at the young age of twelve, it continues to be her passion today. Her motto is “entertain with a purpose” and her goal is to tell the real life stories of everyday people both on the screen and stage

 

*The Crew "Tayari Productions"

                                                                                                        Tayari Productions is a Baltimore based production     company founded in 2013 by cousins Jae Mitch and Scola . The company has it’s hands in all genres of cinematography ranging from commercials to film. The production team and crew are also comprised of a diverse group of individuals- many also have full-time jobs outside of film making. Overall, the crew is a group of motivated, positive individuals that is looking to further develop our vision and expand our passion for visual storytelling to involve community outreach and opportunities for youth.

 

*SERIES OVERVIEW

B-City follows four  childhood friends who live in Baltimore City as they carry out their everyday lives and relationships through hysterical and sometimes complex situation. Hailed the guy version of the show ‘Girlfriends’ wrapped with in "4 Brothers", each character in the series has their own unique personality which seems to get them both in and out of predicaments with each other and in their own lives.In its second season, the series will be even bigger and go deeper into the lives of our four main male characters and the people who surround their everyday lives.

 

*4 Childhood Friends*

Richey Wiser "C.J"( Top left) Rick Palmer Jr. "Pritti"( Top right) Chris Debord "Tone" (Bottom left) Mandela  Brown " Brandon" (Bottom right)

 

Season 2: "Hard Pasts Makes a Brighter Future"

B-City returns after season one, and digs deeper into the main characters' pasts. Each character has a unique situation that makes them stronger and better for the future. Season 2 focuses on Pritti, who, after being embarrassed by his mother at an important event at the end of season 1,  slowly spirals out of control throughout the course of the season, bringing up past wounds and secrets. Season 2 delves into new and established  topics such as Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder, drug abuse, and sexuality.

Read more about the first season of B-City in the series’ feature article in blacktalent.tv: http://blacktalent.tv/2017/01/20/look-whos-next...

 

*PROJECT TIMELINE

Pre-Production (Present- September 2017): acquisition of financing, and securing locations, talent, and crew

Production (September 2017-March 2018): filming of the 7 episodes over the course of 17 shoot days (estimated). Filming will take place September 2017-November 2017, and February 2018-March 2018

Post-Production (March 2018- 12/2018): Editing, sound design, and scoring of the episodes in the season

Release (01/19- tentative): B-City Season 2 will begin to be released for public viewing

story:
Last year Matt and Mike drove 5000 miles across the country, hitting 12 cities in 8 days and reconnected with 22 Marines. While that trip was both epic and at times grueling because of the amount of driving each day, we had a blast. Those videos are posted on our Facebook page and tell the story of our time while out on the road.

This time when we hit the road, we will be taking things to the next level. Because our network has grown since the last time we were out, this will allow us to stop in and connect with other Marines that follow our page. As we are looking at the map and plotting out our route we are getting excited about some of the things that we have planned along the way.

Just like last season, we will be producing a video for each stop along our way. We will also be utilizing the power of social media to go "live" on Facebook at a predetermined time. That way you will be able to catch up with us in real time and see what we are up to. You may possibly even be able to throw out any ideas for us while we are out.

Once we complete the trip is when we will go deep into the post production world and start with all the editing that will need to take place. Then we will be posting the videos to our Leatherneck Reconnect Facebook page for our fans.

If you're able to make a contribution we would really appreciate it and we look forward to sharing our stories with all of you.

story:
What We Need & What You Get

All donations will go toward a 16-day shoot which is reflected in the following breakdown:

Production expenses: 45,250

Expenses include market rate compensation for actors/crew, equipment rental, location fees, permits, etc.

Post-production expenses: 3,500

Expenses include rights/acquisitions for music, market rate compensation for crew, etc.

Administrative expenses: 6,250

Expenses include production/workers compensation/errors & omissions insurance, accounting fees, web hosting, etc.

 

In the event we do not reach our goal, all funds will go exclusively to the filmmaking process. Other costs will be absorbed as best as possible.

As a thank you for your contribution you will get one or more of our unique perks!

  • Public recognition via social media and/or series website.
  • An exclusive preview link to "The Park" to see the first season before we make it public.
  • “The Park”-branded merchandise, such as stickers, t-shirts, tote bags and autographed posters
  • Film credit

The Impact

This series is bigger than any of its creators. We crafted a story with a lot of community input and love and we’re driven to make sure their story is told right. By donating, you’re helping us do the following for our first season:

  • Furthering the diverse representation of artists in Chicago’s film industry: Over 90% of the roles in our pilot episode featured actors of color. We are excited to follow in the footsteps of many other wonderful content creators in Chicago who are strengthening the medium by telling new, fresh and vital stories.
  • Free online distribution via Vimeo: our goal is to provide a high-quality, accessible and relevant story. It is the highest priority that this series remain available for anybody with an internet connection.
  • Strengthening the voice of our outreach partners: This series would not have been possible without the trust and honesty of various groups devoted to violence prevention work in Chicago. By funding this series, you are helping to bring attention to work that is increasingly underreported in our city.

Risks & Challenges

Every filmmaker undertakes an inherently expensive task to do this work well. We made it through the production of our pilot episode with very limited resources and we're going to make due with whatever we get. If we have to scale down our vision, so be it. The Park is THAT important to us.  We're dreaming big here.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate financially, it doesn’t mean that you aren’t part of our community! Please share our work and let people know what it is we are working for.  This show is bigger than us and we’re dedicated to doing what we can to ensure the message behind the story gets out. Please use the share tools on Indiegogo and let people know what we have been up to and what we’re trying to accomplish!
