story:
Short Summary

Episode One (Pilot) - “Invasion”
Invasion is happening.  From what?  No one knows for sure at first.  Tony, Ashley, and Mikayla join Adam and Laura at Adam’s house.  At first, there are various news reports from around the country.  Reports of mysterious Men In Black appearing out of nowhere and snatching up loved ones.  Our small group thinks they're safe.  That is until one of those Men In Black shows up on their doorstep.  Ruthless and methodical it will stop at nothing until it achieves its objective.  What is the objective?   You'll have to contribute to our ENCOUNTER campaign to find out. 

We plan to use this pilot episode as part of an overall pitch pack for a series with episodes in the 30-minute range---much like Black Summer on Netflix.   We have a total of ten episodes outlined and will be pushing hard to have Encounter available on streaming platforms.   We will also be entering Encounter into the film festival circuit and our overall funding ask includes film festival submissions.  But to do all of this we need YOUR HELP.  So please scroll down and learn more about our CAST and CREW and how you can make a difference and help us achieve our goal.  Thank you!! 

Follow Us

http://www.facebook.com/Encounter-Movie-333024040729502/

http://www.instagram.com/encounter_series_2019/

Say Hello To Our Cast

Kaci Sue Hinds is a young actress who has been involved in many projects including, theater, film, print, commercial and a web series, and is most recently known for her work in the 2017 short film, ‘Fracture’ in which she won the title of Best Leading Actress at the Best Shorts Film Festival in 2017.  Kaci is an advocate and supporter of the fight to end human trafficking slavery and has recently been featured in many news stories nationally and internationally.

  

Delno Ebie started in Shakespeare's Richard II and has performed in some 40+ plays since.  He has been in many films like Walt Disney Pictures “The Haunted Mansion”, “Intolerable Cruelty”, “Wichita” and “Violet” for which he won BEST ACTOR at The Gallop Film Festival.  Delno is the father of a teenage son with Down Syndrome, married for 16 years, a cancer survivor, and...a Ballroom and Latin dancer.

Thomas Martin Hanks brings a new face to a familiar name to those who know movies.  We say he's the flip side of the same coin.   A regular on stage and in local films, Thomas brings a depth and grounded realism to each character he plays.

Deonde Crawford aka Mr 316 has been doing comedy and acting since 2009.  Has shared the stage with notables Hope Flood, Luenell Campbell, and Tiffany Haddish.  And in movies with James Brolin and Pattie Smythe.  He brings his versatility from the stage to the big screen with confidence.  This project is one of many in the works. 

Our Crew

Micah Dennis

Writer, Director, Producer

Micah Dennis is a writer, producer, and director.  His work includes the feature film Pearl (writer/director) that is currently available on Amazon Prime with over 6 million views worldwide, and the sequel, Pearl 2 is currently filming now.  The award-winning web series, Mind Games (writer), and the web series Loose Ends (writer, director).  Micah graduated from the Fine Arts Academy of Wichita High School West in 2007.   He is married to his wife, Lavielle, of 10 years and has three children.  Micah is involved in his home church, Revelation Ministries Christian Church, and plays both acoustic and bass guitar.

   Delno Ebie

    Producer

As you read above, Delno has been in a number of movies both large and small and has enjoyed each.  He's also been a producer on several and has enjoyed that process as well.  He and writer/director Micah Dennis have worked on several projects together and they are excited to help bring this one to life.

What We Need & What You Get

Production and Post-Production:

  • Paying the cast and crew for their work.  Making a film/pilot is extremely hard work and time-consuming no matter how small or big that project is.  We've worked many productions for free and feel that if we're going to ask people to give of their talents and give of their time then they should be compensated.   We also plan on doing the film festival circuit to build up word of mouth and gain the results we have set for ourselves.
  • Some of the great perks we're offering is a meet and greet with the cast and director via Skype or Facebook.  An exclusive personal comedy show with Mr. 316 himself, Deonde Crawford.   A Ballroom and Latin dance lesson with lead actor Delno Ebie, and much more. 
  • All funds will go toward production no matter what.

Risks & Challenges

With any venture comes a challenge and a certain amount of risk.   But the team we've assembled has award-winning actors and writers who've been in the business for many years and who have worked indie and Hollywood productions.  So the risks and challenges are greatly diminished because of this.  A perfect example of experience winning out.  We also are planning out exactly what we need and how we're going to execute that plan, so our time and money are used in an efficient way. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Spread the word and make some noise about our ENCOUNTER campaign across all the media and social media platforms you belong to.  Word of mouth is always helpful and we would greatly appreciate your help in getting the word out.  Use the Indiegogo share tools and make a difference.

All funds will go toward production no matter what.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:
Spread the word and make some noise about our ENCOUNTER campaign across all the media and social media platforms you belong to.  Word of mouth is always helpful and we would greatly appreciate your help in getting the word out.  Use the Indiegogo share tools and make a difference.

story:
OVERVIEW

Seeking Refuge is a four-episode digital series exploring the lives of four female refugees living in the city of Toronto. Inspired by M. Émeraude Domingos-Mbuku's documentary, It's a Little Complicated, which focused on her mother's journey to Scarborough, Ontario, Canada from Kinshasa, in the Democratic Republic of Congo (formerly Zaïre), Seeking Refuge aims to emphasize female immigrants, migrants, and refugees and create a space for them to tell their stories in their own words. In sitting down with these women and giving them a platform to talk about their experiences, we are giving them an opportunity to teach Canadian citizens about the immigration/refugee process and open doors for honest dialogue. Women have always been a viable source of information. As of late, it has become commonplace for women to remain silent when talking about themselves or the traumas they have endured. We are looking to connect people through poignant storytelling.

 

 

THE BUDGET

Our fundraising goal of $3,000 will help with the production and post-production of the digital series. The largest portion of our budget will pay for the equipment needed to produce the work. But there are other expenses, like transportation costs, equipment rental insurance, food/catering, honorariums that we need to cover. If we’re unable to reach our funding goal, we will have to cut back on our filming schedule, and cut other costs impacting the quality of our work. 

But this campaign is both give and take. We have perks that kick in at different contribution levels - including social media shout outs and having your name in the end credits as a supporter or an associate producer! However, it doesn't really matter what you contribute because each amount helps us get closer to our goal. 
 

 

THE TEAM

Seeking Refuge's executive team is comprised of four filmmakers, one journalist, two multidisciplinary artists, a makeup artist, and a photographer. They are: 
 

M. Émeraude Domingos-Mbuku - Director  
M. Émeraude Domingos-Mbuku is a Toronto-based filmmaker and writer. As the daughter of an African refugee, she uses film as a medium to discuss Black and African womanhood in popular culture and inter-sectional feminism (Africana womanism) in the age of social media. Émeraude has been featured in Reel Honey Magazine, The Eyeopener, and The Newspaper. Her first documentary film, It’s a Little Complicated, inspired her to further pursue narratives on female refugees living in Toronto, allowing them to tell their stories in their own words. She has presented and participated in panels and incubators including CHATBOUT – A Conversation on Femininity, The Body & (Mis)representation and the CineFan Feature Film Incubator. Émeraude recently graduated from Ryerson University with a Master of Fine Arts.
 

Klasha Fernandes - Sound 
Klasha Fernandes is a South Asian artist and filmmaker based in Toronto. She primarily works with video, creating works that focus on colonization, capitalism, and LGBTQ issues, examining their effects on the personal. Her projects are inspired by individual stories that speak to larger structures of power that define the realities people are often bound by. She is a recent graduate from the MFA Documentary Media program at Ryerson University.


Tameesha Holder - Producer
Tameesha Holder is a Toronto based Independent Producer and Community Organizer. She is an Undergraduate Student at the University of Toronto pursuing a Bachelor of Arts in Women and Gender Studies and New Media Studies. She works with people throughout the community with diverse needs by managing and producing their passion projects such as artists' events and installations, panel discussions and workshops. Tameesha is a 2018 Equity and Diversity in the Arts grant recipient from the University of Toronto Scarborough for her work in community arts. She is also a 2019 CUE Arts Grant recipient which supported her coproduction of the zine GOLD LINES MY PUSSY, featured in the Stick it to the Man Exhibition at the MOEG Gallery in September 2019.  Her work focuses on creating safe spaces for youth, telling the stories of racialized women and their experiences with sexuality, identity, systemic barriers and marginalization living in the Greater Toronto Area.
 

Gaëlle Kosi-Mbuku - Production Assistant 
Gaëlle Kosi-Mbuku is a Toronto-based journalist and YouTuber. Her YouTube pages boasts thousands of views per episode and has made her one of the staple Toronto-based Congolese journalists in the city. She has worked at Cityline and recently hosted Fally Ipupa's concert in Toronto, Canada. She studied at Seneca College where she majored in Broadcast Journalism.


Annum Shah - Colour
Annum Shah is a multimedia artist whose work explores personal narratives, with an emphasis on the ways in which race, gender, and landscape form identity. Using film, photography, and writing as her main mediums, she sifts through family archives and individual testimony to question notions of place and belonging, as experienced by the South Asian diaspora. Annum’s interest in material memory and family histories extends from her own lived experiences. 
 

Evelyn Pakinewatik - Director of Photography
From Nipissing First Nation, Evelyn Pakinewatik is a filmmaker of Ojibwe and Irish descent. A self-taught writer, director, producer, and editor, Evelyn is a 2018 TQFF New IndigiQueer Fellow (Toronto, ON), 2018 ImagineNative Sovereign Bodies | Healthy Nations Fellow (Toronto, ON), 2018 Reelworld E20 Fellow (Toronto, ON), 2019 Big Sky NFI Fellow (Missoula, MT), and a 2019 4th World Media Lab Fellow (Seattle, WA and Camden, ME). Evelyn has spoken at academic institutions such as OCADU and Cornell University, and their work has screened at festivals such as ImagineNative, Présence autochtone, and Maoriland. Evelyn is also an artist and co-administrator with the Chinimiwin Collective, teaching traditional Indigenous textile and nature arts in community since childhood.


Kourtnie Forbes - Lights 
Kourtnie Forbes is a freelance photographer who strives to create dynamic and compelling imagery. Her travel work has been featured in Wanderous Affair Magazine and she has also led multiple e-commerce branding campaigns for The Bunny Tail. Kourtnie has attended Laurentian University for Communication Studies and Humber College for Creative Photography. 
 

Lizeth Montoya - Editor
Lizeth Montoya is a photographer turned filmmaker from Monterrey, Mexico. In 2012 she was part of Programa de Fotografía Contemporánea PFC’12, a Mexico-based multidisciplinary program that focused on exploring photography as an artistic medium. Lizeth has received additional training in the International Center of Photography and the School of Visual Arts in New York, New York. She is interested in exploring various topics that explore human vulnerability through a poetic and intimate approach. She is a recent graduate from the MFA in Documentary Media program at Ryerson University.
 

Eren Bentsel - Makeup 
Eren is a makeup artist located in Toronto, Ontario. She  graduated from CMU College of Makeup Arts & Design where she learned special effects makeup, beauty makeup, hair, and prosthetic application. 


 

*Crew illustrations by Evelyn Pakinewatik

story:
Who I am

I am simply the vessel for life-changing, peace-building wisdom to come through...Our world needs to rise up and come together right now, don't you think? The Power of 10 shows us the way.

What We Need & What You Get

We need at least $15,000 for Black Rock Entertainment to film and produce the pitch pilot to get us on the air. Check out our awesome Perks!

The Impact

This show will have a positive impact on humanity by demonstrating how we can all learn to manifest a full, abundant life  and allow that prosperity to flow over by giving generously. We are all connected, and by giving to others we receive ample more in this ever-expanding holographic universe that we all share. Carl Jung taught that what you focus on expands, and even grows! When you fight the power, you add power to the fight. Want to do something positive toward peace and understanding? Help us out. Check out our website at www.WeAreThePowerOf10.com (and connect with us on social media) and see if our messages are something you resonate with and can support. We appreciate the love...

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share our campaign with positive, like-minded, high-vibing friends and family! You can also sponsor us through product placement. Contact us to learn more.

story:
AWAY is a scripted dramedy that tells the story of LA transplant Nilay Dannon, an introverted aspiring photographer, as she navigates the reality of being black, queer, and female in a world where those labels constantly clash.

Nilay, being a three-striker minority, is a walking political statement with absolutely no desire to be a part of the political scene. On the surface she represents your average twenty something living on her own for the first time: Clueless about “the real world.” Love is something she learned about on the radio. And that art degree she’s spent four years earning isn’t going to much use. Set in summer 2016, a time of political and social unrest, Nilay is swept into the unfamiliar world of activism, which for the first time forces her outside of herself. As she tries to keep her mind from falling victim to the seductive Los Angeles party scene, those around her continue to challenge her ideology, sexuality, and overall purpose, making Nilay question exactly where she fits in.

This story differs from similar predecessors because it is seen through the rare lens of a young, black, QWOC (queer woman of color). Blackness, femininity, and sexuality are themes that layer this story and each character throughout. AWAY uses a sarcastic and nonchalant tone because it mirrors everyday cycles of internal conflict we have within ourselves.

Tiffany Patterson (Writer/Director)

Tiffany is a dreamer hailing from the slums of New Jersey. She is destined to be a hero but is barely conquering the saga of her early twenties. While studying Film & Media Arts at Temple University, Tiffany enrolled in Temple’s Los Angeles Study Away program for one semester. She was a development intern for Di Novi Pictures and Rubicon Entertainment and fell in love with the city. After graduating Temple University she made the cross country move to Los Angeles. Since then she’s completed two other internships with Aperture Entertainment and Momentum TV. Rooted in the world of screenwriting, AWAY will be Tiffany’s first project as Writer and Director.

Cari Smith (Executive Producer)

Cari is an Independent Producer hailing from the windy city of Chicago. She is a graduate of Columbia College Chicago. After graduating from Columbia a semester early, she moved to Los Angeles to launch her career. While living in LA for the past two years, Cari has had the opportunity to intern for Aperture Entertainment and later worked as a page for CBS. Currently, Cari is an office manager and bookkeeper at a Marketing Agency.

Unique Jenkins (as Nilay Dannon)

Born and raised in Los Angeles. Unique was trained at the LACC Theatre Academy Three Year Conservatory. She has been in multiple commercials and Prints such as This Free Life, Facebook, Truth Orange, Soundcloud Go, Ad Council, MeUndies, Snapchat, Stuzo Clothing, Curve Magazine, Afropelle Magazine and many more. Along with films and web series with Black&Sexy TV, Mousara, 5 Black People You Meet In College, Humulious and many more.

Isayah Phillips (as Duran)

"Born and raised in Milwaukee, WI. Isáyah first found his love for acting when he played Nat Turner in Robert O' Hara's Insurrection: Holding History at Georgetown University. He completed his Bachelor of Science in Foreign Service and knew right after that acting was his calling to change the world. Isáyah is based in Los Angeles and plans on continuing to transcend his acting craft while also challenging minds, sparking discourse, and opening hearts through the mediums of films, commercials, television, and beyond."

Lindsay Daniels (as Zye Brown)

Hailing from our Nation's capital of politics and Mumbo sauce, Lindsay is pumped and thankful to be a part of AWAY. She's been West Coast vibe-ing the last two years after having lived in Philadelphia for six years where she earned a BFA in acting from the University of the Arts and performed in plays, participated in readings and appeared in a couple short films. Lindsay also has a strong appreciation for the culinary arts and 90s pop culture which she is happy to reminisce about at any time.

Christopher Edouard Blanchard (as Kyle Flowers)

Chris is a Haitian American actor born in Ft. Lauderdale, Florida t  Christopher always had a passion for acting since he was six. If there had been a club, audition or an event related to drama; Christopher would and will participate. Blanchard had once ran into Academy award winning Actor, Tommy lee Jones, who had given him advice to take private classes, join drama programs, and some tips for auditioning for major roles and Christopher did just that. Then a huge opportunity came to Chris’s attention in 2008. He wanted to travel to Hollywood to participate in the, “Young Actors Camp”.  They taught how to audition (commercial, cold read etc.), memorize a script, projecting his voice while auditioning, preparing for an audition everything that a serious actor needs to know and have. At the age of 22, Christopher decided to move to LA with the support of parents and begin pursuing the art professionally.

Briza Covarrubias (as Gabriella Ruiz)

Briza is an Latinx actor and LA Native. She has dedicated her career to performance and activism. She began performing when she was in elementary school in Mexican ballet folklorico and her love of the stage never ceased to exist. She went on to train in ballet, jazz, musical theater and landed her first lead role in her high school play when she was 15. She was always active in social justice groups and as she attended CSULB, she promised to change career paths to the non-profit realm in order to help others. Little did she know that she would find “Theater of the Oppressed” (created by Agusto Boal), where using theater can help create safe solutions to social conflicts. Her love of social theater was born. She now works for social theater group Pure Praxis whom conducts sexual assault prevention training for the military, pursues acting career in Los Angeles and is actively producing work that tells stories of adversity and perseverance within communities.

Aside from backing the campaign, the most valuable thing you can do for this project is share it on your social media. That’s where most people find out about Indiegogo campaigns! You can directly share this campaign to Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and other platforms with the icons at the bottom of this page.

Thank You for taking the time to help make this a reality.

story:
THE STORY BEHIND THE STORY

 

  • THE STORY SYNOPSIS: You'll never get enough of this new romantic web series! Everyone has one and this is his... Learn THE STORY of a man who has loved and lost before. CHARLES LAWSON finds himself living in the memory of a love he never had the chance to live. But when LISA NICHOLSꟷa new love with a story of her ownꟷenters his life, only time will tell if she can change all that and more?

 

  • PROJECT PURPOSE/MISSION: Written, created and produced by Kyle Connor McDuffie, this project will have it all including suspense, intrigue, lust, love and more all acted out by an incredibly talented and DIVERSE cast!​

 

  • LONG OVER DUE: African American,  males aren’t represented as LEADS in primetime television or films. More often than not, they’re ONLY given the opportunity to play the following roles:
    1. Victim of police brutality
    2. Absentee father
    3. Gangster
    4. Comedic side kick/best friend
    5. Prison inmate

Years ago, African American men were represented in a positive light that inspired many serving as role models for younger African American men. Examples include:

  • BOOMERANG
  • LOVE JONES
  • LOVE AND BASKETBALL
  • MOHAGANY
  • THE WOOD

 

  • PROJECT VISION: “After the laughter, tears, drama, suspense  and smoke clears, I’m hoping our audience will see how important it is for us to love again regardless of our differences. I just want people to see a love story where the boundaries of race and other differences do not exist.” - Kyle Connor McDuffie

 

  • ​ABOUT THE CAST: “My cast is very diverse and although diversity and inclusion is very important to me, it wasn’t the driving force. Each character breakdown was open for all ethnicities to apply. I was looking for actors who could embody the characters with their individual presence and provide a natural realism that would work well with the cast as a whole body.”- Kyle Connor McDuffie

 

  • # OF EPISODES PER SEASON: 13
  • RUNNING LENGTH TIME PER EPISODE: 15-20 minutes
  • VIEWING PLATFORM: THE STORY website and YouTube (both under construction)
  • SOCIAL MEDIA PLATFORMS:
    1. Instagram: @TheStory_WebSeries
    2. Twitter: @StoryWebSeries

LONG OVER DUE: African American,  males aren’t represented as LEADS in primetime television or films. More often than not, they’re ONLY given the opportunity to play the following roles:
Victim of police brutality
Absentee father
Gangster
Comedic side kick/best friend
Prison inmate

Years ago, African American men were represented in a positive light that inspired many serving as role models for younger African American men. Examples include:
BOOMERANG
LOVE JONES
LOVE AND BASKETBALL
MOHAGANY
THE WOOD
 
PROJECT VISION: “After the laughter, tears, drama, suspense  and smoke clears, I’m hoping our audience will see how important it is for us to love again regardless of our differences. I just want people to see a love story where the boundaries of race and other differences do not exist.” - Kyle Connor McDuffie
 
​ABOUT THE CAST: “My cast is very diverse and although diversity and inclusion is very important to me, it wasn’t the driving force. Each character breakdown was open for all ethnicities to apply. I was looking for actors who could embody the characters with their individual presence and provide a natural realism that would work well with the cast as a whole body.”- Kyle Connor McDuffie

story:
Short Summary

Once upon a time some friends thought it would be fun to film a cooking show, so they did. It was so much fun that they want to do it some more. The idea is for hosts Donnie Price and Paula Reynolds to welcome a different artist every episode. Singers, songwriters, musicians- they all have recipes to share and stories to tell. Director/Executive Producer Taylor Price has assembled a team of some of Texas' most talented professionals to assure that those sights and sounds are presented in the highest quality, and many of your favorite artists are excited to get in the kitchen with us.

 

What We Need

We are crowdfunding for the final goal of $25,000 to shoot at least three episodes of Texas Cookin'  to edit down into a sizzle reel to send to networks and perspective sponsors.

Here is the breakdown:

With these funds we will hire a crew of professionals and acquire the best equipment possible to showcase the talented musical guests, and also procure the rights to the songs performed each episode. Also, we will pay for studio and artist fees to re-cut the Texas Cookin'  theme song with some of Texas' best musicians; including a few Grammy winners. On top of that we will cover the costs for food and wine each episode as well as paying our talented guest artists for their time.

 

Meet the Team

Donnie Price
Host/ Creator

Donnie Price is a Texas native and a Hill Country musician who has played with many of the top names in Texas music, including Augie Meyers, Flaco Jimenez, Rusty Wier, Billy Joe Shaver and Willie Nelson to name just a few, so he already knows many of the top artists in the state. After more than two dozen European tours he has quite an international presence, as well. Donnie has been cooking his whole life, in fact he says he doesn’t remember not knowing how to make a pan of gravy, but his travels have also broadened the spectrum of his kitchen experiments.

Paula Reynolds
Host

Paula and her husband initiated a house concert venue in their home, hosting some 60 or so house concerts. After stepping away from her career in education, she also found herself with the luxury of time to hone her creative skills in the kitchen, finding joy in whipping up new recipes and feeding friends and family. At present, Paula freelances, has a published memoir, and is a feature writer for an Italian-American magazine.  Paula’s love for cooking has found new outlets as she eats her way across Italy,one plate of pasta at a time.

Taylor Price
Executive Producer/ Director

Taylor has had a passion for film and photography since she was a little girl running around with her grandmother's home video camera. After developing countless rolls of film ---  she went on to study film and television and began working at a local news station as a camera and audio operator. From there she worked her way up to Executive Producer and eventually moved to Austin to continue her television career. Currently she is focusing on Texas Cookin' and is already dreaming up the next project for Cross Stitch Media.

James Fite
Associate Producer

James grew up in the small town of Bowling Green, Ohio where he spent many of days playing video games and watching movies. He quickly knew that he wanted to make movies, but since his small hometown had no way of making his dream a reality he decided to move to Austin, Texas. Now he spends his days honing his skills by acting at Austin improv theaters, writing screenplays and sketches, directing and producing his written sketches, and editing said sketches.

Taylor Camerot
Lead Camera Operator

Taylor is an independent cinematographer based in Austin, Texas. He graduated from Sedona Film School in 2012 with a certificate in narrative film-making. With the combination of sensitive lighting and creative camera moves, Taylor creates award winning cinematography. In addition to creativity, professionalism and communication are top priorities on every project.
You can see some of Taylor's latest work here.

Christopher Valva
Camera Operator/ Editor

Christopher Valva is a photographer and videographer based in Austin, Texas. He got his start in media as a camera and audio operator at a NBC news station in West Texas. From there he produced daily news casts for CBS and began his freelance filming career. Currently he spends his days creating videos for real estate agents and filming a number of concerts for musicians around Texas.

Allen Green
Audio Operator

Allen Green is an Audio Technician from San Antonio, Texas. He has worked on many films and TV shows over the years proving he has the talent that Texas Cookin' needs!
Take a look for yourself!

Matt Estes
Beer and Wine Specialist

Matt Estes grew up in Nashville and moved to the Texas Hill Country at 17. After a career in public safety, Matt went back to school at 35 to become a chef. While at Scottsdale Culinary Institute, he discovered a love of wine. After earning his BA in Culinary Arts, he pursued a career in wine, moving back to Texas and taking a job in the Fredericksburg H-E-B.  Matt has been awarded a Level 2 certification with Wine & Spirits Education Trust and is feverishly studying to pass the Certified Specialist of Wines exam.

 

Our Perks

We tried to tailor our perks to our food and music lovers as best as possible, and we feel we have a wide variety of goodies to choose from. Our donation tiers vary from a signed poster by all featured guest musicians, Texas Cookin'  swag, and even an invite to the set to be a part of the action.

In the end we realize that contributing to the success of this fun project is the greatest reward. Thank you for making this endeavor possible!

 

Risks & Challenges

As stated in our pitch video, scheduling around our guests tour schedules will be a challenge, but we have many to choose from to assure our episodes will be entertaining.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!
  • And share, share, share! (and share again)

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Major Update:

May 10, 2017: We have an Angel Investor and are so thankful. Outside of this campaign platform, a very generous investor has commited to funding two episodes. Filming will take place in late June and we are already moving into pre-production. But we still need your help. We need to fund one more episode. If we get more than needed for the third episode, we can move into filming episodes 4, 5 and 6. 

Please consider contributing $5 during our High $5 Blitz. Thanks for supporting this project.

 

What is A Blind Eye?

A visual thriller. An unseen killer. 

"A BLIND EYE" is a crime thriller series, developed for a streaming platform and adaptable for other media. 

 

 

About The Project: A Blind Eye

‘A BLIND EYE' has a killer script, a crew ready to bring it to life and WE HAVE distribution to get it out to the audience.

A BLIND EYE : Everything begins to fall in place as Valentina De Luca gains the trust of Chicago Police Department detectives Matthew Coleman and Karen Jackson by feigning blindness. Believing her story about having visions about the murders, she manipulates the detectives and begins to frame the men who put her father in prison. Marisa, Valentina's roommate and Matthew's sister, garners another win as she tries to connect with her brother. Karen starts keeping secrets from Matthew about her personal life as the police Captain struggles with his addiction while trying to balance a home life. 

Click the video below for a message from writer Mandalynn Carlson.

 

Get Onboard! This fundraiser is about helping this timely show that puts women in roles which portray them as strong, independent characters, on the airways.

The concept for the show comes from actress Nicole Criss (A HORSE FOR SUMMER) and the screenplay and story is award-winning actress Mandalynn Carlson (GREY'S ANATOMY). Their goal was to work on a woman-centric project ▬ one created by, written, produced, directed and distributed by women.

According to an article by Brent Lang for Variety Magazine on 10/27/15, who quoted the results of a 2014 study from the Center for the Study of Women in Television and Film at San Diego State University:

  1. In 2014, 85% of films had no female directors, 80% had no female writers, 33% had no female producers, 78% had no female editors and 92% had no female cinematographers.
  2. Women comprised 13% of directors on the top 700 films, but just 7% on the top 250 films.
  3. Women made up 13% of writers on the top 700 films, and 11% on the top 250 films.
  4. Women made up 27% of producers on the top 700 films, while 23% on the top 250 films were female.
  5. Women accounted for 9% of cinematographers on the top 700 films, but 5% of cinematographers on the top 250 pictures.
  6. The number of female editors stayed consistent at 18% in both test samples.

Evidence suggests that women in positions of power are more likely to employ other women. The study also suggests:

  1. Films with female directors, women comprised 52% of writers, 35% of editors and 26% of cinematographers. When men directed, the number of female writers shrank to 8%, editors fell to 15% and cinematographers dropped to 5%.
  2. The same is true for directing opportunities. Women comprised 20% of directors on projects where at least a third of the producers were female, but just 7% of directors when the representation of female producers fell below that percentage.

 

Let’s help encourage young women like Mandalynn and Nicole to change the landscape of filmmaking! Support our campaign for A BLIND EYE.

 

 

ABOUT US: Nandar Pictures LLC is a family of filmmakers in a variety of genres. Our first series, a single cam comedy is being looked at by Netflix and has already been funded.  "A BLIND EYE" will be our first drama series and our goal is to fund, create and air in time for Daytime Emmy nominations.

Our Goal: Six episodes for the first phase,  with a total of 18 episodes for a complete season. Having enough episodes available, creates an opportunity for people to binge watch, like what they see and ask for more. This also allows us to take a successful "showing" in the marketplace to the online platform leaders like Amazon, NetFlix, Hulu and pitch the show as one of their original shows.

 

Nancy Criss, Producer, Director

Nancy has been involved in the entertainment business from her teen years, helping to push her way through an industry that doesn't always embrace women in producing and directing jobs. She is president of Nandar Group, Nandar Pictures LLC and Nandar Entertainment and is an award-winning director and producer and works with a variety of genres. Nancy has been recognized for her work on "A HORSE FOR SUMMER," "THE SPARROWS: NESTING" and other projects. Currently Nancy is producing a series that a major streaming platform is interested in picking up. (Sorry, can't give more details than that at this time.) Nancy lives with her daughter in Arizona and keeps an office at Raleigh Studios in Hollywood. She is a successful business woman outside the film industry with a multi-million dollar delivery service and online retail store. 

Follow Nancy on Social Media:     &         

 

 

Mandalynn Carlson, Director/Writer

Mandalynn Carlson is an award-winning actress seen in films and on television shows. Her first paid acting role was supporting, opposite Gerard Butler, Michelle Monaghan and Michael Shannon in "Machine Gun Preacher" back in 2010. She was 10 years old. Moving to Hollywood at 12 years old, she has found quite a bit of success in front of the camera, including guest stars on "GREYS ANATOMY", "SCANDAL" and "CSI:NY." Many actors face times where they are not fitting the roles out there...too old, too young...and they play the waiting game. While Mandalynn waits, she continues to train with some of the best coaches in Hollywood and she is creating projects. Just like Sylvester Stalone and many others, she has taken to creating opportunities for work in Hollywood, in front and behind the camera. "Sometimes you create while you wait for the perfect vehicle for your acting to appear," states Carlson. 

Mandalynn and teen friend Nicole Criss created the idea for "A BLIND EYE." Mandalynn wrote the screenplay for the thriller, which promises non-stop chills and excitement. 

Follow Mandalynn on Social Media:          

Josh Hodgins, Director

Josh is a creator, having written, directed, produced and starred in numerous feature films, many on AmazonPrime. Josh lives in the state of Washington and is working on multiple shows, one that is being considered by a major streaming platform. Josh created a serial television show called Jackson Horn that was shown on Fox Affiliate stations nationwide. He will be directing some of the episodes and helping to create storylines as the show progresses. 

Photo from the set of The Sparrows: Nesting.

 

Nicole Criss, Creator

Teen actress Nicole Criss created the story premise for 'A BLIND EYE." It was her vision for a twisted story and inspired Mandalynn to come on board. Nicole is known for her roles in "The Sparrows: Nesting," "Fishes & Loaves: Heaven Sent," and "Deadly Sanctuary." She is involved in theater as well as film in Arizona, where she resides with her mother, award-winning director and producer Nancy Criss. In her spare time, Nicole is learning to barrel race for an upcoming role in "Heart of a Champion" which will be filmed in Arizona in late 2017. 

  • Producers: Nancy Criss, Sherri Carlson
  • Directors: Nancy Criss, Mandalynn Carlson, Josh Hodgins
  • Writer: Mandalynn Carlson
  • Creator: Nicole Criss
  • Lead Characters: Valentina DeLuca, Marissa Coleman, Mrs. Warren, Ms. Jackson, Matthew Coleman, Capt. Hale

​

​​

 

We Need Your Help! Great ideas are a dime a dozen. Getting the money to move forward is the hard part. We decided to be creative in our fundraising and develop partnerships by seeking BRAND SPONSORS! Twenty major sponsors per episode and we can pay quality name actors that daytime drama fans will recognize. To get the most bang for our backer's money, those who have businesses, we offer the opportunity to get wide-exposure that is affordable for businesses of all sizes.

We offer AMAZING PERKs for your backing.

  • Creative input in our show by naming victims, landmarks and dressing our characters. 
  •  The ability to put brands in our project at a very affordable price is available to you. As low as $500 and your brand enjoys perpetual life on our series. AND, if we get the Emmy nod, we take you with us!
  • Twenty major sponsors per episode and we can pay quality name actors who daytime drama fans will recognize.
  • The funds will allow us to produce a high-quality episode.

Opening up our show to brand sponsorship is a win-win. For less than the cost of a newspaper ad, a brand could be seen "normal use in a slice of life" visual ad. And, the exposure is nearly unlimited. Our distributor is able to put this show into the global marketplace. All of our sponsors will get perpetual exposure of their brand, globally, for the life of the show. If it does into syndication, that means a long life for the small price.

Are you ready to take your brand to this level? This project has guaranteed distribution! Your products will be seen on a broad scale.

 

 

 

Brand Sponsorship:

  • Each episode, for our first season, will be shot on a micro-budget of $10,000. This will create 15 minutes of quality drama and use familiar names in the soap opera genre.
  • For a $500 donation and the product for our main cast (or entire cast, we keep our cast small in each episode), a brand will be highlighted in the episode. Season sponsors welcome. Email us for details.
    • Select the perk for Female Shoes.
    • In Episode 1, we have three females and four different wardrobe changes. The opportunity is to put in 3-12 pairs of a particular shoe brand.
    • We will photograph each pair of shoes in the scenes and post those photos on our social media, tagging the brand. 
    • The photos will also be available for the brand to use in their own advertising. 
    • The shoes will be seen in the episode, everywhere it airs, for as long as it airs. That could be years! It could be global.
  • A $500 donation and product for an episode, with left over products being gifted to the cast after each episode in a pretty gift bag:
    • Makeup for our entire cast
    • Hair products for our entire cast

  • A $1000 donation and you can name a victim in the episode. Our screenwriter will create the backstory and will email you a signed copy of the script (once aired) with your victim named. 

  • A $1000 donation and the brand will be incorporated across multiple episodes, depending on the type of brand. It requires the donation and the product. Examples are:
    • Tea in the cabinet (all episodes)
    • Coffee maker on the counter (all episodes)
    • Make-up on the dresser
    • Magazines and books
    • Snacks and beverages used in cabinets, on tables, in stores, in normal life situations
  • A donation of $2500 and we will incorporate your brand into various show landmarks for the entire season. Your brand could be incorporated into:
    • The bar
    • The high rise apartment
    • The prison
    • The street (we have a couple streets)
    • The restaurant 
  • If we don't reach our entire goal, we will use the monies we collected to shoot as many episodes as we can afford and start smaller, still maintaining a goal for the Emmy.

Nandar Pictures, LLC. is a distributor for both domestic and international sales. We will heavily market this project for maximum exposure. 

  • The show will be aired to a wide audience on AmazonPrime. We will market heavily on social media and blogs to encourage viewership. A win-win for our brand sponsors.
  • If we are able to get enough funds to put daytime drama names in the roles, we will also get exposure through various magazines that cover these celebrities.
  • Once the season is complete, we will package to DVD and distribute to big box retailers, nationwide.
  • Our marketing team will be using the photos from set (many that will include the brands) and submit with articles and press releases.
  • The script and the completed show will be submitted to notable film festivals and contests.

 

The Nandar Family has been producing award-winning projects for several years and is always on budget. This project has guaranteed distribution! It will be seen by a wide audience. 

  • Our goal is to create a show that focuses on strong women, people of color and other minorities, often overlooked in television. 
  • Our writer and one of our producers came together through a project funded on Indiegogo a few years ago that centered around two young women. They hope to take what they learned from the first project and numerous projects since then and apply it to this series. 
  • We have an Emmy-winning producer who is mentoring our creative process so that this show has an opportunity for a wide audience.  This producer already has a show of this nature that has been nominated for Daytime Emmys three years in a row.

 

 

 

Risks & Challenges

There is always a risk when creating content, but we believe our plan will overcome the hurdles and risk. Even at the rate of $10K per episode, we may have difficulty finding name actors. Distribution -- getting the project seen -- is always a risk.

  • Guaranteed Distribution! Many projects get made and have no distribution. Nandar Pictures, LLC. will distribute this show, beginning on Amazon Prime and will look at other opportunities for release.  They will also negotiate with any major streaming platforms that may wish to 'pick up' our series. We have domestic distribution and the potential for global distribution of this project. 
  • Our crew is behind this project 100% and will work to keep it on budget, so it will be completed and distributed.
  • We have commitments from some of the best in the industry. Our editors has had projects in the Cannes Film Festival. Our directors have won numerous awards. Our casting director will attach relevant and known cast. 
  • One of our producers has contacts with daytime drama actors and will work to negotiate their participation on our project. 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Help us find relevant brands we can partner with. If you know of a business or brand that wants exposure, talk about our opportunity and share on your social media. Indiegogo has share tools to make this easy.

  • Help how you can!  Share this on social media! It works. And share often. Indiegogo has share tools that make it easy to share this campaign.
  • Bring our project up in conversations. You never know who you may know that can help us on this project.

In her spare time, Nicole is learning to barrel race for an upcoming role in "Heart of a Champion" which will be filmed in Arizona in late 2017. 

Producers: Nancy Criss, Sherri Carlson
Directors: Nancy Criss, Mandalynn Carlson, Josh Hodgins
Writer: Mandalynn Carlson
Creator: Nicole Criss
Lead Characters: Valentina DeLuca, Marissa Coleman, Mrs. Warren, Ms. Jackson, Matthew Coleman, Capt. Hale

​
​​
 
We Need Your Help! Great ideas are a dime a dozen. Getting the money to move forward is the hard part. We decided to be creative in our fundraising and develop partnerships by seeking BRAND SPONSORS! Twenty major sponsors per episode and we can pay quality name actors that daytime drama fans will recognize. To get the most bang for our backer's money, those who have businesses, we offer the opportunity to get wide-exposure that is affordable for businesses of all sizes.
We offer AMAZING PERKs for your backing.

Creative input in our show by naming victims, landmarks and dressing our characters. 
 The ability to put brands in our project at a very affordable price is available to you. As low as $500 and your brand enjoys perpetual life on our series. AND, if we get the Emmy nod, we take you with us!
Twenty major sponsors per episode and we can pay quality name actors who daytime drama fans will recognize.
The funds will allow us to produce a high-quality episode.

Opening up our show to brand sponsorship is a win-win. For less than the cost of a newspaper ad, a brand could be seen "normal use in a slice of life" visual ad. And, the exposure is nearly unlimited. Our distributor is able to put this show into the global marketplace. All of our sponsors will get perpetual exposure of their brand, globally, for the life of the show. If it does into syndication, that means a long life for the small price.
Are you ready to take your brand to this level? This project has guaranteed distribution! Your products will be seen on a broad scale.
 
 

 

Brand Sponsorship:

Each episode, for our first season, will be shot on a micro-budget of $10,000. This will create 15 minutes of quality drama and use familiar names in the soap opera genre.
For a $500 donation and the product for our main cast (or entire cast, we keep our cast small in each episode), a brand will be highlighted in the episode. Season sponsors welcome. Email us for details.
Select the perk for Female Shoes.
In Episode 1, we have three females and four different wardrobe changes. The opportunity is to put in 3-12 pairs of a particular shoe brand.
We will photograph each pair of shoes in the scenes and post those photos on our social media, tagging the brand. 
The photos will also be available for the brand to use in their own advertising. 
The shoes will be seen in the episode, everywhere it airs, for as long as it airs. That could be years! It could be global.


A $500 donation and product for an episode, with left over products being gifted to the cast after each episode in a pretty gift bag:
Makeup for our entire cast
Hair products for our entire cast


A $1000 donation and you can name a victim in the episode. Our screenwriter will create the backstory and will email you a signed copy of the script (once aired) with your victim named. 
A $1000 donation and the brand will be incorporated across multiple episodes, depending on the type of brand. It requires the donation and the product. Examples are:
Tea in the cabinet (all episodes)
Coffee maker on the counter (all episodes)
Make-up on the dresser
Magazines and books
Snacks and beverages used in cabinets, on tables, in stores, in normal life situations


A donation of $2500 and we will incorporate your brand into various show landmarks for the entire season. Your brand could be incorporated into:
The bar
The high rise apartment
The prison
The street (we have a couple streets)
The restaurant 


If we don't reach our entire goal, we will use the monies we collected to shoot as many episodes as we can afford and start smaller, still maintaining a goal for the Emmy.


Nandar Pictures, LLC. is a distributor for both domestic and international sales. We will heavily market this project for maximum exposure. 

The show will be aired to a wide audience on AmazonPrime. We will market heavily on social media and blogs to encourage viewership. A win-win for our brand sponsors.
If we are able to get enough funds to put daytime drama names in the roles, we will also get exposure through various magazines that cover these celebrities.
Once the season is complete, we will package to DVD and distribute to big box retailers, nationwide.
Our marketing team will be using the photos from set (many that will include the brands) and submit with articles and press releases.
The script and the completed show will be submitted to notable film festivals and contests.

 


The Nandar Family has been producing award-winning projects for several years and is always on budget. This project has guaranteed distribution! It will be seen by a wide audience. 

Our goal is to create a show that focuses on strong women, people of color and other minorities, often overlooked in television. 
Our writer and one of our producers came together through a project funded on Indiegogo a few years ago that centered around two young women. They hope to take what they learned from the first project and numerous projects since then and apply it to this series. 
We have an Emmy-winning producer who is mentoring our creative process so that this show has an opportunity for a wide audience.  This producer already has a show of this nature that has been nominated for Daytime Emmys three years in a row.

 
 
 

Risks & Challenges
There is always a risk when creating content, but we believe our plan will overcome the hurdles and risk. Even at the rate of $10K per episode, we may have difficulty finding name actors. Distribution -- getting the project seen -- is always a risk.


Guaranteed Distribution! Many projects get made and have no distribution. Nandar Pictures, LLC. will distribute this show, beginning on Amazon Prime and will look at other opportunities for release.  They will also negotiate with any major streaming platforms that may wish to 'pick up' our series. We have domestic distribution and the potential for global distribution of this project. 
Our crew is behind this project 100% and will work to keep it on budget, so it will be completed and distributed.
We have commitments from some of the best in the industry. Our editors has had projects in the Cannes Film Festival. Our directors have won numerous awards. Our casting director will attach relevant and known cast. 
One of our producers has contacts with daytime drama actors and will work to negotiate their participation on our project. 

 
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Help us find relevant brands we can partner with. If you know of a business or brand that wants exposure, talk about our opportunity and share on your social media. Indiegogo has share tools to make this easy.

Help how you can!  Share this on social media! It works. And share often. Indiegogo has share tools that make it easy to share this campaign.
Bring our project up in conversations. You never know who you may know that can help us on this project.

story:
Short Summary

What is "Empowered: The Series"?:

  • A 10-episode web series focusing on a group of teenage superheroes as they further develop their powers, and are united in the efforts to rescue an endangered friend and fight a threat to their very existence. 
  • A superhero web series that seeks to turn the typical lack and/or poor representation of women in the genre on its head, and present female superheroes in a new fashion: normal, every day, strong women who happen to have superpowers; someone that girls can actually look up to. Although the characters have superpowers, we believe that they can show children, adolescents, and young adults--especially girls/young women--that they can feel empowered simply by who they are as a person. 

Crew: 

  • Jarrod Finn- Writer/Creator
  • Kris Wilcox- Director
  • Kalan Benbow- Casting Director
  • Isaac Musgrave- Director of Photography
  • Linda Evans- Location Scout
  • Mandi Huffman- Brand Consultant
  • Johnny Nation- Practical Effects
  • Ryan Marshall- Sound Engineer

Cast:

We are currently recasting a couple roles. 

  • Evelyn "Evie" Tobolsky- TBA. Evie is a 16-year-old Broadway and theater fanatic who lives for the stage and for performing. She dreams to be a professional singer just like her grandmother from whom Evie gets her affinity for 40s big band music/standards. Evie is one of the most warm-hearted, kind, caring, jovial, and giving people you'll ever meet; her ability to make people feel welcome and appreciated is astounding. Superpowers: Sonic scream; siren song (can bend a person's will to hers by singing).
  • Keilah Wilson as Bryn Cooke. Bryn is 17, extremely socially and politically active (she is an aspiring journalist), and a military brat. After the loss of her mother Korinne, she and her father moved to Champaign to be closer to her grandmother. The loss, which shattered both their worlds, forged an even closer relationship with her father. She is one of Evie's best friends and is on the school newspaper staff with her. Superpower: Super intelligence; developing telekinesis. 
  • Jess Schlipf as Hayden Bennet. Hayden is 17, and has become a close confidant of Evie, and a good friend with the rest of the group. She's formed a bond with Tempest--Hayden was once the new kid just like Tempest--and has helped her adjust. On the surface, Hayden is friendly but after years of battling insecurities has developed defenses that can cause her personality to flip quickly. No super powers.
  • McKenzie Deremiah as Tempest Grace.  Tempest is a 15-year-old dance student who has a love for ballet. She has only been studying for about 6 months or so, but has oddly picked everything up rapidly. Tempest identifies as Queer, and currently has a crush on a junior named Bree. While socially awkward and not entirely skilled at making friends, when she is able to she is incredibly loyal to them. Such is the case as the group of girls (Evie, Bryn, and Hayden) have welcomed them into the group. For most of her youth Tempest has searched for friends to help her break out of her shell, and finally, she's found said friends. She and Hayden have formed a close bond as they both battle through insecurities. Superpower: We'll just call it "kinesthetics" for now. She has a sort of super agility, is able to pick up and replicate physical movements (sports, dance, etc) extremely quickly, and can foresee a person's movements/attacks several steps ahead.
  • Selima Samaha- TBA. 
  • Madelyn Childress as Bree Gonzales. Bree, 16, is a warm, caring, bubbly person who sees the best in people. Her mother is of Filipino decent (her father white), and she is learning to appreciate the culture of her ancestors. She has fallen in love with graphic design, and does most of the design for the high school's newspaper. Also Tempest's crush, the two of them build a close relationship in which Bree becomes the yang to Tempest's yin. Bree helps Tempest come out of her shell, and become more comfortable with herself.
  • Prince F. Robertson as Dr. Gregory "Greg" Cooke. Greg, 42 and Bryn's stern yet loving father, is a recently retired Colonel in the U.S. Army. After graduating from Westpoint, his exceptional intelligence helped him climb the military ranks quite rapidly until he reached Colonel by his mid-30s, in addition to obtaining a PhD while serving his country. As a military intelligence and Chemical, Biological, Radiological, and Nuclear (CBRN) officer, Greg conducted biological/scientific research on the regenerative capabilities in animals and their potential human applications. Said research was pushed along after the manifestation of his own regenerative powers—these powers explain why Greg appears to look much younger than he actually is. By the time of his retirement, he had reached the rank of colonel and certainly had a much longer and illustrious career ahead of him. However, his decision to retire and move back home to teach at the University of Illinois was spurred on by two factors: 1) his fear of the military discovering his powers and using them immorally/for military medicine and weapons (these fears weren't completely off base as military intelligence began suspecting something and 2) the death of his wife Korinne—she was killed as a superpowered individual attempted to stop a robbery. Very much in love with her, her death shook Greg to the core and left him guilt- ridden for not being there to use his powers to protect her. Seeking comfort and now raising his now 16-year-old daughter Bryn alone, he retired, moved back home to be near his parents in Champaign, and accepted a position as a professor at the university. To this day he has kept his powers completely secret.
  • James R. Ling as Alex Davenport.  Alex, 30, is a PhD candidate at the local university and works as a TA for Bryn Cooke's father Gregory. What Alex lacks in powers, he makes up for in intelligence and his ability to absorb new information quickly. Throughout his academic career, Alex has been obsessed with the regenerative nature of certain organisms. That obsession leads him to discover Gregory Cooke's research, which in turn became the catalyst for Alex's desire to work under Cooke.

What We Need to Get

For this leg of the crowdfunding campaign, we are seeking a total of $4,000. Your donations to this campaign will cover the following:

  • Pre-Production/Production/Post-Production Costs (Test shots, equipment rental, crew, reshoots/pick ups if necessary)
  • Catering/Crafts Table for Cast and Crew
  • Props/Practical Effects
  • Travel and Lodging for One or Two Cast Members
  • Fulfilling perks

Any excess or leftover funds will be applied to branding such as posters, etc., and used to fund the full season. 

Perks for contributing will range from a hearty thank you to digital and physical copies of both the pilot and the script to actual props from production to even invitations to set, screenings, and after parties. We even offer an opportunity to be an executive producer. 

Funds, if we reach at least 80% of our goal but fall short, will still be applied to production costs as best we can. If we do not raise enough funds, production will not be possible and refunds will be offered. 

The Impact

  • While our overall goal is to create an entertaining and well-produced pilot episode, our intentions are to bring a new perspective to the superhero genre. As superhero and comic book fans, we have grown frustrated with not only the lackluster representation of females, but also realistic female heroes when they are present. We have decided to remedy this issue by creating superheroes women, young and old alike, can relate to and support. No fawning over boys. No costumes that make them look like Jane Fonda in an exercise video. Real, down to earth, teenage girls that face everyday struggles and just happen to have powers. 
  • In addition to the female representation, we seek to tackle issues that currently face the nation; issues/topics that we feel the nation needs to see and hear. 
  • In the end, we hope to create a world of superheroes that ALL people can look up to and cheer on.

story:
Jay Martin Canada’s Renaissance Man inks a deal with Jamaican "King of Comedy" – Double the Laughs!

Multi-awarding winning comedian Jay Martin inked a spectacular deal with legendary Jamaican actor and comedian Oliver Samuels in June 2020. The deal includes a package of film and television projects which includes a trilogy of feature films including “Destination Wedding” – a romantic comedy.  “Oliver In Charge”, a television sitcom is currently in pre-production and slated for television release in 2021. This hilarious sitcom series follows Martin's character who plays Oliver Samuels estranged son.

"Oliver In Charge" and "Destination Wedding", along with two additional films to complete the trilogy, will form the basis of Ajahmae Live Entertainment Inc.’s foray into film and television.  Martin is intent on establishing and growing a successful production company that will develop and produce exceptional comedic content.  His TV and film projects will build on his wholesome family brand as he extends his audience in this space both in front of and behind the camera. 

 

We need your help to make the TV trailer and show pilot for "Oliver In Charge" - a hilarious sitcom showcasing clean Caribbean, Canadian comedic content.

 

 

 

OLIVER IN CHARGE - The TV SERIES

Oliver In Charge is a hilarious sitcom which brings together Jamaican, Caribbean, Canadian and African cultures in a hilarious and heart-warming fashion that could only happen in the most multicultural city in the world - Toronto. The show and its diverse cast has a formidable fan base that has a broad appeal to international audiences across Canada, the US, Caribbean, UK and Africa.

Oliver Samuels affectionately known as the “Jamaican King of Comedy", has been acting on television, doing stand-up comedy, and performing in comic theatre for four decades. Samuels found fame on the popular Jamaica Broadcasting Corporation (JBC) television series "Oliver At Large". Video clips on YouTube with episodes of 'Oliver at Large' and various Oliver sketch shows still amasses millions of viewers to this day.  The Oliver Samuel brand is synonymous with Jamaica, comedy and laughter. Samuels is widely regarded as one of the funniest talents to emerge from the Caribbean.

Comedic co-stars Jay Martin, Trixx and Jean Paul all have prominent roles in the sitcom 'Oliver in Charge".  Collectively the trio continues to draw appeal and sell out shows - most recently the Three the Hard Way Comedy Show in Toronto.  In response to the COVID-19 pandemic,  The Minority Report  an online satirical weekly comedy special was developed.  Martin and Paul along with other notable comedians, celebrities and special guests entertained audiences providing some much needed comic relief during the unprecedented time.

THE SYNOPSIS

"Oliver in Charge" is a heartwarming family-friendly comedy with a rich interplay of memorable characters and the spice of Jamaican, Caribbean and African culture mixed into a hilarious touching stew. The situations the family members get into are relatable to people of all cultures. "Oliver in Charge"  celebrates our unique differences as well as highlighting our many similarities. The key thread of the show is that family is family, and ultimately nothing is more important than that.

As the sitcom "Oliver In Charge" evolves, Jay, played by comedian Jay Martin becomes increasingly frustrated at always having to keep his father, played by Oliver Samuels, out of trouble. Jay and Oliver regularly get into hilarious conflicts because of Oliver's  raw social skills, fascination with get rich quick schemes, and the inept advice he is always bestowing on his two daughters. 

Oliver's often archaic Jamaican views on women and relationships create sparks between him and Jay's Ghanaian/Nigerian wife Patience.  She is very loving and an independent, no nonsense lawyer.  Patience's mother Winnie, is an upper class proud Ghanaian woman, who views Oliver as an uncultured mooch on her daughter and son-in-law.  

Comedian Jean Paul, plays the slick talking Trinidadian next door neighbour.  Patience's money-challenged brother Kwesi, played by comedian Trixx regularly shows up at the household unexpectedly. Kwesi is constantly plotting get rich schemes with Oliver leaving them in precarious situations at times.

 

MEET SOME OF OUR AMAZING TEAM!

WHAT EXACTLY IS THE PROJECT?

We have assembled an amazing team of actors, creatives and industry professional to create the "Oliver In Charge" television sitcom. The purpose of the INDIEGOGO campaign is to raise funds to offset the cost of filming the trailer and show pilot.

 

THE PERKS

We appreciate EVERY single contribution towards the success of completing the trailer and pilot episode of "Oliver in Charge"! 

To show our appreciation we have created a host of creative perks to sweeten the deal.  Help us reach our goal! We need #OLIVERNOW

_____

THE PERKS BREAKDOWN

THANK YOU!                                                                                                                                                                $25.00

PERK 

  • a THANK YOU email message from Jay Martin 

_____

FIFITY FIFTY                                                                                                                                                   $50.00 

PERK 

  • a THANK YOU email  message from Jay Martin 
  • Mention on social media

______

ONE LOVE                                                                                                                                                        $100.00

PERK -

  • a THANK YOU email message from Jay Martin
  • Mention on social media  
  • a #GiveMeOliverNow T-shirt

______

2 PATTY & A COCOBREAD                                                                                                                                      $250.00

PERK

  • a THANK YOU email message from Jay Martin
  • Mention on social media
  • 2 #GiveMeOliverNow T-shirts
  • 2 VIP tickets to a Jay Martin Comedy Event 

-------

A NANNY                                                                                                                                                          $500.00

PERK - 

  • a THANK YOU email message from Jay Martin 
  • Mention on social media (personal or business)
  • 4 #GiveMeOliverNow T-shirts 
  • 4 VIP tickets to a Jay Martin Comedy Event
  • 2 VIP invitations to "Oliver In Charge" Wrap Party with cast and crew

______

SAY LESS                                                                                                                                                         $1000k

PERK 

  • a THANK YOU email from Jay Martin
  • 2 mentions on social media (personal or business)
  • 6 #GiveMeOliverNow T-shirts
  • 6 VIP tickets to a Jay Martin Comedy Event
  • 4 Invitations to "Oliver In Charge" Wrap Party with cast and crew
  • a 15 minute ZOOM, Skype, or Google Meet video chat with cast members from "Oliver In Charge" 

______

STACKS ON STACKS ON STACKS                                                                                                                        $5000k

PERK -

  • a THANK YOU video call from Jay Martin and Oliver Samuels
  • Listed on "Oliver In Charge" website 
  • Copy of pilot script signed by cast and crew of "Oliver In Charge"
  • 8 VIP tickets to a Jay Martin Comedy Event 
  • 6 VIP and Red Carpet tickets to premiere showing of "Oliver In Charge" 
  • Dinner for 6 guests with cast members from "Oliver In Charge" on set

______

BOSS TINGS                                                                                                                                                  $10,000k

PERK 

  • a THANK YOU video call from Jay Martin and Oliver Samuels, Jean Paul and Trixx
  • Copy of pilot script signed by cast and crew of "Oliver In Charge"
  • 10 VIP tickets to a Jay Martin Comedy Event w/backstage access
  • 10 VIP Red Carpet tickets to the  premiere showing of "Oliver In Charge"
  • Dinner for 6 guests with cast members from "Oliver In Charge" on set 
  • Mentioned as a major contributor on the show's credits

_____

I Want to Donate, But I Can't.

We realize that not everyone is in the position to contribute, however you can still help!  

You can help spread the word by sharing, posting and telling others about the new hilarious sitcom "Oliver In Charge"  Don't forget to use the hashtag #GiveMeOliverNow. 

Word of mouth and social media are powerful tools to spread the word about "Oliver In Charge".

 

WHAT ARE WE DOING WITH THE MONEY?

Created by Mr. Renaissance Man, Jay Martin and the screenplay written by Craig Wellington, "Oliver in Charge" is set up to be a smash hit that the world needs to see!  We are using the monies raised from this campaign to finance the filming trailer and show pilot for "Oliver In Charge"

 

 

A WORD FROM OLIVER SAMUELS

Oliver Samuels is thrilled to work with Jay Martin and Ajahmae Entertainment Inc. and sees the collaboration as an opportunity to, “Expand the audience I have developed in Canada over the last 30 years where my appearance in stage plays have always been well-received.  Further, I am delighted to have an opportunity to work with this very funny young man, ah mean youngish” he said emitting robust laughter.

 

 

THE LAST WORD FROM JAY MARTIN

I am so excited about my entry into the television and film industry after over 20 years doing stand-up comedy. 

I want to share content that promotes and reflects positive living as a counterbalance to all the negative images that are reflected on the nightly news.  I truly prefer to focus on the good things that are going on in the world which are generally drowned out by the dark and ugly happenings.  Well, I’m here to bring the sunshine and, of course, the laughter. After all, laughter is not only good for the spirit it’s also good for maintaining mental health.

"Oliver In Charge" is a  family-friendly, comedy starring Jamaican comedy legend Oliver Samuels along with myself, Jean Paul, Trixx and Christopher Johnny Daley anc more.

The time is now for Caribbean people, the diaspora and people of African descent to see themselves represented on television and in film.  "Oliver in Charge" does that.  It showcases the rich history,  traditions and culture of the Jamaican, Caribbean, African, and Canadian people.  The show transcends cultural barriers, bridges generational gaps and is relatable to young and old alike.  "Oliver In Charge"  is funny, witty and current.  It explores relationships, love and timely issues from a Caribbean/African Canadian lens. 

Let's shout from the rooftops- #GiveMeOliverNow

Thank you for your support!

Let's make television history,

 

JAY MARTIN IN THE MEDIA

Related Links:

CBC NEWS [ARTICLE] Toronto's 'Comedy Doctor' Jay Martin Walks Away from Stand-Up

https://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/toronto/jay-martin-comedy-final-show-1.4917997

CTV POP LIFE with RICHARD CROUSE [TALKSHOW]

https://www.ctvnews.ca/video?clipId=1628980&fbclid=IwAR3lLS1xrcN_fbHG9N8DDVQIIZ6vJNnz9Z-ZTlV30hrxdMo6nFbljTIhenI

2Lined Music Hut [INTERVIEW]

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RdyCXTHdIs8
story_txt:
Jay Martin Canada’s Renaissance Man inks a deal with Jamaican "King of Comedy" – Double the Laughs!Multi-awarding winning comedian Jay Martin inked a spectacular deal with legendary Jamaican actor and comedian Oliver Samuels in June 2020. The deal includes a package of film and television projects which includes a trilogy of feature films including “Destination Wedding” – a romantic comedy.  “Oliver In Charge”, a television sitcom is currently in pre-production and slated for television release in 2021. This hilarious sitcom series follows Martin's character who plays Oliver Samuels estranged son."Oliver In Charge" and "Destination Wedding", along with two additional films to complete the trilogy, will form the basis of Ajahmae Live Entertainment Inc.’s foray into film and television.  Martin is intent on establishing and growing a successful production company that will develop and produce exceptional comedic content.  His TV and film projects will build on his wholesome family brand as he extends his audience in this space both in front of and behind the camera.  We need your help to make the TV trailer and show pilot for "Oliver In Charge" - a hilarious sitcom showcasing clean Caribbean, Canadian comedic content.   OLIVER IN CHARGE - The TV SERIESOliver In Charge is a hilarious sitcom which brings together Jamaican, Caribbean, Canadian and African cultures in a hilarious and heart-warming fashion that could only happen in the most multicultural city in the world - Toronto. The show and its diverse cast has a formidable fan base that has a broad appeal to international audiences across Canada, the US, Caribbean, UK and Africa.Oliver Samuels affectionately known as the “Jamaican King of Comedy", has been acting on television, doing stand-up comedy, and performing in comic theatre for four decades. Samuels found fame on the popular Jamaica Broadcasting Corporation (JBC) television series "Oliver At Large". Video clips on YouTube with episodes of 'Oliver at Large' and various Oliver sketch shows still amasses millions of viewers to this day.  The Oliver Samuel brand is synonymous with Jamaica, comedy and laughter. Samuels is widely regarded as one of the funniest talents to emerge from the Caribbean.Comedic co-stars Jay Martin, Trixx and Jean Paul all have prominent roles in the sitcom 'Oliver in Charge".  Collectively the trio continues to draw appeal and sell out shows - most recently the Three the Hard Way Comedy Show in Toronto.  In response to the COVID-19 pandemic,  The Minority Report  an online satirical weekly comedy special was developed.  Martin and Paul along with other notable comedians, celebrities and special guests entertained audiences providing some much needed comic relief during the unprecedented time.THE SYNOPSIS"Oliver in Charge" is a heartwarming family-friendly comedy with a rich interplay of memorable characters and the spice of Jamaican, Caribbean and African culture mixed into a hilarious touching stew. The situations the family members get into are relatable to people of all cultures. "Oliver in Charge"  celebrates our unique differences as well as highlighting our many similarities. The key thread of the show is that family is family, and ultimately nothing is more important than that.As the sitcom "Oliver In Charge" evolves, Jay, played by comedian Jay Martin becomes increasingly frustrated at always having to keep his father, played by Oliver Samuels, out of trouble. Jay and Oliver regularly get into hilarious conflicts because of Oliver's  raw social skills, fascination with get rich quick schemes, and the inept advice he is always bestowing on his two daughters. Oliver's often archaic Jamaican views on women and relationships create sparks between him and Jay's Ghanaian/Nigerian wife Patience.  She is very loving and an independent, no nonsense lawyer.  Patience's mother Winnie, is an upper class proud Ghanaian woman, who views Oliver as an uncultured mooch on her daughter and son-in-law.  Comedian Jean Paul, plays the slick talking Trinidadian next door neighbour.  Patience's money-challenged brother Kwesi, played by comedian Trixx regularly shows up at the household unexpectedly. Kwesi is constantly plotting get rich schemes with Oliver leaving them in precarious situations at times. MEET SOME OF OUR AMAZING TEAM!WHAT EXACTLY IS THE PROJECT?We have assembled an amazing team of actors, creatives and industry professional to create the "Oliver In Charge" television sitcom. The purpose of the INDIEGOGO campaign is to raise funds to offset the cost of filming the trailer and show pilot. THE PERKSWe appreciate EVERY single contribution towards the success of completing the trailer and pilot episode of "Oliver in Charge"! To show our appreciation we have created a host of creative perks to sweeten the deal.  Help us reach our goal! We need #OLIVERNOW_____THE PERKS BREAKDOWNTHANK YOU!                                                                                                                                                                $25.00PERK a THANK YOU email message from Jay Martin _____FIFITY FIFTY                                                                                                                                                   $50.00 PERK 
a THANK YOU email  message from Jay Martin 
Mention on social media
