story:
Story Time!

ThingzThatMakeUGoHmmm is a online game show created by WeAre1CHICAGO.

 

WeAre1CHICAGO United, NFP is an organization that focus on creating programs, activities and events that financially support the younger generation in Chicago. With all that is going on today, we feel it is extremely important to support our youth and create a bridge to help make their dreams a reality. Some of the current programs we have is "I Love The 90s Millennium Virtual Show", "ChiTown Movie Nite", and "ThingzThatMakeUGoHmmm".

“I Love The 90s Millennium Virtual Show”, is a tribute showcase to artists from 1990-2005. Hosted by Greg Owens, Dedrick D. Banks Gray, & SJ Williams.  Performances by various artists from episode 1-5! We have partnered up with WeAre1CHICAGO and ThingzThatMakeUGoHmmm to assist these artists and the production team during COVID-19. The audience can literally donate to these artists directly through CashApp to show support and win prizes. 

“ChiTown Movie Nite”, gives independent filmmakers a platform to showcase their work while also bringing the city together. There is a submission process in order to be approved. This program takes place once a month. 

"ThingzThatMakeUGoHmmm", is a program that was specifically created to raise money for the younger comedians and entertainers in the Chicagoland area.This show will highlight the creativity, the humor and talents of our young Chicago natives, giving you 1 hour of pure entertainment!

 My name is Jae Davis, born and raised on the south side of the Chicagoland area.  I'm able to live out my passion everyday as a producer who curates her own content. I also work with artists who are looking for platforms to share their art. 

I see my city as something that has great potential and amazing creativity when it comes to our youth and young adults. In the past, our youth have been let down with our lack of involvement and consistency with helping to nourish and catapult their talents and gifts. It is important that we look past today’s and yesterday’s issues, and channel with them to future possibilities for their generation. COVID-19 will not slow us down. 

Our team decided that this game show will help our country to #stayhome and #staysafe. We created a way that we can support our youth and young adults with donations and more opportunities during this second wave of the coronavirus.

This game show will give great energy... like the youth of the
90’s era that stood for unity, justice and equality. I am excited and thrilled to share with you, ThingzThatMakeUGoHmmm!

 

Easy As 1-2-3 

The game show will consist of 2 teams of 4 players on each team. Each team  will have special invited guests (influencers, celebrities, VIPs, etc.) and  random individuals from our youth community. There will be 5 games with 3 rounds each game.  Each round gives each team a chance to win the cash prize for that game, allowing everyone to walk away a winner.

Youth can watch the show with a chance of winning monetary prizes to invest in their craft/school supplies by summarizing the episode or answering the questions asked during the game. 

This series will be live on a weekly basis available via, Twitch,  YouTube and Facebook.

 

What We Need & What You Get

The support from our community can come in many forms. The first phase to build the consistency that we want comes at a price. We are asking for the public to invest in their youth. Our overall goal is to raise over $300,000, with a goal to donate at least $10,000 each week for 30 weeks.  However, we are requesting $60K at a time, to allow us to continue the process of fundraising as we build the pot. The funding that is raised will be used for the following;

  • Recording, Editing, Techs (hired youth and young adults in the community)
  • Promotion (Social media, Billboards, Radio)
  • Payment for Crew and Local Talent
  • Merch ( T-Shirts, Mugs, etc.)
  • Prizes for Youth watching (Money via Cashapp, Venmo, Paypal as well as School Supplies, Gift Cards...)
  • The winning pots for the games

All of contributors will receive the following: 

  • Thank You Letter
  • ThingzThatMakeUGoHmmm T-Shirt
  • Name Entered on the ThingzThatMakeUGoHmm Hall for Fame via website
  • Newsletter recognition of your business if the donation is on the behalf of a business
  • Shoutout during the game show from our official host
  • Tax exempt for your donation via emailed letter 

The Impact 

We know just about everyone in Chicago wants to see these better days ahead and would like to participate the best way they can. Well, we’ve created the platform and now we need your help to push for our city.

This is not our first attempt to create resources for our Youth in Chicago.  We did a live show, bringing all of the popular local acts together, creating unity, diversity and overall more opportunities.  However, we didn't have the monetary resources to promote it, therefore, majority of Chicago wasn't able to support because they didn't know that it was even happening.  That's why, this year, we need your support.  

 

Other Ways You Can Contribute

Every bit helps even if your donation isn't monetary. Other items you can donate are the following: 

  • Share the fundraiser on your social media platforms (Facebook, Instagram, Twitter...)
  • Gift Cards (Walmart, Best Buy, Target, Visa..) to give away to the youth community
  • School Supplies  ( Binders, Pencils, Backpacks...)
  • Dorm Life (Printers, Lamps, Bedsheets, Cleaning Supplies..)
  • Photo Shoot (to help offer professionalism to our youth)
  • Marketing (to help promote the youth goals, activities and or projects, etc...)
  • Videography (to assist the youth in creating content for their projects, etc...)

story:
Short Summary

My name is Jesse Lee Peterson. I'm the host of The Fallen State, a unique and wildly popular YouTube series. In little more than two years, we've garnered over 17 million views, multiple viral videos, and 175,000 subscribers. Why?

The Fallen State is compelling content at its finest.  It’s unscripted, unpredictable, and authentic.  Every time I sit down to interview someone, I’m 100% honest and myself. I never know exactly where my conversations are going to lead.  It's led some of my guests to major breakthroughs. Other guests have stormed off the set in anger.  But regardless of how it may go over, I always tell the truth. And viewers constantly tell me that the show is a breath of fresh air.

At The Fallen State, we love variety.  On any given week, you'll find something new and exciting: from timely, cinematically-edited “man-on-the-street” interviews, to intense debates, to meaningful dialogues.  And our guests are incredibly diverse! From entertaining “regular folks,” to celebrity therapist Dr. Drew, to an anarcho-communist, to SlutWalk creator Amber Rose and conservative commentator Ann Coulter—our guests run the gamut.

I ask the questions no one else will, and tackle the spiritual, political, and cultural topics others run from. In this age of safe spaces and politically correct thought police, The Fallen State stands out like a beacon.  Furthermore, we are not beholden to any network, handler, or advertiser restricting our speech and content.

Unfortunately, not everyone wants to see free thought and free dialogue flourish.  Because of this, we’re being targeted. George Soros-funded Media Matters for America wants to see us removed from YouTube. They're calling me (a black man) a racist and... wait for it... a white supremacist, of all things!

It's incredibly ironic, as The Fallen State gives a voice to the most diverse spectrum of voices imaginable.  We feature guests of every race, gender, income level, age, faith, and political affiliation.

We will not cave to this threat. In fact, we are seeking your help to make the show even BETTER, making necessary upgrades to reach even more people who seek truth and enlightenment.

Support a platform where you—not the censors—get to decide which viewpoints you’ll accept. Your views will be challenged, you’ll laugh, you’ll tear up, you may even get mad—but you'll be entertained while gaining a greater understanding about yourself and the world we live in.

 

The digital domain is rife with competition, and producing shows of exceptional quality is an absolute must. Our equipment is woefully dated, and we are holding the show together pretty much with wire and duct tape right now.

The two most glaring problems are The Fallen State computers and cameras.  Two of these computers are dinosaurs (Macs from 2009).  And the remaining computers are operating with outdated software.  Then there’s the most indispensable type of gear for a TV show: the cameras.  Ours are 10 years old! As a result of this old equipment, our editors, graphic designers, and producers are forced to spend far too much time completing tasks. And even then, the visuals don’t end up as vibrant nor as sharp as they could with the latest tech updates.

Then there are the issues with our audio:  We’ve experienced everything from bad microphone malfunctions, to challenges syncing audio and visuals.  We had to pull a popular episode because the audio and visual aspects were grossly mismatched (picture an old poorly dubbed Chinese Kung Fu movie!).

Cameras, sound equipment, computers, and software happen to be some of the priciest items to replace.  So it's crucial that we raise $40,000 to make the necessary upgrades to the show to improve its look, sound, and entertainment value, and make The Fallen State TV better than ever before.

 

Here's a breakdown of what we need and what it will accomplish: 

CAMERAS & ACCESSORIES total = $17,400 (44.5%)

-4 cameras: $16,000

Our current cameras are from 2008.  In order to stay competitive, we need updated equipment that shoots higher-quality video.

 

-2 tripods: $1,400

Our current tripods are inadequate for panning or moving the camera.  Having tripods will cut down on shaky shots so we capture the footage right the first time.

 

PRODUCTION / EDITING / DESIGN total = $12,600 (32.2%)

-3 HD camera monitors: $600

This allows our crew to see three different camera shots on large, high-definition screens, which prevents mistakes from happening while filming.  Saves time in post-production, and prevents re-shoots.

 

-3 iMacs with software: $12,000

This allows us to update our team's outdated, malfunctioning computers. It also enables us to expand our production team so that everyone has access to the equipment they need.

 

SOUND total = $5,880 (15.1%)

-8-track field audio recorder: $1,100

This recorder seamlessly syncs the audio portion of the show with the video portion—normally a painstaking process. This will also let us incorporate more multi-guest panel discussions and debates on the show. Saves major time in the editing room and makes the show look and sound more professional.

 

-3 lavalier microphones: $3,180

Enables us to have live panels on the show (including up to 4 guests simultaneously) and saves us from paying to rent equipment.  

 

-Boom microphone with boom pull: $1,200

Helps us capture audio much better during our "man-on-the street" filming, shooting promotions and commercials, etc.

 

-Wireless receiver: $400

Allows us to film street interviews using a cordless mic. This makes it much easier to maneuver in crowded events.

 

STORAGE total = $2,000 (5.1%)

-SSD drives and SDXC cards: $2,000

These store hours of valuable footage from the show, and transfer the data between devices. No room for failure.

 

SET total = $1,200 (3.1%)

-Green Screen background: $200

Enables editors to add special visual effects in post production. This saves us time and money because we don’t have to go elsewhere to film or pay for another studio.

 

-Darker Black Curtain: $1,000

This will improve the overall color quality of the show and cut down on adjustments in post-production.

 

GRAND TOTAL: $17,400 + $12,600 + $5,880 + $2,000 + $1,200 = $39,080

 


The Fallen State started in January of 2016 with no subscribers, no headlines, and no connections to big celebrities.  In little more than two years, we’ve created a cultural, political and spiritual earthquake felt around the world by the rich and famous, as well as the unknown.

As an example, one of our most impactful shows was with Amber Rose.  It went viral, getting picked up everywhere—from Yahoo! News, to BET, The Daily Mail, PerezHilton.com, Vibe, Fox News, TooFab, Vlad TV, XXL Mag, and much more.  In this exclusive interview, Amber Rose weighed in on her ex, Kanye West, pronouncing that Donald Trump was "Kanye in a white man's body."

It was this same interview that created the viral "slutmaker" meme.  As a SlutWalk organizer, Rose strives to take the stigma out of the word "slut." Meanwhile, my argument is that neither men, nor women, should be "sluts."  During the interview, Rose asked me, "What does it make you, if you have sex with different women?" I responded, "a slut-maker." A clip of this off-the-cuff, comical moment went viral.

The interview impacted Amber Rose so much, that she linked it from her Instagram page, thereby guaranteeing that her huge fan base would see it.

In addition to Amber, I’ve interviewed many other prominent cultural influencers such as Ben Shapiro, Ann Coulter, actress Stacey Dash, Dr. Drew, rappers Gunplay and R.A. the Rugged Man, reality star Tiffany "New York" Pollard, comedian Luenell, and YouTubers Tommy Sotomayor and Elliott Hulse.

I also interview young men and women who are going through burdensome life challenges. These are some of the most satisfying conversations for me, and they often have the most powerful impact. I talked to two teenagers from a top private school whose teachers refused to give their viewpoints a fair hearing, simply because the students leaned conservative.

In our current season, I hosted an exclusive interview with a young man who identifies as an "Incel" ("Involuntarily Celibate").  He poured his heart out to me and the audience about just how difficult it's become to find a decent woman to date.

Yet, the absolute most important aspect of what we do is changing the hearts of those who hate. Whether in interviews with celebrities or regular folks, my underlying message in every show is always one of love and forgiveness.

We have fans from around the world whose lives have changed in powerful ways from soaking this message in. Here’s a small sampling of some of those we’ve impacted:

 

- Jesse Lee Peterson completely changed my outlook on life!  He taught me that alpha males don't get angry, perfect peace! I have become a better person because of his show. I was a progressive two months ago, now IDK anymore. --Trevor Hinck

 

-Jesse, you have changed my life. God bless you and your show and your being. My wife and children and I all love you for what you are doing. --Daniel Laws

 

-You are truly uniting the people with truth! --Blue Ringed Octopus

 

-So inspiring.....This man is a locksmith reaching out for your chains.....Help him, help you too as he has me..... --PasstheBuck Canuck

 

-Used to really resent my mother for how she divorced my dad and never let me see him. I was such a bitter angry person. Forgiveness brought me peace. Thank you Jesse. --Christian Rogers

 

-Jesse Lee Peterson changed my life. He showed me how to return to the Father. I thought God and religion was a scam, I know now how foolish I truly was. Thank you Mr. Peterson, you saved my life and God got his child back.﻿ --Robert Elliott

 

-Jesse, you’re out here being the strong father role model a lot of us never had thank you!! --James McDonald

 

-I have been listening to you for a few months now....I found my soul again and have found so much happiness again. ❤﻿ --Denise Eagan

 

-I'm a proud Hindu from India.. and there is a saying amongst us that the eyes are often windows to the soul. U have those peace-giving, loving eyes Jesse, the window to a very good soul

 --Ramachandra R

 

We successfully raised funds on Indiegogo several years ago to launch The Fallen State, and now it's taken off!  And with your help, The Fallen State TV: Keep Free Thought Alive! Campaign will propel us to a new level so we can reach so many more hearts and minds around the world!
story_txt: Short SummaryMy name is Jesse Lee Peterson. I'm the host of The Fallen State, a unique and wildly popular YouTube series. In little more than two years, we've garnered over 17 million views, multiple viral videos, and 175,000 subscribers. Why?The Fallen State is compelling content at its finest.  It’s unscripted, unpredictable, and authentic.  Every time I sit down to interview someone, I’m 100% honest and myself. I never know exactly where my conversations are going to lead.  It's led some of my guests to major breakthroughs. Other guests have stormed off the set in anger.  But regardless of how it may go over, I always tell the truth. And viewers constantly tell me that the show is a breath of fresh air.At The Fallen State, we love variety.  On any given week, you'll find something new and exciting: from timely, cinematically-edited “man-on-the-street” interviews, to intense debates, to meaningful dialogues.  And our guests are incredibly diverse! From entertaining “regular folks,” to celebrity therapist Dr. Drew, to an anarcho-communist, to SlutWalk creator Amber Rose and conservative commentator Ann Coulter—our guests run the gamut.I ask the questions no one else will, and tackle the spiritual, political, and cultural topics others run from. In this age of safe spaces and politically correct thought police, The Fallen State stands out like a beacon.  Furthermore, we are not beholden to any network, handler, or advertiser restricting our speech and content.Unfortunately, not everyone wants to see free thought and free dialogue flourish.  Because of this, we’re being targeted. George Soros-funded Media Matters for America wants to see us removed from YouTube. They're calling me (a black man) a racist and... wait for it... a white supremacist, of all things!It's incredibly ironic, as The Fallen State gives a voice to the most diverse spectrum of voices imaginable.  We feature guests of every race, gender, income level, age, faith, and political affiliation.We will not cave to this threat. In fact, we are seeking your help to make the show even BETTER, making necessary upgrades to reach even more people who seek truth and enlightenment.Support a platform where you—not the censors—get to decide which viewpoints you’ll accept. Your views will be challenged, you’ll laugh, you’ll tear up, you may even get mad—but you'll be entertained while gaining a greater understanding about yourself and the world we live in. The digital domain is rife with competition, and producing shows of exceptional quality is an absolute must. Our equipment is woefully dated, and we are holding the show together pretty much with wire and duct tape right now.The two most glaring problems are The Fallen State computers and cameras.  Two of these computers are dinosaurs (Macs from 2009).  And the remaining computers are operating with outdated software.  Then there’s the most indispensable type of gear for a TV show: the cameras.  Ours are 10 years old! As a result of this old equipment, our editors, graphic designers, and producers are forced to spend far too much time completing tasks. And even then, the visuals don’t end up as vibrant nor as sharp as they could with the latest tech updates.Then there are the issues with our audio:  We’ve experienced everything from bad microphone malfunctions, to challenges syncing audio and visuals.  We had to pull a popular episode because the audio and visual aspects were grossly mismatched (picture an old poorly dubbed Chinese Kung Fu movie!).Cameras, sound equipment, computers, and software happen to be some of the priciest items to replace.  So it's crucial that we raise $40,000 to make the necessary upgrades to the show to improve its look, sound, and entertainment value, and make The Fallen State TV better than ever before. Here's a breakdown of what we need and what it will accomplish: CAMERAS & ACCESSORIES total = $17,400 (44.5%)-4 cameras: $16,000Our current cameras are from 2008.  In order to stay competitive, we need updated equipment that shoots higher-quality video. -2 tripods: $1,400Our current tripods are inadequate for panning or moving the camera.  Having tripods will cut down on shaky shots so we capture the footage right the first time. PRODUCTION / EDITING / DESIGN total = $12,600 (32.2%)-3 HD camera monitors: $600This allows our crew to see three different camera shots on large, high-definition screens, which prevents mistakes from happening while filming.  Saves time in post-production, and prevents re-shoots. -3 iMacs with software: $12,000This allows us to update our team's outdated, malfunctioning computers. It also enables us to expand our production team so that everyone has access to the equipment they need. SOUND total = $5,880 (15.1%)-8-track field audio recorder: $1,100This recorder seamlessly syncs the audio portion of the show with the video portion—normally a painstaking process. This will also let us incorporate more multi-guest panel discussions and debates on the show. Saves major time in the editing room and makes the show look and sound more professional. -3 lavalier microphones: $3,180Enables us to have live panels on the show (including up to 4 guests simultaneously) and saves us from paying to rent equipment.   -Boom microphone with boom pull: $1,200Helps us capture audio much better during our "man-on-the street" filming, shooting promotions and commercials, etc. -Wireless receiver: $400Allows us to film street interviews using a cordless mic. This makes it much easier to maneuver in crowded events. STORAGE total = $2,000 (5.1%)-SSD drives and SDXC cards: $2,000These store hours of valuable footage from the show, and transfer the data between devices. No room for failure. SET total = $1,200 (3.1%)-Green Screen background: $200Enables editors to add special visual effects in post production. This saves us time and money because we don’t have to go elsewhere to film or pay for another studio. -Darker Black Curtain: $1,000This will improve the overall color quality of the show and cut down on adjustments in post-production. GRAND TOTAL: $17,400 + $12,600 + $5,880 + $2,000 + $1,200 = $39,080 The Fallen State started in January of 2016 with no subscribers, no headlines, and no connections to big celebrities.  In little more than two years, we’ve created a cultural, political and spiritual earthquake felt around the world by the rich and famous, as well as the unknown.As an example, one of our most impactful shows was with Amber Rose.  It went viral, getting picked up everywhere—from Yahoo! Thank you Mr. Peterson, you saved my life and God got his child back.﻿ --Robert Elliott -Jesse, you’re out here being the strong father role model a lot of us never had thank you!! --James McDonald -I have been listening to you for a few months now....I found my soul again and have found so much happiness again. ❤﻿ --Denise Eagan -I'm a proud Hindu from India.. and there is a saying amongst us that the eyes are often windows to the soul. story:
Short Summary

I'm Allyson. In 2010 I placed my son for adoption. It was the hardest thing I've done in my life. My son is now 8, and I'm very fortunate for our relationship. I'm looking to make a web series about the various sides of adoption. We will have people share stories, discuss open, semi-open and closed adoptions. How the foster care system has changed kid's lives, and much more. The series will air in February 2019 and run 10 episodes for the first season. 

I wanted to start this project because adoption is something I think about everyday. As a birth mother there aren't a lot of places to express your thoughts. I wanted to learn what kids in the foster system deal with. How does being adopted into a family at various ages change a child? How does adopting a child change a family dynamic? What are different reasons birth parents placed their children? I want to give people a platform to share their experiences, and a place to relate.

Helping fund this campaign will help in many ways. I'll be able to travel to more cities, and collect more stories. Currently I am planning on traveling to California, Illinois, Florida and Georgia. I'll be able to help pay for the crew's travel and food. The funds will also help donate clothes and school items to foster children.

What We Need & What You Get

$7,500 is needed to fund Adoption Collection.

5%  ($375) - Indiegogo and credit card fees

5%  ($350) - Advertisement and promoting 

10% ($750) - Equipment

10% ($750) - Location rentals and insurance.

10% ($750) - Perks (pajamas and school supplies)

30% (2,250) - Paying crew and supplying meals. We like to keep our crew happy!

30% (2,250) - Travel expenses. This covers gas and hotels. 

Stretch Goal!

Our stretch goal is $10,000 With the extra $2,500 it would cover more for insurance, research, digital media and promotion. It would also allow us to travel to more cities. Ideally I'd like to make it two other states. I would allow backers to vote on which states!

 

What Do You Get?

Perks!

$1 Thank you on adoptioncollection.com

$10 Shout out on Twitter or Instagram

$20 Thank you in the end credits of an episode

$25  Picture of your family on adoptioncollection.com

$25  Pj's donated to a foster child in your name

$40 Receive a video thank you message from Allyson

$50 Backpack donated to a foster child

$50 Are you looking for someone? (Birth child, parent, or someone else.) Put a picture up on adoptioncollection.com with the information of who you're looking for. Plus get your picture in an episode of Adoption Collection.

$75 Receive a 10 minute Skype call from Allyson to ask any questions you have.

$100 Be a star! Do you want to share your story on Adoption Collection? *Travel expenses not included.

$100 Work on the series. Do you want experience working behind the scenes? Now's your chance to work on an episode.

$500 Associate Producer 

$750 Producer 

$1,000 Executive Producer

Risks & Challenges

There are many risks and challenges associated with the film industry. It's challenging for people to open up about some of their most personal thoughts. We hope to make everyone feel comfortable when sharing their story. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can contribute, thank you. If you can't that's okay too! Either way please ask people to spread the word about the Adoption Collection campaign. Social media is a marvelous way to spread the word quickly. Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Hi, I’m Pete Eliot. And that's me filming in a river. I have a degree in Scriptwriting for Film & TV and a masters in Producing for Film & TV from Bournemouth University, UK – and I've also completed a Sundance Directing course, Carbon Literacy training and a bunch of other cool stuff. I'm a 2020 Nicholl Fellowship semifinalist, a Mind Media Award nominee, and most recently won my first award for a short film drama script about how hoarding disorder affects a family.

I’ve written a lot of drama but I’m also very much a student of comedy, and Litter Pickers is the culmination of everything I enjoy about comedy, and British sitcoms in particular - the main three influences being Spaced, Father Ted and Detectorists. Father Ted mainly for its affectionately odd characters and surreal situations, Spaced for similar reasons plus the dynamic directorial style of Edgar Wright and the inspired music mix, and Detectorists for its outdoors setting and gentle characterisations. Mix up all three with my own unique perspective on life and you get Litter Pickers!

For this series, we’re engaging with the important theme of caring for our environment. Our trio of litter pickers are spending their time tidying up their local community – the best place for anyone to start! And it’s also an activity that can have the added benefit of positive mental wellbeing from spending time outside in nature. While of course having a lot of laughs along the way, I believe that Litter Pickers can provide another positive way to get these messages out there and hopefully encourage at least a few more people not to litter. I also think that now more than ever, we need comedy! Through contributing to our project, you’ll be directly helping to spread these messages and some laughter – similar to that bigger theme of cleaning up our environment – it can only happen through the involvement of many awesome people!

Supporting local talent is important to me, and I’ve been very lucky to find three incredibly talented actors local to Bedfordshire, UK. Albert Welling (Succession, Doctor Who, Outlander) has a list of credits longer than anyone’s leg and will be playing our lead litter picker, the naïve and luckless nature-lover Charlie. Jordan Lewis is an upcoming comedy talent who writes and produces his own comedy sketches – Litter Pickers will be his first step into series content as he plays Brighton, the kind-hearted yet reluctant environmentalist. And last but not least, Elizabeth Cristo, is returning to work with me again after starring as Anxiety in my previous project Today or Not Today, and she is playing the dog-loving , doll-playing rebel, Jess.

Charlie, Brighton, Jess – three very different characters who find it difficult to understand each other at first, they’re thrown together, and yet somehow a wonderful friendship forms between this unlikely trio. Each character has a secret, and these individual and collective story arcs show how everyone has hurdles to overcome as we go about trying to achieve our hopes and dreams in life. The end message will be one of hope as we come to learn about our trio and care about what’s best for them, while laughing at them and with them along the way. And as you’ll see from the additional content that will be released throughout this campaign, the actors are already so passionate about the themes of Litter Pickers, their characters, and the potential of the series.

In terms of filmmaking talent, I will be working with award-winning Director of Photography Malgorzata (Gosia) Pronko. Gosia has a wealth of experience that includes shooting a comedy feature, and a superhuman skill for finding beautiful shots that convey the mood of a scene. She’s as excited as me to get started on the challenge of making Litter Pickers as visually appealing as possible, with that Edgar Wright dynamism being an important influence on our style while incorporating our own sensibilities and what we love about the comedy genre.

And I'm equally delighted that Colin Skevington has agreed to come aboard as Production Manager. Colin is a multi award-winning filmmaker in his own right, so we're blessed to have him in this role, and with his experienced eye for detail and legendary organisational skills, we'll be able to run a very tight ship on Litter Pickers to ensure that filming is completed in the most efficient way possible.

In order to make Litter Pickers a top quality series that allows the whole team to shine at the best of their ability, we're looking to raise £9,000 to make all 6 episodes. This budget will provide paid work for the cast and crew, kit hire (camera, lighting, sound, etc.), food, transport, props, costumes, portable toilet hire, insurance, and post production costs.

I also felt it was important to donate a percentage of the total amount to a charity so we can help others while making Litter Pickers a reality. There’s an amazing charity for stray and abandoned dogs called Dogs Trust, and as Jess is so obsessed with dogs I think she would approve of the decision to go with Dogs Trust!

Dogs Trust will receive 10% of the amount raised up to our £9,000 goal, plus 80% of anything beyond our goal amount. Please check them out at www.dogstrust.org.uk to see their incredible work with caring, rehoming, and rehabilitation for dogs, and there’s also the option of course to make a direct donation on their site in a number of different ways like sponsoring a dog currently in their care.

To make a contribution to Litter Pickers, you can either hit the pink 'BACK IT' button underneath our current total to make a standard contribution or choose a perk. We’ve come up with a list of perks that we hope will also offer some additional enticement. There’s the classics from shoutouts on social media to Executive Producer credits, as well as perks more unique to Litter Pickers with exclusive merchandise and props from the series up for grabs, as well as the opportunity to name a human or animal character! Give the perks a click to see everything included!

Crowdfunding campaigns are a big challenge and if we don’t manage to reach our goal amount in order to make the whole series, we’ll hopefully raise enough to make at least the first couple of episodes (there's a big cliffhanger at the end of episode 1!), so every single contribution is really going to help us take a significant step forward into bringing each episode of the series into reality.

We'll be posting every day on our YouTube, Instagram, Facebook & Twitter accounts for the duration of the campaign, so if you would like to take part by helping our project reach more eyeballs and earholes, please consider sharing it across your social media platforms to spread the word of Litter Pickers! We'll be eternally grateful!

And thank YOU for taking a look at Litter Pickers! There’s going to be loads more additional content coming up throughout this crowdfunding campaign like videos with the actors and comedy sketches, so please feel free to come back, check out the new content and see how we’re getting on!

Each character has a secret, and these individual and collective story arcs show how everyone has hurdles to overcome as we go about trying to achieve our hopes and dreams in life. The end message will be one of hope as we come to learn about our trio and care about what’s best for them, while laughing at them and with them along the way. And as you’ll see from the additional content that will be released throughout this campaign, the actors are already so passionate about the themes of Litter Pickers, their characters, and the potential of the series.In terms of filmmaking talent, I will be working with award-winning Director of Photography Malgorzata (Gosia) Pronko. Gosia has a wealth of experience that includes shooting a comedy feature, and a superhuman skill for finding beautiful shots that convey the mood of a scene. She’s as excited as me to get started on the challenge of making Litter Pickers as visually appealing as possible, with that Edgar Wright dynamism being an important influence on our style while incorporating our own sensibilities and what we love about the comedy genre.And I'm equally delighted that Colin Skevington has agreed to come aboard as Production Manager. Colin is a multi award-winning filmmaker in his own right, so we're blessed to have him in this role, and with his experienced eye for detail and legendary organisational skills, we'll be able to run a very tight ship on Litter Pickers to ensure that filming is completed in the most efficient way possible.In order to make Litter Pickers a top quality series that allows the whole team to shine at the best of their ability, we're looking to raise £9,000 to make all 6 episodes. This budget will provide paid work for the cast and crew, kit hire (camera, lighting, sound, etc.), food, transport, props, costumes, portable toilet hire, insurance, and post production costs.I also felt it was important to donate a percentage of the total amount to a charity so we can help others while making Litter Pickers a reality. There’s an amazing charity for stray and abandoned dogs called Dogs Trust, and as Jess is so obsessed with dogs I think she would approve of the decision to go with Dogs Trust!Dogs Trust will receive 10% of the amount raised up to our £9,000 goal, plus 80% of anything beyond our goal amount. Please check them out at www.dogstrust.org.uk to see their incredible work with caring, rehoming, and rehabilitation for dogs, and there’s also the option of course to make a direct donation on their site in a number of different ways like sponsoring a dog currently in their care.To make a contribution to Litter Pickers, you can either hit the pink 'BACK IT' button underneath our current total to make a standard contribution or choose a perk. We’ve come up with a list of perks that we hope will also offer some additional enticement. There’s the classics from shoutouts on social media to Executive Producer credits, as well as perks more unique to Litter Pickers with exclusive merchandise and props from the series up for grabs, as well as the opportunity to name a human or animal character! Give the perks a click to see everything included!Crowdfunding campaigns are a big challenge and if we don’t manage to reach our goal amount in order to make the whole series, we’ll hopefully raise enough to make at least the first couple of episodes (there's a big cliffhanger at the end of episode 1!), so every single contribution is really going to help us take a significant step forward into bringing each episode of the series into reality.We'll be posting every day on our YouTube, Instagram, Facebook & Twitter accounts for the duration of the campaign, so if you would like to take part by helping our project reach more eyeballs and earholes, please consider sharing it across your social media platforms to spread the word of Litter Pickers! We'll be eternally grateful!And thank YOU for taking a look at Litter Pickers! There’s going to be loads more additional content coming up throughout this crowdfunding campaign like videos with the actors and comedy sketches, so please feel free to come back, check out the new content and see how we’re getting on!

story:
Our Story

Trillo & Suede is a multi-award-winning film noir parody web series, featuring a ventriloquist detective and his wooden partner. All ten episodes of Season 1 were released in early 2020 on our youtube channel: https://www.youtube.com/c/TrilloSuede

The series has been burning up the international film festival circuit. Winner for Best Web Series at the New York International Film Awards; Winner for Best Web Series at the MP Film Award; Winner for Best Web Series at the Top Shorts Film Festival; Winner for Best Comedy at the Assurdo Film Festival, Milan Italy; Winner of the Outstanding Achievement Award at the IndieX Film Fest, Hollywood CA; Winner of the Bronze Medal in the Independent Shorts Awards...and numerous other awards.

I (Jonathan Geffner) am the writer/creator/executive producer/lead actor.  A real-life professional ventriloquist, I play the roles of both Trillo and Suede. Inspired by the tremendous critical success of Season 1, I have written all ten episodes of Season 2, and have lined up most of the cast and crew to shoot it. We plan to shoot it as soon as the pandemic situation allows us to - this July/August if it is safe to do so, or as soon afterward as possible. It will be shot in and around New York City, as was Season 1.

Join us now in the creation of Season 2 of this uniquely exciting project, and receive some cool perks for your support!

Our Goal & What You Get

Every dollar of your contribution will go toward the production of Trillo & Suede Season 2. Our $22,000 goal will barely cover the cost of shooting and editing Season 2 on a very tight budget. If we are fortunate enough to surpass our goal, every dollar of it will go toward adding production value to the episodes - to do some of the shots and scenes that we would love to do if our budget will allow us to - plus the many additional costs of promoting the series: film festival fees and transportation costs, additional post-production costs, social media ads, costs involved with pitching the series to Netflix and other cable tv platforms etc.

All of our talented cast and crew will be working for very modest fees because of their enthusiasm for and belief in the Trillo & Suede project. But even modest fees will add up quickly over the ten or eleven 12-hour days that we will need to shoot Season 2. Plus there will be equipment rental fees, location fees, transportation fees, cost of props and wardrobe, and lots of nutritious food to keep our cast and crew well-fed and energetic throughout the grueling-yet-exciting shoot. 

Season 2 will be even wilder and crazier than Season 1. I am determined to bring my vision to life even if our campaign goal is not met. But your support will greatly reduce the stress of worrying about the financial strain on my own pocket, and allow us all to better focus on making Season 2 the amazing project that it has the potential to be. And you'll get some cool perks in appreciation for your support.

Other Ways You Can Help

• Share this campaign with friends, family, coworkers, and on social media.

• If you know someone who writes for a journal or a blog, tell them about us so they can spread the word about our campaign.

Your help of any kind will be greatly appreciated. 

We'd love to hear your comments and feedback. Welcome to the Trillo & Suede team!

Meet Our Campaign Team

Jonathan Geffner: Writer/Creator/Executive Producer/Co-Director/Lead Actor of the Trillo & Suede Web Series. Jonathan is a professional ventriloquist, pianist, novelist, Yiddish teacher/translator, and single dad who raised two extraordinary daughters.

 

Kat Holm: Director/Producer. A multi-talented young woman, Kat has also worked as a Director of Photography, a Videographer, and Editor of Hofstra University's Relations Department. Kat is thrilled to be working on Season 2 of the Trillo & Suede Web Series.

 

Sabrina Geffner: Plays the role of Zoe in the Trillo & Suede Web Series.  She is a film major at School of Visual Arts in New York City. 

 

Dave Polgar (Shtoys/Shlep) - is humbled to be returning as a recurring character in Season 2 of Trillo & Suede. Dave was a resident artist at the Hedgerow Theatre, Philadelphia. He has also done a fair amount of commercial, television, and film work from New England to Southern Florida, with "Trillo & Suede" being his first New York-based web series. Many thanks to Zoran Kovcic, Penelope Reed, Jared Reed, Tom Teti, Susan Wefel, his friends and family too for their unflagging support, and Jonathan Geffner for this opportunity, his passion, and tireless effort.

 

 

Constance Cooper: Plays Mrs. Kaminsky in the Trillo & Suede Web Series. She is also currently playing the title role in VICE Media’s Senior Correspondent and will appear online live on June 26 in a modern take on Love’s Labour’s Lost. In her previous decades as a composer, she received a PhD from Princeton in composition and won first prize in Austria’s Gustav Mahler competition.

 

Chris Torem: Plays the role of Goose in the Trillo & Suede Web Series. In addition to acting, Chris is a Psychologist, PE Teacher, Football Coach & Powerlifter. His Acting Resume (Films, TV, Infomercials & Music Videos...) can be found on both Actors Access & Boston Casting, as well as the Christorem.com website.
