THANK YOU!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Morgan Elizabeth Millogo, and I have put together an incredible team of women to make the web series Tabs & Clea. I have a BFA in Film and Television Production from NYU, have worked over 10 years in indie film in front of and behind the camera, am a former burlesque performer and emcee, and am a Certified Contemporary Shamanic Practitioner. All of these explored roads have led me to creating Tabs & Clea. 

Tabs & Clea is an opportunity for me to bring together a community of women storytellers who want to share female centric stories and laugh and have fun while doing it. Everyone who works on this project receives support in creating their future projects as well, through the offering of talents from other members of the Tabs & Clea team. 

Contributions let the whole Tabs & Clea team know that you are interested in female centric stories and support women artists and storytellers. This encouragement is HUGE! To know that women in central creator and power rolls will be supported by an audience, changes the independent film game. It also helps us create local work with local talent and support local businesses. We get to make our work on our terms, and we are all ready to soar! 

What We Need & What You Get

We need $2,000 to rent equipment to make this web series look and sound as good as possible for as affordable as possible. We don't need to rent a lot, but we do prefer to use equipment other than our phones. We have an excellent cinematographer, Rachael Saltzman, and no matter the budget, she will make it look good! However, having certain tools will help the shooting process go faster and look even better. 

Our incentives are fun! I am an excellent Tarot card reader and for every donation, you will receive at least one Tarot card pulled by me with a focus on YOU. A picture of the card will be emailed to you, along with a description. With a $35 contribution or higher, you receive a hand picked crystal, courtesy of Voices of the Stone here in the Hudson Valley. Other incentives include some palo santo to do your own cleansing, a Tabs & Clea tote bag, a special private link to the series before it's released with a Skype Q&A with available cast and crew, and one lucky contributor will receive a featured extra role! 

Whatever amount we raise will be used to get what we need to get this project made. We are working out the different levels of necessity and know how to spend wisely. Tabs & Clea will be made! 

The Impact

There is a lot of content in the world, but not a lot of funny, complex, heartfelt, empowering stories about female friendships. You will be entertained by Tabs & Clea, and you will feel good that you contributed to empowering women to work together to tell this story. Every female voice that speaks up with truth through art, or any form, makes our world better and stronger. Women and men banding together to let these voices rise changes how things have been done and paves a new path forward for us all. The smallest amount of support in any capacity makes a difference. 

I see projects through until the end. In film school, I was given $800 and a video camera to make my thesis film, and I did! Over the years, I have worked on projects that never saw the light of day. My strengths include my resourcefulness along with my ability to make things happen despite any limitations. 

Tabs & Clea will be made with whatever contributions we receive. I will make it happen with what we raise. 

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest hurdle is equipment. However, we made the pitch video just using an iPhone, and my last resort scenario for the web series is to do the same. However, any amount of money raised will wisely be used to get the most efficient, effective and affordable equipment. Our cinematographer is aware that what we raise will be our budget, and she is prepared to problem solve the equipment riddle with whatever amount we have. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand if you are not able to make a monetary contribution at this time. That is ok! What we really want is for the word to get out about Tabs & Clea and for people to watch it when it comes out in 2018! You can help us by liking our facebook page to keep up to date, and sharing our Indiegogo campaign! Indiegogo has sharing tools, so please feel free to use them! Sharing is the greatest form of supporting! 

Thank you for taking the time to view our campaign! We hope you keep up to date on Tabs & Clea and watch next year! THANK YOU!

Sincerely,

Morgan Millogo

And the Tabs & Clea Team!

story:
Short Summary

gypsi is an Original Supernatural television drama series that offers multiple meanings and story lines. It is an entirely unique and new story-line, not based on any existing books or previously aired publications, written by Angel and Mysti Cozart, that explores the rich cultural mythology of southern voodoo in a fictional town in southern Louisiana that has been hidden from the world through all phases of mankind’s cultural and technological evolution. The series centers on the adventures of gypsi lasalle, a carefree nomad who begins to feel a draw to bring her home, to a place she’s never been before.

gypsi lasalle is an Adventurous free spirited witch who lives the life of a gypsy among the mortals. She is on the precipice of discovering that there is more to who she really is. Her journey will reveal how important she will become to the unknown, mysterious, mystical town in the bayou. As gypsi’s power begins to increase, so does the intensity of her dreams. A reoccurring cry for help from across centuries leads her back to a home and a town that she has no memory of. She will uncover that family ties can be more binding than the blood that flows through her veins.

    Angel and Mysti Cozart - Writers and Co-Creators: Angel and Mysti  grew up in a small town and had a great passion for music and entertainment. With over 2 decades of experience in the entertainment industry.

    What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking to raise $10,000 for the final push for our funding to film  gypsi. I know, it sounds like a low amount, but we have had unbelievable support from our actors, locations to help lower the costs. So, we've got some awesome perks lined up that we encourage you to look through but here are few really awesome ones. 

Pre-Screening: We are hosting a special screening of the project upon completion. In addition to watching gypsi on the big screen, we will have a catered event with select cast and crew members there as well. Plus, entrance into the exclusive VIP after party.  $150.00 

Speaking Role: A speaking part in the pilot episode, IMDB credits, your name in the end credits of the pilot episode and lunch with select members of the cast and crew. You can also bring one guest to hang out behind the scenes and watch your performance! Plus, you can have your choice of any of the previous perks which includes the Pre-Screening and VIP and after party.  $500.00

Exclusive Access: Day On Set: You and a guest will come to the filming of the pilot episode of gypsi. You will share in the creative journey with a day on set with us and get exclusive access to behind the scenes, meals with the cast and crew and total access to our creators. (TBD)  $100.00 

Voodoo Swag: Get your very own custom, limited edition, gypsi T-Shirt with the cover art from the show. The cost of the shirt includes delivery!  $35.00

DVD and Digital Download: Get a stand alone DVD of the Pilot Episode of gypsi when it is released with exclusive behind the scenes full length commentary from the  Writers, Producers and select cast members. PLUS a separate Digital Download of "The Making Of gypsi" behind the scenes documentary.  $20.00 

Personalized Autograph: This is for all those #TeamChase fans out there! A personalized, autographed, photo of Chase Coleman with a dedication for your support! (Not included in any other incentive)  $25.00

All The Voodoo: Custom Limited Edition gypsi T-Shirt. A copy of the gypsi Soundtrack featuring original music from the creators Angel and Mysti Cozart and others. Personalized Autographed Pic of the gypsi Cast. DVD of the Pilot Episode with commentary. Digital Download of the "Making Of gypsi" Documentary. This perk also includes access to our behind the scenes private link, exclusive interviews with the cast and crew and production stills from the making of our pilot episode.  $50.00 

Risks & Challenges

gypsi has always had a very open and transparent relationship with our supporters and we continue to do so. 

That being said, the challenge for us is to have enough funds to make sure that we can compensate our cast for travel expenses, lodging and other sundries. Although everyone has been incredibly generous with their time and talents, we believe in making sure people are compensated for their time. It is the only thing you cannot ever get back, after all.

Our supporters, the #TeamVooDoo people have been WONDERFUL and together we can accomplish anything we set out to do.

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    The truth is that gypsi has grown to this level because of the wonderful people who follow us and support us. That means YOU! If you cannot contribute financially, please consider joining our #TeamVooDoo on social media and spread the word to any contacts that you may think can help grow this amazing project.

    The easiest way for you to share is to use Indiegogo's built in sharing tools! There is very little Voodoo needed to make it happen!

story:
Short Summary

 

I'm a graduate from NYU's Cinema Studies program, studying the craft of filmmaking (also watching a lot of DVD extras on my free time), and have been writing and producing plays, and have been taking classes at UCB (bonus: I'm in the Advanced Study program for Sketch). Bonus: I'm collaborating with an incredibly experienced cast & crew, including Sam Haft, Michelle Jones, Sarah Bedrick, Lisa Bober, Remi Moses, Savannah Whitten, Marisa Roper, Conner Ozer, Katherine Wadleigh, Nicholas Patrella, Brooke Comegys, and many more.

Why this web series and why now? Well, I'd be lying if I didn't mention I went through a rough breakup last year (long story, won't bore ya with the details but she's blocked on everything and hopefully she isn't looking at this campaign right now and if yes Hi!). This series is the fruit of that shit show. During that time, I got low. I found art to be a comforting source in understanding the universal human suffering that comes from the end of a seemingly happy relationship.  Music, movies, books, something to reach out and tell me everything will be alright. I wanted to create something that could help people feel better when a life change of this magnitude occurs and really explore why relationships end and what our exes mean to us when everything is over. And possibly understand relationships better. And also get some cheap laughs. Think of it as Man Seeking Woman by way of Rick and Morty and Bojack Horseman. 

Somehow, writing this series, it helped me get back to normal. I was going to table it, slip into a drawer where no one could find it, but then I showed it to people. And they really, really liked it. It connected to a deep emotional level with others that I didn't know was possible. Now I want to share it with the world. 

What We Need & What You Get

This is where your contribution goes:

  • Paying our actors, make-up artists, puppeteers, and film crew
  • Covering costs for on-location shoots and props
  • Allowing us to make the best damn web series possible

What you'll get:

  • A web-series you can watch over and over again (yes, even during Peak TV - they're only 5 minutes a pop)
  • Fun rewards! 

The Impact

If this ends up making it, you can be on the ground floor of another breakout web series and boast to your friends "Hey, I funded it before it was big!" (You probably won't though, since that joke is pretty played out). Also, potentially helping people out of some rough patches in their lives. 

Risks & Challenges

I've shot videos in high school on an old camcorder that took VHS tapes so it's been awhile. But I'm collaborating with people who frequently work on film sets (cast and crew included) and, to make the best product possible, I'll need the funds to hire some of the best crew to make this happen. There will also be a lot of complicated effects that will balloon the budget. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Get the word out! Talking about it makes this project come closer to reality! Plus, a super rich person might hear about it and that can fund this thing in one go. Also, consider joining the crew! Applications are welcome.

Allowing us to make the best damn web series possible

What you'll get:

A web-series you can watch over and over again (yes, even during Peak TV - they're only 5 minutes a pop)
Fun rewards! 


The Impact
If this ends up making it, you can be on the ground floor of another breakout web series and boast to your friends "Hey, I funded it before it was big!" (You probably won't though, since that joke is pretty played out). Also, potentially helping people out of some rough patches in their lives. 

Risks & Challenges
I've shot videos in high school on an old camcorder that took VHS tapes so it's been awhile. But I'm collaborating with people who frequently work on film sets (cast and crew included) and, to make the best product possible, I'll need the funds to hire some of the best crew to make this happen. There will also be a lot of complicated effects that will balloon the budget. 

Other Ways You Can Help
Get the word out! Talking about it makes this project come closer to reality! Plus, a super rich person might hear about it and that can fund this thing in one go. Also, consider joining the crew! Applications are welcome.

story:
Hello! My name is Lola Rocknrolla. I have been obsessed with B-movies since I saw “Creature from the Black lagoon” and “Rocky Horror” in the same weekend. I was 7 years old (remind me to thank my dad!). Since then I vowed to make my own versions. I have since made the short films Dragzilla, Night of the Living Gay, I was a Tranny Werewolf. I was always a huge fan of Blaxploitation and created my own Foxy Brown, Nefertitty and then the sequel Nefertitty in Space. All my films have played festivals worldwide but now it’s time to come home. Nefertitty TV wants to be in your living room.

I have since teamed up with the amazing producers Nick Brooks (dir:Sam) and Sibyl Santiago (Sitting Cat Productions) to turn Nefertitty into Nefertitty TV!

Although Nefertitty is a Blaxploitation comedy she is able to bring up serious matters of sexism and racism while kicking ass in an amazing spandex outfit with not one afro hair out of place. 

With the current political tide and the rise of white nationalism many of us don’t know what to do…so Nefertitty will do it for you! She uppercuts racism in it’s face with a smile and one liners to rival any action hero.

Nefertitty needs your generosity to become a reality. In return you can get tons of cool merch. Signed posters, T-shirts, downloads of all Lola's films, invites to the premiere, even a credit or a walk on role!

With your help we can afford sets, props, food, locations, light and camera equipment, good sound, professional crews and actors, make-up, costumes, editing and FX. Thank you so much for your interest in our campaign.

Power to the people!

story:
WHAT AND WHY ARE WE DOING?

It has been 41 years from famous and, by that – time standards unrepeatable Kragujevac to Kilimanjaro expedition when five old and famous Yugoslavian "Zastava 101" cars went through 11.000 km long journey from Kragujevac in Serbia to Kilimanjaro in Africa. Everybody said it’s unique and it cannot be repeated. We agree. But, regarding the technology nowadays, being inspired by this expedition, we decided to go a step further,  making another unrepeatable journey – driving from Belgrade, capital of Serbia, to Tokyo on the wings of sports spirits announcing the upcoming Olympic games in Tokyo. And to make things more interesting, we will do it using old - timer cars from countries that are mapped on our route.  It will be a convoy consisted of three old timer cars from Serbia (Zastava 101), Russia (Lada Niva), Japan (Honda), two motorbikes and fifteen expedition members supported by the worldwide media.

Our idea is to experience once in a lifetime journey meeting new people, making friendships, trying out various crazy and fun things, learning about different cultures, overcoming our fears and all of that in front of cameras in order to spread travel spirit and cultural tolerance to worldwide public.  We will make a series of episodes that will be a unique mixture of travel shows, reality, survivor and documentary programs but with our special twist because a real travel doesn’t reveal in discovering new landscapes, but in completely new, different perspective about the world and yourself. Besides that, we will create tons of various multimedia materials for social networks and internet that will be containing behind the scenes and unique moments revealing even more personal side of our journey and containing useful tips for travel and sightseeing of all of the countries on our route.

You still doubt us? Or think we’re insane? Don’t doubt - yes we are! We can do this because we deeply believe that understanding other cultures and traditions is the first step in creating a healthy society and we’re going to bring it closer to you because we’re insane about travel, spreading good vibes and living life to the fullest.  Support our project and become a traveler, don’t be a tourist!

WHERE ARE WE GOING?

We are going to drive 26.000km long journey across Europe and Asia. The idea is to start this Unforgettable journey in our hometown, Belgrade, capital of Serbia. On our route to north, until the Hungarian border we will stop in Novi Sad, the city of biggest Eastern – European music festival, Exit, and also a world capital of culture in 2012, and a few bigger cities in Serbia. After that, we will take you through the plains of Hungary and variety of their exotic cuisine, the imposing Slovakian mountains, almost infinite Polish forests and old cities with legends about heroes and dragons, through vast wilderness of Belarus and Russia, following the route of famous Transsiberian railway and enjoying incredible Russian nature and cities during the route. After that, we’re leaving Europe behind at very end of the Eurasian mainland – in Vladivostok and taking the ship to country of the rising sun – Japan, getting to know their worldwide unique traditions and rituals, driving right to the place where Olympic Games will be opened. When we reach that goal, to make the journey more interesting, we will go back to Serbia through South Korea, taking a boat to Beijing and then driving again across the plains and mountains of China and Kazakhstan. After that you will be travelling with us across the Caspian Sea and Azerbaijan deserts, climb with us on the peaks of the Caucasus in Georgia and take a dip in the Black sea, learning about old Turkish hedonistic culture in Istanbul, getting back to Europe. Then we’ll travel along the beautiful coast of Greece to Thessaloniki, via Macedonia and back to Serbia, to the southern border of our country again, where we’ll visit all the major cities to Belgrade, where we end our journey.

WHO IS MAKING THIS TRAVEL SHOW?

We are a group of friends who travel a lot. Some people live for travelling, we travel to live. :)
They say it's always a good thing to find friends that share the same passion as you do, I say it's much funnier to find friends that share a same mental illness as you do :D

Just kidding... Who are we?

We are The Wonder Drifters! Young, but fully professional production with years of experience in filming, marketing and tourism. Our passion is simple, travel the world, meet new people, experience new cultures, explore the unknown and share our passion with everyone using our vast knowledge about video production, media and viral internet trends! Our goal is to offer to our clients, cooperators and, first of all, to our audience fun, dynamic, useful and innovative content that will motivate everyone to get out of their comfort zones, try something new, meet different cultures and become real travelers and Wonder Drifters, just like us.

WHY SHOULD WE GET YOUR SUPPORT?

       Because you're going to have so much fun and learn so many things watching twelve travel fanatics doing almost impossible expedition, offering you, as a viewer, tons of knowledge, fun, good vibes, and a chance to live a thousand lives just by watching our video material and who knows – maybe we'll inspire you with our experience and trips to visit these countries, or event better, to overcome your doubts and make your own expedition!

        Everyone knows that the countries of Eastern Europe and Asia are definitely among the countries with the richest and oldest cultures in the world, but many people don’t know enough about these countries because they are visiting mostly well-known classical touristic places. Our goal is to change focus. Is there a better way to taste the contrasts of the huge cultural diversity of these countries than going by car all the way to the Far East and back?

        Just imagine a recorded adventure from Serbia to Japan about the life of different people, beautiful landscapes and attractions on our way with a couple of pre-planned stops and tons of improvisational stops. Mountains, rivers, deepest and cleanest lakes, eleven time zones and two continents, churches, mosques, Buddhist temples, forests, taigas, seas, deserts ... all this in just one expedition! It is really an Unrepeatable journey! There are 26.000 kilometers and 26.000 reasons why we simply MUST GO on this epic journey.

And the last, but not the least, we have really enormously cool perks to offer to anyone infected with adventurous travel spirit and willing to support our project and make it happen!

 

INDIEGOGO CAMPAIGN GOAL?

We are going to divide full project in three stages.

STAGE I - First stage preparations (GOAL: 10 000$)        

- Buying old timer cars and motorbikes (Zastava 101, Lada Niva, Honda Civic, Honda Cross Country)                              
- Vehicle preparations and branding 
- Vehicle documentation preparations 
 
STAGE II - Second stage preparations (GOAL: 35 000$)

- Buying proper filming and storing equipment
- Equipment documentation preparations 

STAGE III - Production (GOAL: 75 000$)  

Expedition begins! 
- Covering travel expenses (Insurance, Fuel, Accommodation, Food, Drinks etc.)
- Filming permits and documents 
- Visas
- Promotion and Marketing expenses
- Unexpected expenses 
- Post-production expenses 


Every single penny we fund raise here will be placed just exactly where is't needed. In automobiles, in accommodation, in equipment, documentation,marketing etc.
In order to make sure we justify your help, every single step and budget cost will be extremely transparent and clear. 

FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS

Where and when will the filming happen?
Beginning of the expedition is planed for April 2018. Filming however fill begin much before that. We will film the preparations for the very expedition as well.

First stage of filming will take place in Serbia, in our home town, Belgrade, to be exact. When the expedition begins filming will continue tough Serbia with few stops on our way to the North border, trough Hungary, Slovak Republic, Poland, Belarus, Russia, Japan, South Korea, China, Kazakhstan, Azerbaijan, Georgia, Turkey, Greece and Macedonia. 

If you live in any of the countries above, feel free to contact us! We will be glad to meet with you!

How can I be in this documentary?
We would really love to meet you all and make you be part of our team and our show. No matter who you are and where you live, when we visit your country and your city we will come to meet you. It's important that you contact us for more information or to give us ideas. We would love to make you our official guide in your city, town, village or wherever you may live.  ;)

Why are you going with "Flexible Funding" on Indiegogo?

We are using flexible funding for two reasons: 
1) Because we are going to make this travel show no matter what. 
2) Because we chose not to use PayPal. Although PayPal can be great, they have security measures built into their system that could freeze the account and lock the money away for long periods of time. Sadly, other people have had this problem in the past.
 

What if you don’t reach the campaign goal?
We are committed to make this show no matter what happens or how much we raise. Any and all money received from this campaign will go towards making this documentary. The show must go on!
 

Will the documentary be free on YouTube?
Yes! Furthermore, on our YouTube channel you will find some behind scenes footage and directors cuts. DVDs, Blu-Rays, and digital copies will also be available for purchase for those who would like a personal copy

WHO TO CONTACT FOR ADDTIONAL INFOMRATION

Marko Milicevic, Executive Producer: https://www.facebook.com/marko.milichevich90

Tea Puharic, Executive Director: https://www.facebook.com/aetcirahup​

Srdjan Srdjenovic, Director of Photography: https://www.facebook.com/TheSrki

Or by sending an e-mail: wonderdrifters@gmail.com

 

HOW ELSE YOU CAN CONTRIBUTE?

Spread the word! Share, send it to your friends, tell the people! We will keep you all updated with all new information and progress of the project. Stay with us and we will share every single step along the way!

THANK YOU AND SEE YOU SOON!

story:
About

Nerds Incognito was created by Reutan Collective company member, Sarah McMillan. Her passion for all things nerdy coupled with a study of addiction and destructive behaviors made her pose the question: can anything be a problem if you allow it? 

That was four years ago. She's been developing and working on the project in her free time ever since. Last October she pitched a joint venture with Reutan Collective and Junior Giant Productions and the rest is history. 

Who's involved

Here are some of the key players involved in Nerds Incognito. Check 'em out, we think they're pretty cool.

The Cast
Emily Nikfar- Cynthia
Emma Sharp- Catherine
Jen Bennett- Quinn
Brian Zinda- Zach
Nathaniel Andrew- George
Gabrielle Gulledge- Carol Singers
David Servillo- Paul
Michael Vizzi- Clark
Daniel Shtivelberg- Jack
Travis Marsala- David
Lindsey Dorcus- Tammy

The Crew
Creator- Sarah F McMillan
Cinematographer- Mitchell Mussatto
Assistant Director- Arin Westerbeck
Sound- Matt Vince
Stunts- Will Bennett


What We Need & What You Get

The budget of the project goes to the following 

  • Payment for the cast and the crew
  • Production Insurance- a good set is a safe set
  • Feeding the team, no one likes to work on an empty stomach
  • If we do not complete this goal, we will be utilizing the funds to make the series work, while still paying our cast. 

The Impact

We understand there are countless independent projects being produced, so why should you donate to this one? 

  • This project has been in development for years
  • Reutan Collective and Junior Giant have seen multiple projects to completion, we will get this project done.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate today, that's okay here are a few other ways to help: 

  • Share this campaign on social media, help us get the word out. 
  • Keep an eye out for other opportunities via Reutan Collective and Junior Giant's facebook pages.
  • Like Reutan Collective and Junior Giant on facebook and follow us on twitter.

story:
SQUAD
 

Let's cut to the chase, shall we? Long story short, I (Kim Whitfield) have written and produced a comedy web series titled SQUAD. Most people say it's like the black version of FRIENDS. That's not necessarily the angle I was going for, but comme ci comme ca...The goal of this series is to share a relatable story that promotes diversity, cultural artistry, and the urban community of Brooklyn. In addition to that, it's also really funny show about funny people doing funny shit. Help us fund it?

This past February, we self-produced the pilot episode and now it's time to continue the story and complete the rest of Season 1. We've reached out to other artists and industry professionals who are equally excited about this venture and are willing to help. Now we just need one last thing: funding. Aaaannnd that’s the pitch.

About The Creator: Kim Whitfield - I’m a Brooklyn-based actor, writer, producer, and Founder of KDub Productions. Last year I graduated from my studies in Film from the New York Conservatory of the Dramatic Arts, and have since hit the ground running. I’ve acted in several plays and film projects here in New York as well as produced my own mini projects, but I’m ready to kick it up a notch (or two, or three, or more…) with my web series, SQUAD. 

What We Need & What You Get

Filmmaking is expensive! On top of researching, writing, and mapping out productions details, we need to pay for equipment, crew, cast, food, travel, a kickass editor, festival fees, and more. Our goal is to reach $10,000 - a micro budget when it comes to filmmaking. It sounds like a lot, but with your generous contribution, support, and social media sharing, I know we can make it happen. 

To the right, you’ll see some lovely perks we have lined up for you —>

But of course, any contribution is welcome and we thank you!

The Impact

SQUAD isn’t just a passion project, and it isn’t just another web series being made about friends who live together and do dumb shit. If that’s all it was, we wouldn’t be putting in the time and effort to make it. SQUAD is more than a party trick; it’s a cultural and social experience produced by a FEMALE FILMMAKER that highlights the daily life of BLACK MILLENNIALS. Did you know that in 2014, according to PBS, only 12.5% of characters in American film and television were black, and according to San Diego State’s Center for the Study of Women in Television and Film, only 7% of directors on the top 250 films in 2014 were directed by women? It’s time to REPRESENT! SQUAD is culture, it’s progress, it’s art.

Other Ways You Can Help

Don’t have a dollar to spare? Please share our Indiegogo on social media; The more people that want to join our SQUAD, the better! 

And that's all there is to it.

Filmmaking is expensive! On top of researching, writing, and mapping out productions details, we need to pay for equipment, crew, cast, food, travel, a kickass editor, festival fees, and more. Our goal is to reach $10,000 - a micro budget when it comes to filmmaking. It sounds like a lot, but with your generous contribution, support, and social media sharing, I know we can make it happen. 
To the right, you’ll see some lovely perks we have lined up for you —>
But of course, any contribution is welcome and we thank you!
The Impact
SQUAD isn’t just a passion project, and it isn’t just another web series being made about friends who live together and do dumb shit. If that’s all it was, we wouldn’t be putting in the time and effort to make it. SQUAD is more than a party trick; it’s a cultural and social experience produced by a FEMALE FILMMAKER that highlights the daily life of BLACK MILLENNIALS. Did you know that in 2014, according to PBS, only 12.5% of characters in American film and television were black, and according to San Diego State’s Center for the Study of Women in Television and Film, only 7% of directors on the top 250 films in 2014 were directed by women? It’s time to REPRESENT! SQUAD is culture, it’s progress, it’s art.
Other Ways You Can Help
Don’t have a dollar to spare? Please share our Indiegogo on social media; The more people that want to join our SQUAD, the better! 
And that's all there is to it.

story:
*Who We Are

The cast and crew of B-City Season 2 come from a variety of backgrounds and experiences that will ensure that the series is a continued success.

Jolie East-Miji (Creator, Writer, Director, Producer):

Born and raised in Baltimore City, Jolie is a graduate of Stevenson University with a Bachelor of Science in  Film/Video.  After falling in love with writing and film at the young age of twelve, it continues to be her passion today. Her motto is “entertain with a purpose” and her goal is to tell the real life stories of everyday people both on the screen and stage.

The Crew "Tayari Productions"

 

 

 

 

Tayari Productions  is Baltimore based production company founded in 2013 by cousins Jae Mitch and Scola . The company has it’s hands in all genres of cinematography ranging from commercials to film. The production team and crew are also comprised of a diverse group of individuals- many also have full-time jobs outside of film making. Overall, the crew is a group of motivated, positive individuals that is looking to further develop our vision and expand our passion for visual storytelling to involve community outreach and opportunities for youth.

The Cast (The 4 leads)

Mandela "Manny Be" Brown (Brandon) is a Film/ stage Actor/ Rapper/ Painter from Baltimore Maryland. Manny has worked on many projects ranging from HBO's the wire to stage projects like "Our Town" at Stevenson University. His music is locally known as well as his paintings .

Chris Debord (Tone) is a  US Army veteran turned Actor/Comedian/Writer.  Chris has worked on projects for Dunkin' Donuts, Pepsi, and others. Chris is the author of "The Undisciplined Cowboys", a book that can be found on Amazon.com.  Chris has also performed at comedy clubs and venues in New York, California, Texas and more.

Rick Palmer (Pritti) Currently resides in Baltimore, Maryland. Recently played leading role in music video by R&B Artist Rose Breyae entitled "Be More". Rick received an opportunity in 2007 to work with New York Agency Model Search Inc. as a runway model. Since then he's starred in Theater Plays, Films, Commercials, TV Pilot, Fashion Shows, Print and Commercial Modeling.

Richey Wiser (C.J)  has had a rough upbringing but through life threatening surgeries and a car accident that almost paralyzed him, his love and devotion to acting has always stayed strong. This disciplined actor comes from a stand-up comedy background. His love of acting definitely shows through when he is in front of a camera.

*SERIES OVERVIEW

Since the riots in the summer of 2015, the city of Baltimore has not only been in a state of recovery, but has dealt with a return to the spotlight with a perpetually negative image.Despite the struggles that exist in this city, as in every city, the community, creativity, and love is strong. This is what B-City portrays and this image is what the series aims to reinforce. B-City aims to not only provide further community building within the city, but also build connections and a sense of understanding of the strong culture that exists in Baltimore.

B-City follows four crazy childhood friends who live in Baltimore City as they carry out their everyday lives and relationships through hysterical and sometimes complex situation. Hailed the guy version of the show ‘Girlfriends’, each character in the series has their own unique personality which seems to get them both in and out of predicaments with each other and in their own lives.In its second season, the series will be even bigger and go deeper into the lives of our four main male characters and the people who surround their everyday lives.

Season 2: "Hard Pasts Makes a Brighter Future"

B-City returns after season one, and digs deeper into the main characters' pasts. Each character has a unique situation that makes them stronger and better for the future. Season 2 focuses on Pritti, who, after being embarrassed by his mother at an important event at the end of season 1,  slowly spirals out of control throughout the course of the season, bringing up past wounds and secrets. Season 2 delves into new and established  topics such as Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder, drug abuse, and sexuality.

Read more about the first season of B-City in the series’ feature article in blacktalent.tv: http://blacktalent.tv/2017/01/20/look-whos-next...

*FUNDING

Season 2 requires $6,000 in funding. The aim is to acquire these funds through Indiegogo donors, with the remaining costs being recouped by production. This budget of $6000 was calculated to cover the following expenses: compensation for the crew, 23 member cast, craft services, and locations for the 17 shoot days scheduled between September 2017-March 2018, as well as post-production editing of the series, and promotional materials to continue to spread the series and build its fan-base.

In return for the support of Indiegogo donors, several exciting perks have been developed to engage our supporters in the B-City community. These perks are a way of saying thanks for donations of every size, and include: shout-outs, being an extra on set, t-shirts, wrist bands, to being an IMDB-credited executive producer. If you make goods, merchandise, or own a business, perks are also available for independent product placement in either an episode or throughout the entire season.

Be sure to check out our full list of perks and select one that interests you!

*PROJECT TIMELINE

Pre-Production (Present- September 2017): acquisition of financing, and securing locations, talent, and crew

Production (September 2017-March 2018): filming of the 7 episodes over the course of 17 shoot days (estimated). Filming will take place September 2017-November 2017, and February 2018-March 2018

Post-Production (March 2018- 12/2018): Editing, sound design, and scoring of the episodes in the season

Release (01/19- tentative): B-City Season 2 will begin to be released for public viewing

story:
The animation centres around three friends, Ben, Ade and Tuan. Ben is a recent graduate currently working as a software tester, Ben a club promoter and Tuan the joke of the group is a stock broker. The story alternates around their lives and how they manage to survive as  young men in a fragile environment. The animations covers every detail of their day from the moment they wake up in the morning to when the night stand is turned off in their rooms. Sit back and I hope you enjoy the animations when we start the uploads.

Our budget as stated is £4,000. Included is a detailed copy of our outline, so you'll know exactly where each money donated is going. But to summarize, our main expenses are:

  • PRODUCTION:

Equipment Fees: (renting a blue yeti mic, drawing tablet)  -   Feeding co-workers  - Paying co-workers - And More

  • POST PRODUCTION: 

Sound Design   -  Advertisement -  And More  

With each contribution, we've offered a certain PERK. From the very low investment, to the highest of highs, you'll get a gift in exchange for helping us achieve our goal. They're detailed below, but range from a social media shout out, all the way to a full-fledged credit at the end of the film.

Like all investments, the biggest question is - what if you don't reach your goal? Although we expect nothing but going well above it, if we don't happen to hit our amount, we'll use the money we do raise in order to still tell the story. We'll cut back and delegate different amount of money to different areas, but we'll issue full transparency on where each and every money of yours is going.

...we'll be off to the races!

Immediately following our campaign, we'll go into the creation of the animation series. The first trailer for the animation should be ready by late June which will be shortly followed by the first episode of season one.

All the videos will be free to watch on platforms such as youtube, our social media pages and vimeo. 

You may have read all of this and, like us, still don't have much financially. But if you like our project, like our script, and still want to see this film come to life - then you can still help! Word of mouth, sharing on social media, showing your friends this page; ALL of it will help us hit our goal.

We're ready to make a powerful series of animation - and we can't wait for you to see it!

  • Can I contribute internationally? 

Yes! You can donate in USD, CAD, EUR, and GBP.

  • What form of payments are accepted?

Credit card or paypal

  • Can we exceed the goal?

Yes! That would be extraordinary! Surpassing our goal would put us in the position to create an even better animation.

  • What do you plan on doing with the animation?

The episodes will be uploaded on Youtube for every one to watch. 

  • If I contribute do I have to choose a perk?

Not at all. And, you can contribute any amount of money you wish. 

Our Thanks:

On behalf of the entire Co-op we thank you so much for your consideration and support!

-Life in Phases

story:
CULTURE SHOCK - A SLEY EXPOSÉ PRODUCTION

Culture Shock is a global documentary series for the voiceless and defenceless. Join us for Season One of this Culture Shocking adventure, designed to expose and educate the world on global atrocities faced by our non-human counterparts. And watch how we work together with communities to make peaceful, productive and proactive cultural reform through education, understanding and compassion.

Culture Shock follows Compassionate Influencer and Educator, Sarah Leyshan on an entertaining, jaw dropping and educating journey to each continent. As former beauty queen, actress, and model, she isn’t a stranger to being out in front of the world, now here she is bringing a culture-shocking exposé of insatiable curiosity for the abused and unknown. An in depth docu-series that captures the human spirit and investigates the great questions around why we are, the way we are. 

 

CARNEVEIL - EPISODE ONE

WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT TO HELP COMPLETE THIS EPISODE WHICH WILL BE USED TO GENERATE FURTHER FUNDING FOR THE FIRST SERIES.

In episode one, Sarah travels across the globe to discover some of the worst non-human atrocities, beginning with the Yulin Dog & Cat meat Festival in Sarah's native China. She's meeting with Chinese advocates, lawmakers, doctors, scientists, celebrities, meat vendors and restauranteurs to find educated, pro-active solutions for brutal, outdated cultures. In each episode Sarah will venture to a different continent with the aim of unveiling, and solving cultural discrimination between man and man's best friend, with unbiased education reform.

 

OUR GOAL - $55K (To help complete our Pilot episode)

This will pay for :

-  Development costs

- Film Equiptment

- Editing  and Production Services

- Legal Fees

- Branding and Mechandise

- Marketing

- Travel Expenses

- Digital Downloads

 +MORE!!

 

We have been working tirelessly on this concept for almost a year now, and we are ready to start filming. My team have met major challenges along the way due to the sensitive nature of the content and how controversial these topics are, yet we have overcome each hurdle.

We have put in countless hours researching, investigating, and planning to get where we are today and spent thousands of dollars, but without your help we can only go so far.

Now we need your help getting this pilot episode complete to help secure further funding to get the first series and it's message to the world.

Join us in this campaign and you will be supporting our mission to kindly re-educate the world for the better, for ALL!

THE IMPACT -

The benefits of supporting this film go beyond the downloads, shirts, names in the film, elite producer status, or any of the other unique perks we offer. You will be part of a global movement towards true sustainability and conscious awakening. By supporting this campaign, you are taking a stand against corporate corruption, environmental degradation, food and water pollution, deforestation, and species extinction – and supporting the vital importance of freedom of speech and freedom of the press. You are lending your voice and speaking up for all those trampled by this maddening world.

Sley Exposé’s sole purpose is to expose cultural atrocities around the globe and work with experts to find peaceful and proactive solutions for the voiceless and defenseless victims of this planet.

THIS IS NOT JUST A SHOW, ITS A MOVEMENT.

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP -

If you are unable to financially contribute to the campaign, you still can play a vital role by sharing this link on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and all other social media platforms. It is only with all of us working together that we can make this change happen. 

We trust you will join us.

Sarah Leyshan

(Creator of Culture Shock)

LOOKING FOR MORE INFORMATION, PLEASE VISIT OUR WEBSITE

story:
About Yogma

Thank you for checking us out! After an incredible season 1 reception, we are working to make our show something unforgettable and a great follow up for our fans and supporters.

This campaign means the world to us and our viewers because we really understand our story and know how to tell it. Not only is the show ripped from the pages of the creators own real life journal and portrayed through her acting, but its also directed by her fiance, the person who was there to go through it all with her. It opened up some really important conversations with people who don't know about yoga, what that world is like and how hard it can be to survive. it can be beautiful, it can be hilarious and it can be ridiculous.

CLICK HERE TO WATCH SEASON 1

The first season of the show was written by us, filmed without a crew and edited in house. Its time to elevate and make it bigger, better and professional. Your contribution will allow us to elevate the production value of the show, pay the professionals who work on it and get it edited by a seasoned professional. Our goal is to raise $8000 to complete this season, its going to be like no other show you've ever seen. Every bit counts and we thank you in advance.

Here's what your contributions will help us cover:

  • Crew costs
  • Light rentals
  • sound recording
  • location rental
  • food
  • music licensing
  • editing/ color grading/ sound design
  • festival submissions

PERKS

 To show our appreciation for your help, we have some pretty amazing perks to let you know that we're here to put some heartfelt effort into making season 2 a success including:

  • shout outs on social networks
  • tickets to group yoga classes lead by our star (Karla Huffman)
  • private yoga instructions/ with swag bags
  • tickets for 2 to a comedy show
  • partying with the crew
  • invites to group workouts with professional trainers
  • producers credits
  • visits behind the scenes

        and more...

 

Even if we don't make our goal... we are going to make this show.  We will fight, scrap and scrape til the bitter end. all funds from this campaign will be directed towards the production process and post production is a phase we can fight for more resources to finish. Its not our first rodeo, Our creator is an experienced producer of film, Our director has been creating for years and almost everyone involved is a veteran with credits to their name. We know how to make alot happen with a little.

If you simply aren't able to contribute 5, 50, or a hundred thousand dollars that's ok, you can still help out. Please help us spread the word about our campaign by sharing with your friends and family on social networks using the indiegogo share tools to the right.

story:
Overview

I'm Kafi, and I founded Story Play Media to produce scripted content for family audiences.  Story Play's very first project is an animated cartoon short, Big Man Dan, which features Caribbean newlyweds Dan and Sheila. Big Man Dan is an exciting opportunity to tackle gender issues through an easy-to-swallow comedy format that audiences everywhere will love.  Released in 2019, Big Man Dan was an official selection at this year's Trinidad & Tobago Film Festival -- the Caribbean's biggest film festival. And now, our cartoon has been selected to be part of the 3D Wire 2019 catalogue!

 

Let's Take Dan to Spain

Being selected for 3D Wire's International Animation Market in Spain gives us an opportunity to showcase Big Man Dan to an audience of global producers, television networks and animation companies. This is a chance for us  to match with people who can help us bring you more Big Man Dan episodes.

Your contribution to our campaign will help take Big Man Dan's producers to 3D Wire to meet in person with representatives from international companies and television channels looking to co-produce, develop and distribute fresh, new cartoons like Big Man Dan. This is an incredible opportunity to take an original series idea, developed 100% in Trinidad and Tobago, to the world.

 

As an official selection, 3D Wire has provided us with accreditation to attend the 3-day event. Here's what we need to pay for:

  • Flight & Hotel - $2000
  • Ground Transportation & Meals - $500
  • Presentation Materials (one sheets, cards etc) - $200
  • Perks, Mailing  & Contingency (just in case we get lost in Spain) - $300

 

HEARTFELT THANKS

$10 - We'll send you a thank you email dripping with compliments and gratitude because you deserve it!

POSTCARD FROM SPAIN

$25 - Get a personalised post card from Big Man Dan's creator plus digital photos from the 3D Wire market. 

COFFEE MUG

$75 - Your coffee and tea will taste better than ever in a custom Big Man Dan mug. Get yours!

TV PILOT SCRIPT

$100 - Get an exclusive look at our half-hour Big Man Dan TV pilot screenplay (never before made available to the general public).

EXECUTIVE PRODUCER CREDIT

$1000 - You'll receive Executive Producer screen credit on the next Big Man Dan episode plus we'll email  you the latest version of our Big Man Dan Pitch Book with character designs and future episodes.

 

The Impact

We're all about making media that makes an impact. Here are some of the ways supporting Big Man Dan can help make a better world:

  • Big Man Dan uses newlyweds Dan and Sheila to explore traditional gender roles with the aim of eradicating damaging gender biases through comedy. 
  • Big Man Dan presents strong, diverse characters to expand audience's cultural awareness.
  • Big Man Dan has already attracted distribution offers from two Caribbean television companies, which bodes well for the project's viability in the global content marketplace. 

 

Risks & Challenges

There's no guarantee that attending 3D Wire will advance our goal of producing more Big Man Dan episodes. However, there's no doubt that the experience and connections we make at the event will be priceless and will contribute tremendously to our production company's growth. 

 

  • Follow us on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter!
  • Share this campaign with somebody, anybody everybody!

Thanks for supporting Big Man Dan and Story Play Media!
story_txt:
Overview
I'm Kafi, and I founded Story Play Media to produce scripted content for family audiences.  Story Play's very first project is an animated cartoon short, Big Man Dan, which features Caribbean newlyweds Dan and Sheila. Big Man Dan is an exciting opportunity to tackle gender issues through an easy-to-swallow comedy format that audiences everywhere will love.  Released in 2019, Big Man Dan was an official selection at this year's Trinidad & Tobago Film Festival -- the Caribbean's biggest film festival. And now, our cartoon has been selected to be part of the 3D Wire 2019 catalogue!

 
Let's Take Dan to Spain
Being selected for 3D Wire's International Animation Market in Spain gives us an opportunity to showcase Big Man Dan to an audience of global producers, television networks and animation companies. This is a chance for us  to match with people who can help us bring you more Big Man Dan episodes.
Your contribution to our campaign will help take Big Man Dan's producers to 3D Wire to meet in person with representatives from international companies and television channels looking to co-produce, develop and distribute fresh, new cartoons like Big Man Dan. This is an incredible opportunity to take an original series idea, developed 100% in Trinidad and Tobago, to the world.
 


As an official selection, 3D Wire has provided us with accreditation to attend the 3-day event. Here's what we need to pay for:

Flight & Hotel - $2000
Ground Transportation & Meals - $500
Presentation Materials (one sheets, cards etc) - $200
Perks, Mailing  & Contingency (just in case we get lost in Spain) - $300

story:
Me, and the Spotlight

I thought it would be a good opportunity for me to introduce myself. Howdy folks, I'm Dan! Beyond being a New Yorker with no reason to say "howdy," I'm a 24-year-old music journalist. I host a radio show on Jazz90.1, I've written articles for the D&C, I work for Eastman School of Music, host podcasts, and I host, produce, direct, edit, record, and mix the Rochester Indie Musician Spotlight.

This campaign represents the next biggest step the show has to take... The jump to TV. Yes, you could name innumerable successful Youtubers and web series that reach millions of people, but this show is local. While we've made the occasional reach to some Buffalo musicians (Tyler Westcott, The Brothers Blue), and will continue to do so, because the emphasis is so local, adding a presence on TV in addition to the "web series" model will ensure the maximum amount of people can see the show. 

I can hardly state what making this jump would mean to me, and the show. It boggles my mind the support and response I get every time I post an episode. Your support had, has, and will continue to have an immeasurable effect on me, my happiness, and the drive to grow and create... And this successful campaign would ensure the show's future, and make it a great way to celebrate 50 REGULARLY SCHEDULED EPISODES AT THE END OF THE SEASON!

 

What We Need & What You Get

Here's the breakdown of WHAT WE NEED, folks:

  • I'm asking for $3,500.
    • $300 of that is going into the money spent this "off season," and promoting this campaign.
    • $3,200 of that is going right into the fifteen planned episodes this upcoming season. Thirteen REGULARLY SCHEDULED episodes, and three SPOTLIGHT SPECIALS.​
      • To do the math, that's $200 an episode. That's going to be going into the paid programming slot (DAY/ TIME TO COME), Facebook advertising, posters, and paying my employees.
        • Only the REGULARLY SCHEDULED episodes will appear on air, and the SPOTLIGHT SPECIALS will be web-only.
    • REGULARLY SCHEDULED GUESTS FOR SEASON5 INCLUDES (so far):​
      • Laura Dubin - Jazz pianist and composer extraordinaire
      • Small Signals - Stephen Roessner delivers his "Missed Connections" songbook
      • Juicy Connotation - Contemporary instrumental/ fusion group
      • The Honey Smugglers - One of Rochester's favorite folk groups
      • Hanna PK - Blues singer, pianist, and songwriter, and a growing local favorite
      • Grand Canyon Rescue Episode - Roots-rock sextet
      • Seth Faergolzia - Anti-folk and multimedia legend
      • White Woods - Indie/ contemporary rock group
      • Jimmie Highsmith Jr. - Grammy-nominated smooth jazz saxophonist
      • And MORE on the way!
    • DAY, TIME, AND CHANNEL OF THE NEW PAID PROGRAMMING SLOT IS STILL UNDER REVIEW.

If we DON'T REACH OUR GOAL, the money raised will be put in web-only advertising.

 

Here are your PUH-PUH-PUH-PERKS!

  • PERKS WILL BE DELIVERED AFTER THE CAMPAIGN IS DONE (whether or not the goal is reached, those who donated will receive their rewards)
  • Of course, at every level, your donation comes with your choice of:
    • A hearty handshake
    • A wholesome high-five
    • A bear hug
    • Or a complicated dap of your choosing
  • $5
    • In addition to handshake/ high-five/ hug/ dap, you'll get a sweet set of Rochester Indie Musician Spotlight stickers featuring the show's iconic logo.
  • $15
    • In addition to the rewards listed at lower levels, you'll receive a black T-shirt with the name of the show, and the Spotlight's iconic logo.
  • $25
    • In addition to the rewards listed at lower levels, you'll receive a CD/ download card/ files for a "Best of SEASON FOUR" mixtape. It'll feature the best track from most of the great acts that have been on the show this past season!
  • $50
    • YOUR BEST VALUE!!!
    • In addition to the rewards listed at lower levels, you'll receive your choice of: 
      • 1. A swag bag from Bop Shop Records 
        • ​(Stickers, a coffee mug, a T shirt, and a copy of Bob Sneider and Joe Locke's "Fallen Angel.")
      • 2. A year-long coupon for $3 off growler fills/ refills at Three Heads 
      • 3. Coffee from Joe Bean Coffee Roasters that has been aged in Black Button Distilling gin barrels 
      • 4. A 15% off coupon at Sound Source!
    • PLUS you'll appear in the credits at the end of every episode, AND you'll have a special invite to celebrate Season5, the 50th episode, and the continued success of the show at a party at Bop Shop Records!
  • $100
    • In addition to the rewards listed at lower levels, you'll get a free two-camera video and recording of one song of your choosing!
  • $200
    • In addition to the rewards listed at lower levels (and my dropped jaw), you'll get a free two-song two-camera video and recording session. It'll be your own mini-Spotlight episode to keep!
  • $200+
    • In addition to the rewards listed at lower levels (and my dropped jaw), you will leave me speechless. Who could want anything more?!

 

The Impact

Rochester is an incredible town, not just for music, but cultural in general. With all of the changes in how our media covers what happens here, this show is more important than ever. It educated, showcases, and gives a smile to everyone who watches. Music and cultural education is important to all of us; let's keep it going! You've seen what we've been able to do so far, but let's keep growing together!

 

Risks & Challenges

The truth is, the show will continue, in the short term. I have been able to operate the show at a loss until now. I have never charged a musician for coming on my show, and I've made sure to pay the people who help me as soon as I could. But if this can't make the leap to TV this upcoming season (Season5), we'll need to reevaluate the show after the 50th episode - which will air at the end of this season - if we can't make the jump to TV. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that no one's financial situation is the same. In addition to your continued support of watching and sharing the online episodes, you can:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you so much for your time! :)

story:
Synopsis
Clean Break is about a playful single mum (Tamara) and her highly intelligent daughter (Diana) who work as cleaners to survive. Tamara has always dreamed about being a rapper and Diana is an aspiring politician. Their conflicting personalities often leads them into arguments. This is heightened when they are faced with bizarre and freaky situations on the job. If they put their minds together they can achieve anything. That’s a big if.

Short Summary

I’m Malick the Producer and I’m Elly the Director. We are students at the MET Film School in London. Our campaign is to raise funds for a web series pilot we are producing for our final year grad project. This project is exceptionally important to us as this is a culmination of our hard work over the last year and an opportunity to tell a contemporary story that you wouldn’t otherwise see on mainstream television.

Your contributions will provide us with a massive opportunity to shed light on the hard work of single parents, diversity in the creative industry and produce a female driven story to ultimately entertain our audiences. We cannot stress how important it is for everyone to be represented in the media and with a massive imbalance of female directors such as Elly and a diversity problem within the film and TV industry. With your contributions, you’d be doing your part in supporting a progressive production that can play its part in creating a progressive and inclusive industry.

What We Need & What You Get
We are looking to raise £3’500 for this project. This will go towards catering, logistics, locations, cast and crew. A large portion of the fund will go towards our cast and crew about £1’500 in fact. we want to attract top talent and this money will allow us to pay their expenses and make them as comfortable as possible on set so we can get the best performances and work out of our team. Here is a breakdown of what the whole £3’500 will go towards below:

£1’500: Cast and Crew
£500: Food and Drink
£300: Props & Costume
£300: Travel Expenses and Equipment Transport
£400: Extra Equipment (Lights, Gimbals, Sound etc.)
£200: Extra’s
£300: Contingency


We have a range of perks for our contributors like production stills, personalised cleaning gear, personalised online content, exclusive and personal content from our cast, behind the scenes footage, scripts and executive producer credits for those of you that really dig deep into your pockets! These are all the awesome things we are happy to give you in return for helping us realise this project. Even if we do not reach our goal we will strive to make the best web series pilot we possibly can. If we exceed our goal, we will begin producing our second episode and hopefully complete a series by the end of 2018.


The Impact
Our project is focussed on the lives of a working class mother (Tamara, 33) and daughter (Diana, 17) doing what is necessary to survive in an area where rent prices have risen, there community’s identity is changing and they now seem out of place. With this project we want to poke fun at this through their perspective as they embark on bizarre adventures when cleaning the houses of local clients.

As mentioned before this campaign is to fund this project that is all about diversity and progressiveness in the film and TV industry.  By contributing you’d be endorsing a female led web series based on working class people and stories and paying homage to some of the hardest working people in the world. Single Parents.

Below are some facts:
•    There are around two million single parents – they make up a quarter of families with dependent children.
•    Less than two per cent of single parents are teenagers.
•    68 per cent of single parents are in work.
•    The majority of single parents don’t receive child maintenance payments.
•    47 per cent of children in single parent families live in relative poverty, around twice the risk of relative poverty faced by children in couple families (24 per cent).
https://www.gingerbread.org.uk/policy-campaigns...

This is why we hold this project so close to the heart. We want to change the way single parents are represented in the media, we want to celebrate the work that they do for their children. Ultimately we want to them to have something they can relate to, that makes them laugh and feel good about the job that they do. Because it is not easy and on a personal note this our way of saying thank you.

Risks & Challenges
Our biggest challenge is our story. We want to make it funny and emotionally compelling which is a difficult task that will rely on our screenwriter and our cast. We are extensively working on our script.

We do not want to misrepresent specific groups in society with our stories. This means we do not want to create characters that encourage negative stereotypes that can offend people. This being said as our series is a comedy, there will be exaggerations of particular situations and characterisations too.

We want to portray real stories from real people and that will require a lot of research for our series. This method will require a lot of primary research which will require a dedication of time and effort to produce an exciting episode for our series.

We want to move forward. After our pilot episode we want to continue with the web series, this means raising more funds and approaching broadcasters. This will be the most challenging aspect going forward but we have some good contacts within the industry. We have worked within the industry over the last three, four years and have enough experience, knowledge and contacts to make this project a success.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you are unable to contribute to the project, please share it with friends and family. Help us spread the word, make some noise and ultimately help us distribute this story to as many people as we possibly can.

Any contribution is appreciated greatly and we are really thankful to everyone that will support us on the journey.

This project is so close to our hearts and has the potential to bring joy to so many people and you could be a part of that.

Thank you!

story:
​

We met at a well-known London tour-guiding company and have since been working as comedians together. Luke has worked as a comedian and actor for over twenty years (part of comedy duo Frost & Ireland), Frances is a recent graduate and actor from a writing family (daughter of author Michael Keyton).

As actors, we believe in creating our own opportunities rather than waiting for that phone-call. We feel like in recent years TV comedy has limited itself to sitcom and panel shows so we have created a cutting-edge comedy which reflects today's society. Influenced by Peep Show, Green Wing, The Office and Monty Python, Guides is funny, it's moving, it's all true, and you're going to see things about London and tour-guiding that you've never seen before.

We have created strong comedy roles for women and also focused on obscure hobbies such as ponyplay, beatboxing, collecting war memorabilia and folk music. In this series there's something for everyone; guides of all ages, and tourists from all over the world. You will learn real London facts, and also learn how guides often "improvise" by making stuff up...!

We knew we couldn't do it alone so we joined forces with the talented director and executive producer Matthew Tibbenham to bring his creative vision and expertise to the project, so Guides can be made at the highest possible level. In addition to our producer team, we have a talented cast and crew - each with a huge amount of screen and comedy experience (More below!) 

The cast and crew of Guides value a TV culture that is passionate about delivering diversity and equitable practices. Throughout the entire production and beyond we will commit to this by making sure we are fair in hiring, paying and communicating with all cast and crew. We will also make sure to include all audiences, applying our ethos at any screenings or events that we may host.

We are so passionate about this series, and with your help we can make this happen. 

"GUIDES has great potential"

- Rob Kitzmann, Director of Photography (GREEN WING, EPISODES, THE INBETWEENERS, THAT MITCHELL & WEBB LOOK)

" You have an original idea with lots of potential. No-one gets anywhere without trying and that is such a huge part of 'making it' - hard graft and never giving up." 

- Matt Lipsey, Director (LITTLE BRITAIN, SICK NOTE, UPSTART CROW, PSYCHODALE)

Anything you can contribute!

For our 30 minute pilot, our budget will allow us to:

             > Hire amazing costumes and sets
             > Hire and customise a bus!
             > Get permits to shoot in busy London locations
             > Pay and feed our actors and crew
             > Hire professional camera and lighting equipment

  • Along with the crowdfunding campaign we will be running an extensive social media campaign, on Facebook and Instagram, both of which will show the distributors that there is in fact a pre-existing audience that wants to see more episodes.

  • After winning the filmmaking "Pick My Pitch" competition, we have formed a strategic partnership with Cine Circle Film Networking who create filmmaker events in London. This will open up doors to not only online but also event focused sponsorship deals. 

  • We recognise as comedy-writers that while it is important to be true to our creative values, this industry is a business and runs on strategy. Therefore once production is complete, with your contribution we will be able to showcase the project, our values and comedy ethos to a wider audience, making a lasting impact on the industry. 

  • Even if we don't reach our entire goal, we will make this pilot no matter what, because we are so passionate about it. It may be shorter or more simplified, but we will make it!

We are SO proud of our gorgeous, talented, funny cast - just look at them!

Frances Keyton (Writer/Executive Producer/Cast)

Frances Keyton is an actor based in London and Wales. She studied French at UCL before graduating from Drama Studio London in 2016.  She has toured with bilingual troupe Line Theatre in Lyon, National Youth Theatre and National Youth Theatre of Wales. Recent credits include BBCs  KEEPING FAITH, and playing Shelby in the original tour of CRACKED. Frances also performs comedy on the London circuit as part of duo WINGSPAN. GUIDES is her first writing venture.

Luke Ireland (Writer/Executive Producer/Cast)

Luke has worked as an actor for 20 years in TV, Film and Theatre. He’s starred in feature films including INVISIBLE MEN and EXTRAORDINARY RENDITION. He's also worked in TV performing alongside Alan Carr and Tony Law. He writes and performs comedy and has worked on the comedy circuit for many years. GUIDES is his first writing venture.

Matthew Tibbenham (Director/Executive Producer)

Matthew Tibbenham is a British-American writer and director, who has been making movies for almost a decade. After graduating from college and living overseas for a few years, he moved to New York City to more actively purse a career in film directing, where he worked on the Blumhouse horror film, SINISTER, directed by Scott Derrickson and starring Ethan Hawke, as the Director's Assistant and Second Unit Director. After New York, he moved to Los Angeles and released the interactive comedy web series, THE WRONG GUYS FOR THE JOB. Matthew’s first feature film, SURVIVING CONFESSION, is being released in April 2019. He’s excited to direct GUIDES this summer and his next feature film, NIGHTFALL, later this year. He currently resides in London, where he writes and directs commercials, films, and TV shows. 

   

Ewa Habdas (Producer)             Zbigniew Siwek (Co-Producer)

   

Dave Golbraich ( Composer)    Josh Black (Cinematographer)

      

Tony Chivers (1st AD)      Hamish Clayton (2nd AD)          

                     

Petra Lang (Assistant Producer)   Laerke Olsvig (Production Manager)

                           

Rahul Kumar (Camera Assistant)    Alex Magill (Gaffer)

More crew members coming soon!

We appreciate every contribution, so we want you to get back what you put in to Guides. 

We have an awesome selection of "perks" for you, so with your donation, you won't leave empty handed! Head over to the perks page now to see what tickles your fancy!

  • YES! Please get the word out and make some noise about our Guides campaign by liking our Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/GuidesComedy , following us on Instagram: @GuidesComedy , and by sharing this campaign via Indiegogo!
  • Do you know other people and communities who might support us? Share this page with them and get them to contribute. We'd love your likes and shares and all the support on social media (#guidescomedy)
story_txt:
​
We met at a well-known London tour-guiding company and have since been working as comedians together. Luke has worked as a comedian and actor for over twenty years (part of comedy duo Frost & Ireland), Frances is a recent graduate and actor from a writing family (daughter of author Michael Keyton).
As actors, we believe in creating our own opportunities rather than waiting for that phone-call. We feel like in recent years TV comedy has limited itself to sitcom and panel shows so we have created a cutting-edge comedy which reflects today's society. Influenced by Peep Show, Green Wing, The Office and Monty Python, Guides is funny, it's moving, it's all true, and you're going to see things about London and tour-guiding that you've never seen before.
We have created strong comedy roles for women and also focused on obscure hobbies such as ponyplay, beatboxing, collecting war memorabilia and folk music. In this series there's something for everyone; guides of all ages, and tourists from all over the world. You will learn real London facts, and also learn how guides often "improvise" by making stuff up...!
We knew we couldn't do it alone so we joined forces with the talented director and executive producer Matthew Tibbenham to bring his creative vision and expertise to the project, so Guides can be made at the highest possible level. In addition to our producer team, we have a talented cast and crew - each with a huge amount of screen and comedy experience (More below!) 
The cast and crew of Guides value a TV culture that is passionate about delivering diversity and equitable practices. Throughout the entire production and beyond we will commit to this by making sure we are fair in hiring, paying and communicating with all cast and crew. We will also make sure to include all audiences, applying our ethos at any screenings or events that we may host.
We are so passionate about this series, and with your help we can make this happen. 
"GUIDES has great potential" 
- Rob Kitzmann, Director of Photography (GREEN WING, EPISODES, THE INBETWEENERS, THAT MITCHELL & WEBB LOOK)
" You have an original idea with lots of potential. No-one gets anywhere without trying and that is such a huge part of 'making it' - hard graft and never giving up." 
- Matt Lipsey, Director (LITTLE BRITAIN, SICK NOTE, UPSTART CROW, PSYCHODALE)


Anything you can contribute!
For our 30 minute pilot, our budget will allow us to:
             > Hire amazing costumes and sets             > Hire and customise a bus!             > Get permits to shoot in busy London locations             > Pay and feed our actors and crew             > Hire professional camera and lighting equipment


Along with the crowdfunding campaign we will be running an extensive social media campaign, on Facebook and Instagram, both of which will show the distributors that there is in fact a pre-existing audience that wants to see more episodes.
After winning the filmmaking "Pick My Pitch" competition, we have formed a strategic partnership with Cine Circle Film Networking who create filmmaker events in London. This will open up doors to not only online but also event focused sponsorship deals. 
We recognise as comedy-writers that while it is important to be true to our creative values, this industry is a business and runs on strategy. Therefore once production is complete, with your contribution we will be able to showcase the project, our values and comedy ethos to a wider audience, making a lasting impact on the industry. 
Even if we don't reach our entire goal, we will make this pilot no matter what, because we are so passionate about it. It may be shorter or more simplified, but we will make it!


We are SO proud of our gorgeous, talented, funny cast - just look at them!

Recent credits include BBCs  KEEPING FAITH, and playing Shelby in the original tour of CRACKED. Frances also performs comedy on the London circuit as part of duo WINGSPAN. GUIDES is her first writing venture.
Luke Ireland (Writer/Executive Producer/Cast)
Luke has worked as an actor for 20 years in TV, Film and Theatre. He’s starred in feature films including INVISIBLE MEN and EXTRAORDINARY RENDITION. He's also worked in TV performing alongside Alan Carr and Tony Law. He writes and performs comedy and has worked on the comedy circuit for many years. GUIDES is his first writing venture.

Matthew Tibbenham (Director/Executive Producer)
Matthew Tibbenham is a British-American writer and director, who has been making movies for almost a decade. After graduating from college and living overseas for a few years, he moved to New York City to more actively purse a career in film directing, where he worked on the Blumhouse horror film, SINISTER, directed by Scott Derrickson and starring Ethan Hawke, as the Director's Assistant and Second Unit Director. After New York, he moved to Los Angeles and released the interactive comedy web series, THE WRONG GUYS FOR THE JOB. Matthew’s first feature film, SURVIVING CONFESSION, is being released in April 2019. He’s excited to direct GUIDES this summer and his next feature film, NIGHTFALL, later this year. He currently resides in London, where he writes and directs commercials, films, and TV shows.
