story:
Intro

Welcome to My Greek Table, my love song to Greece, a cooking-travel series that airs nationally on public television and shares the health-giving foods, natural beauty, history, and culture of Greece with the world. Greece, the mother of the Mediterranean Diet, holds so many valuable lessons for how to live and eat well, largely on a plant-forward diet, with delicious foods that satisfy both our physical and emotional hunger.

I am Diane Kochilas, host, co-producer and creator of the series. I am a New Yorker by birth and hail from the Blue Zone Greek island of Ikaria by ancestry. I’ve spent much of my adult life shuttling back and forth between Greece and the United States, devoted to sharing the foods and culture of Greece with Americans. I teach, run a recreational cooking school on Ikaria, and have been fortunate to see the dream of My Greek Table come to life. The series has enabled me to share the amazing, health-giving foods of Greece as well as the country’s natural beauty and culture with you.  

My Greek Table Campaign - Season 3 Completion

The My Greek Table campaign will help us finish financing our production needs for Season 3 of the series.  All contributions  go to the Resolution Media Fund, a non-profit 501 (c)(3), so they are tax-deductible, an added perk!  Your support will bear gifts! I am looking forward to literally sharing some of the bounty of Greece with you, our supporters, in generous gifts of delicious, regional Greek extra-virgin olive oils, olives, an ancient grain product called trahana, a private online cooking class with me and the chance to win a place at my Ikaria cooking school in 2020. 

I want to welcome you around My Greek Table with a gift of health-giving food!

We’ve completed location filming in several Greek islands, among them Chios, Naxos, Paros, Tinos and Mykonos, as well as in the coastal region of the Southern Peloponnese, all part of next season’s focus on Greece from the sea, with an exploration of the country’s traditions and culinary heritage in the Aegean and Ionian. We are planning to film the actual kitchen/cooking part of the show in December 2019 and hope to film in the Ionian then, too. Achieving our goal through this IndieGoGo campaign will enable us to deliver another great season of the series to you, with new places, great, new, healthy and accessible regional Greek recipes, and a journey for armchair and real travelers alike.

What We Need & What You Get

All funding for the show, whether from direct corporate and foundation sponsorships, or this IndieGoGo campaign, goes toward the actual production of the series, from filming to editing and airing. As mentioned above, all contributions are tax-deductible. 

We’re almost there! But in order to deliver the best possible series to you and to complete our production needs we have a ways to go. My goal with this IndieGoGo campaign is to raise $35,000. Whether we achieve that or not, all funds will continue to go toward our production needs, again, to help deliver a delicious third season of My Greek Table to you.

I’ve set the campaign levels at $25, $50, $75, $100, $500 and $1,000, and for each level there are great edible perks -- the delicious, traditional health-giving Greek foods and ingredients that make My Greek Table and the Greek diet one of the best in the world.

For a $25 contribution, you’ll receive a bottle of Eirini Plomariou, an excellent organic extra-virgin Greek olive oil from  Lesvos, one of the country’s premiere regions for the production of olive oil.

For $50, our gift to you is two bottles of excellent Greek olive oil, the Lesvos Eirini Plomariou and the organic Vrisi 36, produced in Laconia, another premiere region for the production of olive oil, mainly from the famed Coroneiki variety.  

For $75, you’ll enjoy three bottles of amazing Greek olive oil: Eirini, from the emerald-green island of Lesvos in the Northeastern Aegean,  GreekGarden produced just outside historic Sparta, and Vrisi 36, the organic extra virgin Greek olive oil produced near Monemvasia in Laconia. 

For $100, our gift to you is all of the above – three bottles of excellent regional Greek olive oils, a delicious bag of Greek prune olives, sweet and very lightly salted, as well as a package of one of the world’s most intriguing and ancient grain products, trahana. Trahana is one of my favorite Greek ingredients and you can find lots of recipes for it on my website. 

A $500 contribution will give you all of the above, three excellent Greek olive oils, olives, and trahana as well as access to a private online cooking class that focuses on 3 Greek classics, TBD after Jan. 10. 

And, finally, for $1,000 you will receive everything listed above -- three olive oils, olives, trahana, a private online class, and the chance to win a place in 2020 at my Ikaria cooking class.

PLEASE NOTE: If the three olive oils mentioned above, the olives or trahana run out of stock, we will replace with some of the other excellent olive oils, olives and trahana available on my online shop.

The Impact of My Greek Table

My Greek Table shines a glowing light on the delicious, health-giving foods, wines, and traditions of Greece, while taking viewers on a journey through the country’s breath-taking natural wonders and long, glorious history.

A major, mainstream Public Television series on the cuisine of Greece is particularly timely. Greece boasts the greatest range of plant-based and plant-forward dishes of any other tradition in the Mediterranean. One of my main goals with the series is to share with Americans the vast array of these delicious dishes, to make vegetables and plant-based cooking more accessible, all the while sharing other delicious foods, recipes, and unique Greek wines in moderation, from feta and other Greek cheeses, to amazing olive oils, great regional specialties and luscious sweets. 

The show brings  viewers on a breathtaking journey to gorgeous historic places all over Greece, both well-known, such as Santorini, and off the beaten track, such as Volos, Chios, Tinos and Epirus. It has helped raise awareness about Greece as a travel destination and has possibly even been one of the reasons why tourism from North America to Greece has gone up these past two years, exactly the time frame that the show has been airing. Viewers' comments have helped me understand just how well-received the show is, with many people actually writing to tell me they've booked a ticket to Greece after watching My Greek Table.

My aim is to highlight, among other things, aspects of Greek culture that are little-known outside of Greece. So, for example, I’ve done episodes on how food has helped soften the refugee crisis on the island of Lesvos, told through the eyes of a local fisherman who was recommended for the Nobel Peace Prize; on the the traditions of the Asia Minor Greeks on Greek music and food; on the continuity of Greek ingredients from prehistory to the present, with renowned archeologist Dr. John Camp; on Greek bean soup as the catalyst for feeding the homeless on the streets of Athens and more. In season 3, some of the subjects covered in episodes include sustainability and dry-farming, a timely issue as water becomes an ever-more scarce resource on the planet; the surprising agricultural life of Greece’s most cosmopolitan island, Mykonos; and the wonders of a Greek superfood, Mastiha, filmed on the island of Chios.

Episodes also focus explicitly on ingredients that enhance the health of all: olive oil, olives, honey, beans among them, with visits to the agricultural areas in which these seminal Greek-Mediterranean foods are cultivated or produced.

I am very proud to say that the series is a stellar example of Greek-American collaboration and cultural exchange. For the second consecutive year, the American Ambassador to Greece, Geoffrey Pyatt, honored the series by hosting a reception at his residence in Athens. 

Seasons 1 and 2 of My Greek Table garnered a lot of excitement and enjoyed resounding success. Season 1 was an immediate winner, with 93.8% channel coverage and 15,059 channel airings, incredible numbers for a new show.  During Season 2, My Greek Table with Diane Kochilas aired more than 60,000 times with 95% coverage across the nation.  In addition, each episode enjoys 1.5 million viewers; 75,000 online plays and the series' website 250,000 page views.

The success of My Greek Table to date is evidenced by the continuous stream of viewer comments on social media praising the ease, accessibility, authenticity and overall success of the recipes, as well as the stories told by each. The series also airs in Canada, Australia and Greece.  Another display of the success and vote of confidence for the series was demonstrated when it was given a prominent time slot on the digital arm of Create’s Public Television channel during prime time on weeknights.

I have lived and breathed Greek cuisine since growing up in a Greek-American home in New York City, and I have devoted my life to studying it and sharing it with North Americans and the world. I love to tell the story of Greek food, as well as of the people behind growing and preparing it. I believe that I make the mosaic that is Greece- its culture, history, foods, wines, regions, and people—comes to life. It is my passion to do so!

Risks & Challenges

Public television provides the perfect home for a show like My Greek Table because Public Television is the largest television network in the United States and because its audience is the most loyal, engaged, affluent, and well-travelled.

It is a tremendous honor to be part of the Public Television family, joining the likes of Julia Child, Jacques Pepin, Lidia Bastianich, Martha Stewart and so many others, whose work has shaped the American palate and broadened our culinary horizons.

Yet, as most of you know, almost every show on Public Television is independently funded through sponsors and underwriters. While Greek food enjoys tremendous popularity in the United States and is generally recognized as one of the healthiest cooking traditions in the world, Greek food products are still under-represented on mainstream American supermarket shelves. So, tapping into the world of Greek food producers as a source of funding provides a unique challenge.

With that reality in the foreground and season 3 simmering, I am reaching out to the fans and friends of My Greek Table. All funds will be used toward the actual production of the series and all contributions, remember -- tax-deductible, will be recognized by name in a special place on the series’ website. The largest contributors will be broadcast in the show's credits.

The intrinsic value of the show, its success in raising awareness about Greece, in making healthy Mediterranean-Greek eating and cooking more accessible, its fan base and viewers' comments are the foundations upon which this IndieGoGo campaign is built. We are almost there!

Thank you so much for supporting us, Welcome to My Greek Table, and enjoy the journey to Greece the series invites you to join.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute but still want to help, please do, by sending this to as many friends and philhellenes as possible.

story:
I am Philip Johnson— the CEO of Philaye Films and the Showrunner (plus Lead Actor, Head Writer, etc.) for Flip Flop TV Show. Flip Flop is a half-hour length comedy TV show that we are shopping around to networks here in Hollywood. 

Logline: When a pro track athlete’s techno-conversion therapy chip implanted in him 16 years ago malfunctions, he must face the world with a flip-flopping sexuality. 

Track. Comedy. Sci-Fi. Sexuality. All in one.

THE PURPOSE of this campaign is to raise $60,000 to continue production past our pilot episode that we have shot and are currently screening. Because TV executives want to see evidence of AUDIENCE and products with monetary value, we successfully raised $10,000 for the pilot episode we completed, and are now looking to produce 6 more episodes to complete a 7-episode Season 1 package.

Flip Flop is currently on a US tour! Click here to RSVP. Pilot screening premieres are scheduled in NYC, Detroit, Atlanta & LA. From Black Sex & The City now to Flip Flop, Philaye Films’ fanbase has reached tens of thousands across the country and globe.

The world does not have enough fresh, inter-sectional TV content. Flip Flop dynamically combines sports, LGBTQ conversations, comedy, futuristic technology and black culture to create an undeniably entertaining experience on-screen.

We have developed the show for all of 2019, and this is only the beginning! With big names like Dallas “Flashman” Wade who has appeared on Catfish & America’s Next Top Model, Flip Flop has gained more and more buzz.

This Indiegogo campaign will provide the extra buzz necessary to take Flip Flop over the top. Through raising $60,000 and producing the entire ground-breaking Season 1 on our own, we will demonstrate our expertise and monetary value to TV executives and big investors.

With your help, Flip Flop will be the next big TV show inspiring millions of creators and viewers across the world facing 21st century identity battles!
story_txt:
I am Philip Johnson— the CEO of Philaye Films and the Showrunner (plus Lead Actor, Head Writer, etc.) for Flip Flop TV Show. Flip Flop is a half-hour length comedy TV show that we are shopping around to networks here in Hollywood. 
Logline: When a pro track athlete’s techno-conversion therapy chip implanted in him 16 years ago malfunctions, he must face the world with a flip-flopping sexuality. 
Track. Comedy. Sci-Fi. Sexuality. All in one.
THE PURPOSE of this campaign is to raise $60,000 to continue production past our pilot episode that we have shot and are currently screening. Because TV executives want to see evidence of AUDIENCE and products with monetary value, we successfully raised $10,000 for the pilot episode we completed, and are now looking to produce 6 more episodes to complete a 7-episode Season 1 package.

story:
Intro

Hi, my name is Sam and I'm a world traveller. In my 25 years on the planet thus far I have been to 28 countries, and lived in China for 4 years. I now have friends spread all across the globe, and I hope to share my travel wisdom with you, as well as the best local places as chosen by the people who live there. 

 

So here's the show(s)

It's a Travel Show

Large Emphasis on Food

Focuses on countries where I have friends, so that we can show the most authentic, unknown, and underground places. None of that touristy shit. The aim of this show is to show authentic portraits of people and places around the world.

There will actually be two shows, the TV Show "Sam Presents the World", and Sam Presents BTS (Behind the scenes) a youtube series that will follow the creation process from beginning to end. This will be a fun show on its own and the best possible resource for aspiring filmmakers.

Meet the Team

Sam Griffin- Creator and Host

 

Alex Killian- Cinematographer 

Denver based Creator/Filmmaker/Actor. Film lives in my blood.

 

 

Here is how your money will be spent

Transportation

Equipment

Film and Editing Costs

Ocasional Accommodation

Daily Diamond Allowance 

Food

Music Rights

Distrubition

 

The Impact

Job Creation

​This project will create multiple jobs and give those jobs to highly talented individuals whose talent has not yet been commercially validated.This includes filmmakers, presenters, and musicians. Basically my goal is to bring as many people up with me as possible.

Education

This show goes beyond stereotypes, and shows how people actually live around the world. We will be visiting some countries that you may not have even heard of, much less know where they are, what they look like, and what foods they eat. We promise to show foods and cuisines that have never before been shown on American television. I believe I am in a unique position to host this show due to my depth of travel experience and my connections around the world. Our behind the scenes show will also be the best possible resource for aspiring filmmakers. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

For real we just need money, but sharing this page is helpful as well

Also we will reward you for sharing the campaign, when your friends have contributed $50 or more you will get a $5 Amazon Gift Card, $500 or more for a $50 Amazon Gift Card, and $5000 or more for a $500 Amazon Gift Card. You must use the Indiegogo sharing tools on the top of this page to qualify for this promotion. You can check your referrals through your Indiegogo profile.

story:
Short Summary

Just a quick note before the Summary, we have set our flexible goal at $25,000 just as a milestone. We actually need more than that. We not only want to finish our first series but begin production on series 2 and that means mucho $’s. You’re help and support is greatly needed and profoundly appreciated.

By way of introduction, I'm Kelly Monteith. Some of you might remember me from my over 40 appearances on the Tonight Show with Johnny Carson and Jay Leno, as well as my appearances on David Letterman and a host of other talk shows. Additionally, I had a summer show on CBS, a syndicated clip show and a sitcom on the BBC in the UK that I created and wrote on and that ran for 6 years. 

This campaign is to complete my latest project, a scripted-reality show called, 'The Real Geezers of Beverly Hills -- Adjacent', which I created and wrote. We have 6 episodes nearly completed and I, along with my Cinematographer/Director Paul Boland, are very happy and excited by what we have thus far. We are so very close to completing the 5th and 6th episodes and with your help and support, we can do that.

We have what we consider to be a unique and very funny comedy web series whose appeal would cross all demographics. Our plan is to immediately start on web series two with the possibility of expanding it to a half hour and submitting it to a streaming service. Any contribution could make this a reality.

What We Need & What You Get

We have set our flexible goal of 25K. This will help us pay our cast and crew, fund locations, additional props, equipment, music, transportation, as well as editing and sound design. 

We have some exciting and unique perks that we're happy to provide for those who contribute, from basic shout outs on social media to cups and t-shirts with The Real Geezers of Beverly Hills -- Adjacent logo, the end and beginning credits for substantial contributions. 

If we don't reach our goal, any funds received will go to finishing and launching the first 6 episodes of the web series. Our goal is to offer it on Amazon at a reasonable price which will reach the US, UK, Germany, and Japan. The funds will allow us to subtitle the episodes for those non-English speaking countries. 

The Impact

Our series is unique in that it uses the format of a reality show with the power of scripted comedy. We've taken time and work to make sure each episode stands on its own and delivers the laughs. Though it's titled 'The Real Geezer', there are younger millennials in it in the character of my son and his surfer friend. More Geezers and millennials will follow in future episodes. This is not about older people in a home, but ones still functioning and working in the world. It also reaches an untouched market in those older folks still working and contributing.

Having created and written 6 years of a ground-breaking sitcom in the UK, I am well qualified to write and produce a comedy show. I continue to work as a stand-up comedian and working internationally spending the last three winters working out of Australia to predominately Australian and New Zealand audience. That also opens up an international market for our show. 

Our show has very good production values which your contributions will help maintain. 

  Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

Of course, no project comes without a measure of risk and worry as to the reception it receives, either critically or from the viewing audience. We are well aware of that and are taking every stop to make sure it is received well without compromising our integrity.

As one who's been a comedian for many, many years, you can never be 100% sure that a joke will work. Nor can you ever be completely sure of either critical acclaim or censure. All we can do is to put everything we have into our product, be confident we're doing the best we can comedically and put it out to the public and trust our instincts.

Other Ways You Can Help

We realize from personal experience that you're not always in a position to contribute anything. In that case, you can help by getting the word out to your friends and family about our campaign by using the IndieGoGo share tools.

If you wish to donate but don't want to go through Indiegogo, you can always use my PayPal account at therealgeezrsofbeverlyhillsadj@gmail.com or just send me a check. You can always contact me at that email address. 

I sincerely thank you for your attention and we would appreciate any help you can give. You would be a part of our team in bringing what we consider a very funny and unique web series, The Real Geezers of Beverly Hills --- Adjacent!

story:
This web series follows the BROKEN HEARTS DIVISION, an under-funded division created by the LAPD for goodwill in the community.

The department is spear-headed by Officer Mackenzie Merriweather.  Mack has had an awful love life and as such is the perfect cop to head this department.  She's a loose canon so the department assigns her Internal Affairs officer, Brad Honeycut (played by Andy Milder of Weeds) a by-the-book bureaucrat.

The BHD gets no respect by top brass, gets housed in the LAPD Janitor's Closet and shares 'office space' with Jerry The Janitor.

Each episode follows a new case while Officer Merriweather tracks the infamous Serial Dater. 

The cases for SEASON ONE: 

With the Season Finale revealing the Identity of the Serial Dater!

This is a labor of love for Showrunner Nicole Feenstra.  Having conceived of this show after years of heartbreak she felt like 2017 was the year to bring the show to life.  

Inspired by “The Broken Windows Theory,” Mack finds that the answer is simple: 

Handle the small crimes to prevent the big crimes.

How we act in the affairs of the heart affects not only ourselves but everyone we encounter. 

The Official Trailer

Nicole Feenstra / CREATOR & EXECUTIVE PRODUCER – Nicole Feenstra's work has won awards at ITVFest, Rome International Festival, First Glance Philadelphia and Shriekfest.  She starred and wrote in the long running Improv Olympic show, "Big News" and has worked in advertising for years on campaigns for POM Wonderful, Neutrogena and Chrysler. This is her first project as Showrunner.

Scott Rodgers / DIRECTOR – Scott's first directing feature, THE DRAMATICS (A COMEDY) was acquired and distributed by The Orchard. Scott directs the award winning improvised play THE BLIND DATE PROJECT, directing countless amazing actors including Margot Robbie, Joel Edgerton, Emmy Rossum to name a few. His acting credits include: THE MASTER, KEY&PEELE and MARRIED(FX).

Matt Miller / EXECUTIVE PRODUCER - Matt has worked on over 100 film and television productions on both the studio and independent levels in addition to over 50 commercials and music videos.  In 2010 Matt co-founded the independent film and commercial production company, Vanishing Angle. Recent company credits include: Distribution of TOO LATE, starring Academy Award nominee John Hawkes. The Grief of Others, which world premiered in competition at SXSW, premiered internationally at the Cannes Film Festival; Amira & Sam, released theatrically by Drafthouse Films.

Raphe Wolfgang / LINE PRODUCER – Raphe is a filmmaker with talents spanning all aspects of the process. In addition to Producing various projects, he has Directed award winning short films, commercials, and music videos.  Raphe recently worked on OSCAR MIKE(Verizon Go90) and received an Emmy Award for the digital series EMMA APPROVED (Pemberly Digital). 

Seth Johnson / DIRECTOR OF PHOTOGRAPHY - Seth graduated from the American Film Institute in 2007.   His latest feature, DEADLY EXPOSE, was produced for Lifetime. He’s also shot for National Geographic and Discovery International. His commercial credits include Mitsubishi, Playboy, NordicTrack, iFit, and Hennessey Motors.

Andy Milder / BRAD HONEYCUT– Andy is known for playing ‘Dean Hodes’ on the Showtime show, ‘Weeds’, where he garnered two Screen Actor Guild Award nominations with the cast as Outstanding Performance by an Ensemble/ Comedy.  He is also known more recently for his work in Bones,  Rizzoli and Isles, Grey’s Anatomy, NCIS, Masters of Sex and Criminal Minds to name a few.

Ryan Mirvis / JERRY THE JANITOR –  Ryan "Mirv" Mirvis is an actor and stand up comedian, working at UCB, Comedy Store and The Improv.  You may recognize him from the images above. He will also be seen on Chuck Lorre's new Netflix sitcom, "Disjointed."  You may recognize him as a Viking from Capital One or from that time his Tinder profile went viral.

Rusty Dunn / SOUND – Rusty’s work as a sound designer/editor, dialogue/ADR editor and re-recording mixer is extensive.  He currently works with the NFL and other recognizable credits include: Notorious, Parks and Rec, Dragon Ball Z, Empire, The Girl Next Door and the recent Netflix series, ‘Love’.  He is a sound story teller, identifying as a conductor of layers and sonics.

Roy Shakked / MUSIC  - Roy Shakked is a Los Angeles based album producer and composer. His music has been featured in Sex and The City, Nip/Tick, Independent Lens and CSI Miami.  He has worked with Nissan Motors, Universal Pictures, Einstein Brothers Bagels and Toyota to name a few – and has contributed cues and songs to a host of movies including Poseidon, Day Zero and The Devil Wears Prada. 

Miriam Hoffman / CASTING - Miriam Hoffman began her career in Casting with the Feature Film "Night at the Museum." She had previously worked at the William Morris Agency as the Coordinator for the Reality Based TV and Packaging Department and at 20th Television in Development. This past fall Miriam just wrapped up casting the 7th and final season of "Workaholics" and getting ready to cast a film for Netflix next year. 

Having self-financed the pilot on a shoe-string budget, Producer Nicole Feenstra  knows how to make money stretch but she also believes it’s important to pay everyone for their talent.  This money goes to all the hard working men and women both in front and behind the camera who make all the magic happen.  It takes a village and the funding goes to paying that village. 

 

In a time, when so many BIG THINGS are happening, you may ask yourself WHY THIS PROJECT?  Well, during troubling times we need to laugh.  During crazy times we need perspective.  During …all the time – we want love.  This project brings all of that. 

PLUS, if you’ve ever thought – I want more women to have a seat at the table of story-telling – THIS IS YOUR CHANCE TO BE PART OF THAT. The majority of projects in Hollywood are helmed or led by men.  This is a female voice and a female vision emboldened with a wildly talented cast and crew of men and women.

story:
About The Lost Weekend

The Lost Weekend is a scripted comedy based on the experiences of its creators/stars in the not-so-glamorous world of a struggling indie rock band. The show was conceptualized by four lifelong friends (Alex Knight, Andrew Knight, Chris Kutsor, and Jeff Mitchell) and pulls largely from their real-world experience as members of a nationally touring pop/rock act.

After spending their teen years in local bands, the group caught the attention of the music industry with a self-released EP. They then spent the next several years touring the nation at the mercy of the highs and lows of the volatile music industry, while also navigating relationships and the uncertainty that comes with attaching your career aspirations to those of your best friends.

After discovering a passion for comedic storytelling and being inspired by the DIY approach of shows and filmmakers such as It’s Always Sunny in Philadelphia, Broad City, and the Duplass brothers, the guys realized that the insanity of trying to make it as a musician was a goldmine of ridiculous situations and emotional complexities. They turned their own DIY background to short filmmaking and simultaneously began mentorships with experienced TV writers in their Orlando home to flesh out the concept for The Lost Weekend.

The creators write, produce, direct, edit, act in, and write music for their web shorts that have been featured everywhere from Chorus.fm to the Orlando Film Festival, and have now developed a vision to take their passion project and remarkable drive to the small screen.

What is the project timeline?

We are shooting the pilot throughout Feb-Apr 2018, and we expect to have a finished product by end of summer 2018.

What are the contributions going towards?

Your contributions will go towards...

  • Production design
  • Props
  • Insurance
  • Equipment rentals
  • Catering
  • Wardrobe
  • + much more!

Disclaimers

Contributions do not entitle anyone to ownership stakes

After discovering a passion for comedic storytelling and being inspired by the DIY approach of shows and filmmakers such as It’s Always Sunny in Philadelphia, Broad City, and the Duplass brothers, the guys realized that the insanity of trying to make it as a musician was a goldmine of ridiculous situations and emotional complexities. They turned their own DIY background to short filmmaking and simultaneously began mentorships with experienced TV writers in their Orlando home to flesh out the concept for The Lost Weekend.
The creators write, produce, direct, edit, act in, and write music for their web shorts that have been featured everywhere from Chorus.fm to the Orlando Film Festival, and have now developed a vision to take their passion project and remarkable drive to the small screen.
What is the project timeline?
We are shooting the pilot throughout Feb-Apr 2018, and we expect to have a finished product by end of summer 2018.

What are the contributions going towards?
Your contributions will go towards...

Production design
Props
Insurance
Equipment rentals
Catering
Wardrobe
+ much more!


Disclaimers
Contributions do not entitle anyone to ownership stakes

story:
Crowned Productions is an independent L.A. based production house, specializing in creating media fit for royalty.

Crowned Productions is comprised of indie filmmakers, Sharice Bryant and Bri Noreen, who have a passion for film, television and other visual media, and a desire to tell stories of today. As visionaries, we believe it’s up to our generation to create magic that we wish to see. 

We’re dedicated to producing engaging visuals of the highest quality and collaborating with other visionaries to help bring their visions to life. 

In the times we are in now, entertainment executives are looking to reproduce classics, when there are so many new stories out there. Funding this campaign would allow fresh voices to be heard and showcase different perspectives, unique storylines and relatable narratives. 

Contributing to this campaign will help two young, minority filmmakers execute their vision, that we believe is a catalyst for creative change in entertainment.  

 

About Friendzoned

After unconsciously placing his college friend, Peyton in the friendzone,
Jaxson goes after a new neighbor, Emery, only to find himself in the same place.
Having never faced rejection or the friendzone before, he enlist the help of Peyton
and his frat brother, Chase, to get him back in the game with Emery. Comedy ensues
as the friends face the different levels of the friendzone and its complications. 


The friendzone is a place that no one ever wants to find themselves in but often times
it’s unavoidable. For someone who isn’t used to being placed in the dreaded
category, it can seems awkward and infuriating, and Friendzoned explores those
feelings and situations.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We're in need of $10,000 to finish season 1 of Friendzoned. We have paid out of pocket to produce the first 6 episodes of the series and hope to finish this season with a bang. 

What donation funds would help

-Paying the Crew: Cinematographer, 1st A.C, Gaffer, Boom Operator, Makeup Artist, Editor, Sound Designer

-Paying the Talent: We have only been able to offer our cast credit, copy, meal for this project. We would like to pay them for their hard work. 

-Fundamentals: Set design, props, catering, wardrobe, equipment rentals, marketing/promotion, post-production hardware, etc. 

Perks include branded apparel, social media shout outs, special thanks in rolling credits and more!

If we do not meet our goal, we would still use the funds towards the project. 

The Impact

  • Contributing to this campaign will show the world that women are capable of running the show. It will dispel the notion that we only belong in front of the camera. #thefutureisfemale

Other Ways You Can Help

Promote the campaign, follow us on social media, share, repost, tag your friends/family who might be interested in the project/campaign

Instagram: @getcrowned_ent

Twitter: @getcrowned_ent

Facebook: Crowned Productions

story:
Short Summary

Making a season of Provo's Most Eligible takes a lot of work. It can be especially challenging as the creators and producers of the show are attending school, raising families, and working full time jobs. Unfortunately we don't get enough views on YouTube to do this full time and the money from events last season went to pay back those who spent money out of their pocket for the production. We need a little help this season so that we can dedicate more time to the show without losing money.

What We Need & What You Get

Any money we raise will go to funding dates, equipment, various crew members who provide lighting and audio equipment, and the producers. We are looking to raise $25,000.

There are several perks based on how much you donate. Including tickets to events, PME merchandise, and even a spot in the show!

The Impact

We are very proud of what we have created with Provo's Most Eligible, and now you can be a part of the creation.

  • Bring people together who would normally never have met and build lifelong friendships and relationships.
  • Create and continue to build a community of creators and fans.
  • Provide once in a lifetime experiences, not just for those participating in those show but for everyone watching and following the drama at home with friends.
  • Help people find their eternal companions.
  • Create endless hours of cringey entertainment.
  • Be a part of something memorable and impactful in Latter Day Saint and Provo culture, something that might not happen ever again.

Risks & Challenges

Making season two was very hard on a lot of people involved in the creation, we loved doing it, but unfortunately we are in school and our studies and grades suffered as a result of the many hours dedicated. Editing alone takes more than 40 hours a week to get it released on time, and the industry professionals who volunteered their time gave up other work for the show. We are doing this to open up more time for us to dedicate to PME while also not negatively impacting our school work and finances.

  • We have two successful seasons under our belt so we know what we are doing, and we know that we can make a good show.
  • With the money raised from this campaign we will know going into this season that we will have enough to cover expenses and make it worth it for those sacrificing their time and equipment to this project.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the word about our campaign! Use the Indiegogo tools to share with friends and family.
  • Message the PME instagram page or on our website with businesses who want to work with us for free.
  • Join our crew and become a PME intern or suggest people you know to be a part of the show who can offer services!
  • Tell all your rich relatives who have nothing else to do to donate:)

story:
OUR PROJECT

No Rest For The Wicked is a horror thriller series about a young man plagued by the ghosts of his past, returning to hometown where a serial killer ran loose, Kit reconnects with friends and family. Unfortunately his return sparks a new series of killings that patterns the previous Ripper. In order to survive they must uncover the secrets and mysteries of this small town while they are picked off one by one. 

ABOUT US AND WHO WE ARE 

Still tuning in? Awesome! Glad to still have you here. Little bit of background on who we are, we're a writing duo. Kenneth & James, originally from New York, we met in college, and showed an equal passion in horror films. 

What we have here is a lovely horror story, that we all love, which will feature, violence, strong language, adult content and the occasional comedy relief. True it is a horror story, but it is not so much about the people of the town but more so about the dark secrets lurking in the under belly of this town.

But what is horror nowadays? We’ve seen it all from, zombies, aliens, serial killers, vampires, werewolves and killer ghost girls. The purpose of this show is to attempt to break the bounds of those stereotypes and to not necessarily come up with something new, but more so, something interesting.

Our main goal is to take the concept of “Scream” and “Halloween” and sort of blend both those incredible stories, minus the ending into something spectacular. We want to take that movie theater fear, that was on the big screen and introduce that on the small screen. Is it original? Not so much. Creative? We think so, but only time will tell on that front.

We’re writing this show for the inner horror movie geek that resides inside of us. We’re writing this with the intention to show the audiences a sort of mini horror film once a week. We’re also writing this because we want to reintroduce the world to actual horror, and not the torture porn the audiences have come to know nowadays.

Let’s be honest here the horror genre is a dying genre. The tumor is growing, and it’s just waiting for two things, someone to come put a bullet in it’s head, and finally put it out it’s misery or for some lucky bastard to come on by and give it new breath of life.

What We Need & What You Get

Your contributions will enable us to cover the bulk of production and post-production costs for our pilot, such as PPE for Covid safety, meals, costumes, props, set design elements, shooting permits, sound mixing, and special effects. We value your contributions highly, which is we are offering cool perks like, Executive Producer, A signed script from the cast and crew, Producer, and an invitation to the first two episode premiere. And many, many more fun perks!

 

OUR PLAN AND ULTIMATE GOAL!

We are currently in pre-production. Production is slated to start in the spring/summer. We aim to finish post-production by the fall, at which point we will screen the finished pilot at our Virtual Premiere Party (see perks).

Next, we will prepare to pitch the series to buyers, with an eye on streaming platforms. If we don't successfully sell our series in 2021, our plan is to enter our pilot into TV festivals like SeriesFest and Catalyst Content Festival, as well as the episodic categories of festivals like Sundance, TIFF, SXSW, and Tribeca, to help it pick up the necessary steam to catch a different buyer's eye or help us finance, shoot, and release the entire No Rest For The Wicked series ourselves.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're interested in No Rest For The Wicked but can't financially contribute at this time, you can still help us by getting the word out; just use Indiegogo's social media share tools, follow us on twitter @trinityproductions, or tell a friend about our campaign.

With every episode also, one or more main character will unfortunately be killed off in a horrific fashion until the finale when there is only one left standing.

So yes, this is basically like a 15-hour horror film about life, about trauma, about love and loss, and some heartbreak, but hopefully you’ll enjoy the ride.

Thanks for reading and may the force be with you.

story:
In 2015, Erika Rose began drawing Tiny Fros by E. RoseTM as a study to get back into cartooning and it quickly developed into a brand all on its own. With the help of a few inspirational words, Erika's illustrations transformed into a persona that gave advice on navigating life as a millennial adult. With over 400 posts on Instagram (IG) and Facebook (FB), @Tinyfros has been a source for motivation and affirmation for the past 5 years. Now, we'd like to take it up a notch and create an animated series!

 

 

Erika Rose - Creator, Illustrator, Animator, Writer

Erika is a visual artist from Virginia currently residing in California. ​During the day she works as a Creative Manager and Designer and by night an illustrator and animator. She attended James Madison University to study Computer Animation and Savannah College of Art & Design for Design Management​. Erika is passionate about creating art that is entertaining and inspiring. Thus, Tiny Fros was born.

 

LaToya “Lyndre” Ransom - Voice Over Coordinator, Writer, Copy Editor

Born in New York and raised in South Carolina, LaToya is a middle-school English teacher during the day; and by night, she’s a singer/voiceover artist. She is a Hampton and Howard University alumna with a focus in Journalism/Communications. LaToya has been able to use her love of the English language, music, and voice-over acting to bring the Tiny Fros world and characters to life.

 

Michael Frempong – Writer, Marketing/Production Assistant

Michael is a DC area native and an alumnus of James Madison University. He works as an Instructional Systems Designer by day and pursues his creative interests, which include but aren’t limited to screenwriting, at night.  From developing quick skits for talent and step show routines to writing plays in church as a kid, his passion for tv and film help him lend his perspective to the Tiny Fros world.

 

 

TINY FROS: THE WEB SERIES is a spin-off of the brand that delves deeper into the life of the main character, Frolana. A 30-something Black woman doing what many millennials can relate to—simply trying to “figure [this life] shit out.”

The first adult animated web-series about a black woman created by a black woman, Tiny Fros: The Web Series, is a millennial dramedy about life. Real-life, just animated.  Watch as Frolana helps her clients manage their personal wellness while dealing with her own relationship issues, career struggles, and bouts of impostor syndrome, not realizing she has what it takes to survive adulthood.

 

Donate. Like, Comment, Share, and Subscribe!

TINY FROS: THE WEB SERIES is produced by three friends and we need your help!
Your donation supports...

  • Talent & Production
    • Voice Actors
    • Animators
    • Musicians
    • Production Artists
    • Writers
  • Promotion & Distribution
  • Black Content Creation

story:
OUR HOPES

Civil Disobedience Series will strive to generate discussion around a wide range of topics, with the hopes to unify people and make them aware of the plight of others, to ultimately spread understanding and tolerance.

You can be a part of this exciting series with a contribution from $10 to $1,000 and get benefits from producing credits, membership to our private test group, early links to the films and much more.

 

OUR PRODUCERS

 

OUR PRODUCTION TEAM

Jen Hook (Director of Photography), Jaimie Beebe (Casting Director), Scottie Simerly Jr (Editor / Director), Karina Farah (UPM / AD), Edith Raya (Costume Designer), Mark Davis (CFO), Hilary van Rooyen (2nd AD), Shirley Do (Makeup / Hair), Jessie West (Script Supervisor), Mark Cardone (Camera Operator), Michael Lockett (Graphic Designer / Director), Robert Stronger (Sound Mixer). Not pictured: Christina C. Brown (Art Director), Conor Soules (Gaffer), Elina Madison (Set Dresser)

 

THE WRITERS

Season one is composed of scripts from creator, Deon van Rooyen (The Samaritan, Trauma, Perspective), from producer/director, Linda Palmer (Registration) and from our script contest winners, Janki Parehk & Naman Gupta (Groomstick), as well as one of our script contest options, Manny Rey (Atone).  

                                          

We are currently running our second script contest where a winner will be chosen and produced in Season 2 and we will option an additional 4 scripts.  For information on entering the contest visit our website here:  2021 Civil Disobedience Script Contest

 

THE STORIES

We are filming a portion of "The Samaritan", "Trauma" and "Perspective" February 27, 2021 with prior funding raised and will finish the remaining episodes as funding becomes available.  Each story is a short film that will be entered into film festivals for approximately three months, hoping to garner recognition, and then be placed in a 30 minute TV talk show format with hosts starting a conversation with guests about the topic.  

 

                                      

 

The stories were written and will be directed by the following team members and star the attached actors:

THE SAMARITAN (Written and Directed by Deon van Rooyen)

 

TRAUMA (Written and Directed by Deon van Rooyen)

 

PERSPECTIVE (Written by Deon van Rooyen | Directed by Michael Lockett)

 

REGISTRATION (Written and Directed by Linda Palmer)

 

GROOMSTICK (Written by Janki Parekh & Naman Gupta and Directed by Naman Gupta)

 

ATONE (Written by Manny Rey and Directed by Scottie Simerly Jr)

 

OUR BUDGET

We have budgeted $100,000 for the series of six short films to be produced over 8 days.  The money is made up of our own investment in the project, investment from others, grants, and our crowdfunding campaign.  It will go toward the following departments in these approximate percentages.

 

OTHER WAYS TO HELP US

Even if you can't afford to contribute to our project, but you still want to help, sharing our campaign is super helpful to us.  We need to expand our base of people that know about what we're doing and everyone that helps share our message with their friends, significantly helps us. So thank you in advance for posting to your social media or talking to your friends about our Civil Disobedience Series.

story:
I'm making a TV show that you didn't know you needed until now!
 

Who am I

I'm Jenny Formica. I'm an actor (I know, gross)...well...trying to be an actor, at least. I've been pursuing acting professionally for 8 years, but my resume looks like I just started. Now I'm closer to 30 than 20,  which in Hollywood women years, I might as well be 70 . "You're still young." "It's just a matter of time." "You're so unique! I'm sure you get work, constantly." And  at 19, I thought all of those things too, but here I am and here you are. 

But I'm not just an actor, I'm also an LGBTQ+ redheaded writer. Growing up as pale, natural redhead in a family and school of brunettes and blondes, life was...interesting. Strangers would grab my hair when I was just a toddler and my parents had to push them off. Kids teased me, which later just became full on aggressive bullying. If I saw another redhead (which was rare) we were either told we had to be related, or we gravitated towards each other naturally to share stories. Adults told me my hair was beautiful, kids said the opposite. When I turned on the TV as a kid, I never saw me.  My representation was a cartoon mermaid, a cartoon seductress, a cartoon crime fighting cheerleader. Always cartoons, never real people and it's still the same way today! In 2021!

"But Lucille Ball is a redhead."

PAUSE
Let's get some things clarified here.

1. Lucille Ball was not a redhead. She dyed her hair red. Those two things are VERY different.

2. Lucille Ball starred on a BLACK AND WHITE television show.

3. If your go to reference for a famous, leading lady redhead on television is from 1955...Well, that just proves my point. 

UNPAUSE

So why does this matter?

Well, let me tell you, random person who has gotten this far. It matters because I'm here to change that. I'm here to fix the lack of natural redheads in television. No more "redheads are too distracting" and "your skin tone isn't right." I'm here to put us front and center and make you laugh while doing it. 

A little over three years ago I started writing a tv pilot about a family of redheads. Well, three years and 20+ revisions later and the "family of redheads" is now one redhead, Jessie Fisher - a 27 year old in the midst of an identify quarter-life-crisis, who begins writing letters to her childhood redheaded hero, Julianne Moore in order to discover who she is.

We have so many shows about teens, so many shows about parents and so many shows about zombies and apocalypses, but where are the shows about the people who are nearing 30 and don't have a career or a family? Who are still trying to find themselves and haven't "come of age" yet. The people who go online and see their friends getting married and their old bullies getting promoted, but they're still just trying to find where they fit! 

This is where YOU come in!

Trying to sell a show to a network is a lot of work. And while, yes, I have a dang good pilot and pitch presentation, I want to make something more to help sell my show. I want to make a trailer. A "Dear Julianne Moore," sneak peak, if you will. But to do this, I need a crew and locations...which, in case you didn't know, those things cost a nice chunk of change...and like I said...I'm an unemployed actor. So, with all of that said, if I have convinced you that this is the show that your binge watching needs, and you feel inspired to help this little ol' pale redhead make a tv show, I'd be greatly appreciative of ANY donation. Seriously. $1. $10. $1000. etc... it doesn't matter. It's one more dollar I get to put towards ACTUALLY making this happen and I want to be able to pay the people who help me make it happen.

What you'll get in return

For every level you reach (depending how much you donate) you'll get something special!
$10 - an autographed photo. 
$20 - An autographed DVD of the trailer
$30-$149 - An autographed headshot AND an autographed DVD

$150 + - All of the above AND I will advertise your business with PRODUCT PLACEMENT! I will contact you to discuss the details about how to incorporate your business into one of my scenes. 

Other Ways You Can Help

SHARE THIS WITH EVERYONE YOU KNOW

story:
Who Are We?

My name is Tiffany Carlson and I am the writer, co-director, and star of Save Room for Dessert, the web series. I created this show with the help of my best friend Halee Pierog. For those of you who don't know, Save Room for Dessert is very, VERY loosely based on our real lives!

If you haven't seen Season One yet (which you probably should!), it is a short, comedic web series that follows the life of a young baking-vlog rookie, Annie, who, due to financial reasons, is forced to move into a house with her best friend, her ex-boyfriend, and a mysterious introvert.

We filmed and released our first 8 episodes season completely financing them out of our own pocket. They were released on a weekly basis on YouTube making them free for everyone to enjoy! Now the time has come, after many enthusiastic comments and reviews about the show, we have decided to create Season Two! 

But this time we want to go BIGGER! We have some fun, unique ideas we are working on but in order to bring you the Season Two you deserve, we are going to need a little help.

 

The Team

Tiffany Carlson met Halee Pierog in College in 2011 and have been friends ever since. After graduating, Tiffany moved to Toronto to continue her film acting education, leaving Halee to follow her there a couple years later. Together they developed the plot line for Save Room for Dessert!

But they could never have made the show as successful without their amazing Cast & Crew, mainly consisting of fellow graduates Tiffany studied with at the Toronto Film School! Many of the cast and crew members played various roles both behind and in front of the camera.

 

What We Need 

In order to create Season Two, we need to raise $5500.

Season One was made on almost no money. The equipment used was generously lent from cast and crew members otherwise, all food and props were purchased by the director/ creators. Though we would love to be able to do that for Season Two, it is not financially possible. 

Our budget breakdown is simple:

  • $3000: Upgrading Equipment. In order to make Season Two look, sound, and feel that much more amazing, we really want to upgrade some of our equipment and get better mics and lights and hopefully allow everything to run smoother.
  • $600: Craft Services (Food and Beverage). Most shoot days last around 10-12 hours long. We provide our cast and crew with lunch, dinner, and snack breaks. We will hopefully be creating another 8 episode season, which means roughly 8 days shooting. That's a lot of cheese and crackers.
  • $600: Marketing. We really want to spread the word of Save Room for Dessert so everyone can enjoy it! If we can get $600 towards marketing, we will be able to cover the cost to submit to different Film Festivals which typically have an admission fee varying around $80- $120. That would also help cover the cost of different types of advertisements so that we can share Save Room for Dessert across as many mediums as possible!
  • $500: Post-Production (editing subscription, music rights). It's important that after we have put in all that hard work and completed the filming portion, we turn it over to our talented editor who has the programs to make our project look it's best! 
  • $800: Props, Locations, Accidentals. Things always happen when working on set and we want to make sure we're covered in case any challenges may arise. 

 

What You Get

If the simple fact of knowing you helped make Season Two a possibility isn't enough for you... DON'T WORRY we have more in store! There are several perks you can receive if you help contribute to Save Room for Dessert, Season Two:

  • Social Media Shout out!
  • Special Thanks Credit
  • Personalized Video from a cast member
  • Autographed Poster by the cast
  • Exclusive "Whip It Good" show access
  • Name Drop in an Episode of Season Two!
  • Executive Producer Credit
  • Walk on Role

 

The Impact

Because this series is [loosely] based on the creators real lives, it makes the experiences and situations the characters go through feel very real and relatable. It is both funny and serious. It has it's ups and downs just like in real life and as the viewer, all you can do is sit back and hope the characters make the right choices. We tackle real problems and offer different solutions to those problems, which helps bring people together and shows that you are not alone. You are not the only person who feels this way or has to deal with these types of situations.

 

Risks and Challenges

When creating your own content, there is always the risk that something will go wrong on set that you won't be able to fix either immediately or in post. We experienced a lot of these challenges during the making of Season One and were always able to find a way around it, so I am certain we will be able to do it again. It is a skill that we have become quite mastered at. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to support Save Room for Dessert, but don't have the financial capabilities to donate, you can still help us tremendously by SUBSCRIBING to our YouTube Channel and liking our videos.

You can also help spread the word! Let others know about Save Room for Dessert and our Indiegogo!

Follow us on Instagram, Facebook , and Twitter. You can also check out our new Website.

 

Thank you so much for your contributions and thank you for reading all of our proposal! We look forward to bringing you a FANTASTIC Season Two!
